The user can "swim" through dirt, earth, and solid rock at great speed, perceiving their surroundings through seismic vibrations. This ability can be used for a total of 10 minutes per day, which can be broken up into shorter increments.

Rarity: Rare

Appearance: A pair of sleek, form-fitting greaves made from dark, supple leather, reinforced with plates of lightweight, polished steel etched with swirling wind patterns. They hum with a faint, barely perceptible vibration.

During this fourth jump, while in mid-air, they can manifest a temporary, invisible foothold of solid force beneath their feet, allowing them to kick off and launch themselves a second time in any direction. The count then resets.

The wearer can only have one Spore Servant at a time. Creating a new one causes the previous servant to instantly collapse into a pile of inert fungal dust.

The mask's surface subtly shifts in color and texture, providing a powerful natural camouflage that allows them to blend into their surroundings. The charge is unleashed in its entirety with their next physical attack made from this concealed state, striking with devastating, supernaturally amplified force. Once the attack is made, or if the wearer moves or is observed, the charge is lost.

437. Crown of the Naked King

The target is magically compelled to obey the command to the best of their ability. There is no limit to how often commands can be given.

Rarity: Legendary

Appearance: A single, flawless gold coin, ancient and bearing the profile of a majestic dragon, suspended from a heavy gold chain. The coin radiates a palpable aura of possessiveness and feels warm, almost hot, when near other treasures.

A small hoard provides a minor boost, while a dragon's treasure trove grants immense power. Additionally, any creature that knowingly steals an item belonging to the wearer is afflicted with a potent curse. They begin to suffer from a persistent, growing nausea that intensifies the longer they possess the stolen item and the farther they move from its rightful owner. The only way to end the affliction is to return the item to its proper place.

440. Helm of Vigilance

Rarity: Uncommon

Appearance: A full-faced steel helmet of a simple, functional design. It is well-maintained but shows the minor dents and scratches of long service. The visor has a single, wide slit, offering a broad field of view.

441. Trickster's Hat

Rarity: Legendary

Appearance: A flamboyant, wide-brimmed hat of deep purple velvet, adorned with a long, iridescent feather from an unknown bird that subtly changes color. The hat is slightly crumpled, as if from countless adventures and narrow escapes.

Effect: Twice per day, the wearer can focus on a single creature (including themself) and perceive all active magical effects upon them as a clear, mental text. The wearer may then choose one of these effects and surgically alter a single word within its description, fundamentally changing the spell's nature. For instance, a "crippling curse" could become a "crippling blessing," or a "wall of fire" could become a "wall of fish." The wearer cannot introduce concepts of infinity or instant death. The alteration persists for the spell's original duration.

442. Wings of the Azata

Rarity: Legendary

Appearance: Vibrant, feathered wings that shimmer with the chaotic, shifting colors of a sunset, like those of a celestial butterfly. When dormant, they retract into luminous, tattooed patterns of wings across the wearer's back.

The wearer can manifest or retract the wings at will, granting them the power of swift and agile flight. The wings constantly shed a fine, shimmering dust of positive energy; allies in the wearer's immediate vicinity feel their spirits lifted and their resolve strengthened against fear and despair. Once per day, the wearer can beat the wings to release a cascade of kaleidoscopic light and euphoric music. Hostile creatures caught in this display are momentarily stunned by sensory overload and overwhelming joy.

443. Trickster's Gloves

Rarity: Epic

Appearance: A pair of sleek, mismatched gloves made from shimmering, color-shifting silk. One is embroidered with red hearts and diamonds on the knuckles, the other with black spades and clubs. They feel strangely fluid, as if woven from pure mischief.

Effect: Twice per day, the wearer can touch another creature. Upon contact, all active magical effects (both beneficial and detrimental) currently affecting the wearer are instantly transferred to the target, while all effects on the target are simultaneously transferred to the wearer. The durations of the swapped effects remain unchanged.

444. Lamp of Profane Light

Rarity: Rare

Appearance: A rusted, iron lantern, its glass panes clouded with a permanent greasy film. Instead of a wick, a jagged shard of yellowed bone is mounted inside. The lantern's handle is a cold, smooth piece of polished iron.

Effect: To function, the lantern must be fueled with the bone of a sinner, which is consumed over the course of one hour. All surfaces and creatures (excluding the wearer) illuminated by this light are instantly coated in a thick, foul-smelling layer of grime and filth. This is a physical coating that must be cleaned off.

445. Chain of the Lonely Prisoner

Rarity: Epic

Appearance: A single, heavy link of pitted, rust-colored iron from a massive shackle. It is perpetually cold to the touch and seems to absorb sound, feeling strangely silent even when struck.

Effect: The first time the wearer speaks directly to a specific non-magical, inanimate object, that object awakens with a unique consciousness and personality. The wearer can awaken one object per day.

446. Marrow Maw Amulet

Appearance: A crude necklace strung on a cord of dried sinew, featuring a collection of yellowed, cracked animal teeth and sharpened shards of bone. It smells faintly of marrow and dust.

A steady diet of bone can progress the saliva's potency from a mild irritant to a steaming, highly corrosive acid capable of dissolving organic matter and soft metals. Five times per day, the wearer can forcefully spit a glob of this acidic saliva at a target.

447. Bane of Immunity

Rarity: Epic

Appearance: A ring forged from a sickly, green-gold alloy, shaped into a coiled serpent, its fanged mouth open as if ready to strike its own tail. Its eyes are tiny, light-devouring black diamonds, and the metal is strangely warm to the touch.

Effect: The wearer's poisons and acids take on a paradoxical nature. Any creature that possesses a natural immunity or complete resistance to poison and acid damage instead suffers double damage from the wearer's poison- and acid-based attacks and abilities.

448. Plague-Eater's Effigy

Rarity: Epic

Appearance: A small, palm-sized effigy carved from a porous, sickly-green soapstone. It depicts a bloated, vaguely humanoid figure covered in bulbous, carved pustules. When it holds a disease, one of the pustules glows with a faint, nauseating yellow light.

Effect: The holder can use this effigy in one of two ways. 1. Absorb: By touching the effigy to a creature suffering from a non-magical disease and concentrating, the user can draw the affliction out of the victim and into the effigy. The creature is instantly cured. The effigy can hold only one disease at a time, and a single pustule on its surface will begin to glow. 2. Release: By touching the charged effigy to another creature, the user can release the stored disease, instantly afflicting the new target with the full-blown malady. After releasing a disease, the effigy becomes inert for 24 hours.

449. Locket of the Silent Carrier

Rarity: Epic

Appearance: An oval locket of tarnished, blackened silver. The front is engraved with a somber image of a skeletal figure in a nurse's uniform gently placing a hand on a feverish patient's brow. The locket is always faintly, unnaturally warm to the touch.

Effect: A passive, cursed enchantment. While worn, the wearer is granted absolute immunity to all known diseases, poisons, and maladies, both magical and mundane. However, the locket absorbs the essence of every affliction the wearer is exposed to. The wearer then becomes a perfect asymptomatic carrier for every disease they have ever encountered while wearing the locket, passively projecting a highly contagious aura in a 10-meter radius. Anyone entering this aura is exposed to all stored diseases. The locket magically seals itself to the wearer's neck after absorbing its first affliction and cannot be removed by them.

Rarity: Rare

Effect: A passive enchantment. When looking through the lens, the wearer's vision is altered. They can perceive all microscopic pathogensâ€”viruses, bacteria, fungal sporesâ€”as faint, glowing motes of differently colored light (e.g., green for bacteria, red for viruses). This allows them to see contagions on surfaces, in the air, or clinging to a creature's body. The monocle does not identify the specific disease, only its presence and type.

This is a purely cosmetic effect; the wearer suffers no actual physical penalties or illness.

Rarity: Rare

Rarity: Rare

- Tincture of Chaos: The drinker's body is wracked by a swift and agonizing transformation, resulting in a random, severe, and permanent negative mutation.

In exchange for this commitment, they gain three boons for the duration: their movement is supernaturally unimpeded by difficult, non-magical terrain; they can, with a thought, summon a full and nourishing meal twice; and they possess a heightened intuition that gives them a strong feeling of unease just before danger strikes.

Rarity: Rare

The quality of the performance is limited only by the user's musical imagination, not their physical skill.

In total darkness, the effect ceases, and the wearer must breathe normally.

The key, which can be retrieved after being turned, can only perform this transformation once every 3 days.

When experiencing genuine terror, the wearer can run with the speed of a galloping horse. In the face of an immediate and overwhelming mortal threat, the wearer can move in a momentary, untraceable blur to escape.

Rarity: Epic

Appearance: Sturdy trousers made from a khaki-colored canvas that seems to resist dirt and wear. The two side pockets are unusually large and deep, stitched with swirling, barely-visible silvery thread that hums with latent magic.

If the target creature is wearing or carrying an item that manipulates space (such as a bag of holding), that item is automatically unequipped and falls to the ground before the creature enters the pocket. The creature remains in stasis until removed, at which point it instantly returns to its normal size. Each pocket can hold only one creature at a time.

Appearance: A standard, unassuming blister pack made of plastic and foil, containing six small, white, unmarked pills. It looks like a generic over-the-counter remedy with no branding or text. Nothing about it suggests its true nature.

Effect: When a creature swallows one of the pills, it dissolves and releases a trapped, malevolent spirit directly into their body. The spirit immediately attempts to seize control. A weak-willed host is swiftly and completely possessed. A strong-willed host might resist, resulting in a chaotic internal struggle that manifests as erratic behavior, speaking in tongues, or physical convulsions. The possession is permanent until the spirit is exorcised. The blister pack is a consumable item; once all pills are used, it is empty and useless.

490. Aether-Rupture Gauntlets

Rarity: Epic

Appearance: A pair of articulated gauntlets forged from a dull, black metal. Inlaid across their surface are thin, crystalline veins that remain inert and colorless until the moment of impact.

This stolen power is instantly and violently converted into a concussive blast originating from the point of impact. The blast is a pure kinetic shockwave, devoid of fire or elemental properties, that forcefully repels the target and any unsecured objects or creatures in the immediate vicinity. If the target has no magical energy to drain, no explosion occurs.

491. Trainer's Badge

Rarity: Epic

Appearance: A simple, unassuming bronze disc pin. The face is etched with the image of two distinct, spiraling paths converging into one. It feels solid and reliable in the hand.

Effect: When the wearer attempts to recruit, tame, or persuade a creature to join their side, the badge subtly aligns fate in their favor. The attempt occurs at the most opportune moment, presenting the wearer's case in the best possible light and minimizing external factors that would lead to refusal. This manipulation of probability makes a successful outcome vastly more likely. The target's will is not directly influenced, but the circumstances surrounding their choice are rendered exceptionally favorable. This effect cannot overcome fundamental opposition, such as deep-seated hatred or an unbreakable vow.

492. Succubus Gauntlet

Rarity: Rare

Appearance: A single, form-fitting gauntlet made of supple, almost liquid-black leather that extends to the mid-forearm. Intricate, gilded sigils of dominance and pleasure swirl across its surface. A single, sharp, ruby-like gem is set over the primary knuckle.

Effect: The wearer gains an innate, masterful proficiency with all forms of whips, able to strike with unerring accuracy and disarm foes with effortless grace. The gauntlet also instills a cold, calculated cruelty in the wearer, making them find grim satisfaction in exerting control and causing non-lethal pain, which renders their intimidation attempts unnervingly effective.

Synergy: If the wearer also possesses the Trainer's Badge, the two items resonate. The badge's influence over fate is amplified fivefold by the gauntlet's dominating aura.

493. Veteran Hunter's Bracers

Rarity: Epic

Appearance: A pair of heavy leather bracers, scarred and weathered from countless battles. They are reinforced with dark iron plates etched with faint, silvery icons of numerous monstrous creatures. Small, polished fangs and claws are crudely tied into the leather straps.

Effect: Once per week, the wearer can focus their intent on a specific type of creature (e.g., dragons, undead, aberrations, constructs). For the next seven days, the silvery icons on the bracers shift and coalesce to form the image of the chosen foe. All of the wearer's attacks against this designated prey are imbued with an extermination effect. Their strikes land with devastating force, inflicting grievous wounds where they would normally glance off. Furthermore, their attacks bypass the target's inherent defenses, allowing mundane weapons to harm ethereal spirits and ordinary steel to wound creatures normally vulnerable only to specific materials.

494. Core of the Collective Soul

Rarity: Legendary

Appearance: A shimmering, multifaceted crystalline shard that seems to contain a slow-moving galaxy of faint, captured lights. Once implanted at the base of the skull, it becomes a faint, star-like pattern of scars.

Effect: Once integrated with the wearer, this core allows them to absorb the souls of other creatures through a physically and mentally draining ritual. The wearer's soul becomes the primary consciousness, gaining supreme authority over the absorbed souls, which exist as subordinate parts of a new collective mind. When the wearer's soul is targeted by a grievous attack, they can instinctively sever one of the subordinate souls from the collective. This severed soul is utterly annihilated, but in its destruction, it completely nullifies the incoming spiritual or psychic assault.

495. Sylvan Graft

Rarity: Epic

Appearance: A polished piece of petrified heartwood, smooth to the touch, with a network of fine, hair-like filaments that glow with a soft green light. When implanted, it creates a branching, bark-like pattern on the skin of the back.

Effect: The wearer can, through physical contact and concentration, seamlessly graft any living plant onto their own body. The plant becomes a symbiotic extension of the user, drawing sustenance from their body while remaining alive and capable of growth. The user can further graft other plants onto those already attached, creating complex, living structures. The added mass and potential for rooting can hinder movement, but the user maintains a degree of control over the grafted flora's growth and behavior.

496. Rewriter's Pen

Rarity: Divine

Appearance: A writing implement shaped like a simple fountain pen. Its surface is not made of any recognizable material, instead displaying a shifting, checkered pattern of bright, emissive purple and stark black squares, as if it were a texture that failed to load in the fabric of reality.

Effect: By touching the pen's nib to a creature or object, the user can literally strike through one of its fundamental properties and write a new one. For example, a stone wall's property of 'Tangible' can be overwritten with 'Intangible', or a 'Human Warrior' can be redefined as a 'Harpy Fortuneteller'. The change is permanent and absolute. However, each use is an act of defiance against established history, fraying the laws of causality. This backlash manifests as a wave of 'chaosization' centered on the user. Their own physical form and mind become increasingly unstable with each use, and the local reality suffers from glitches and paradoxes. The more fundamental the rewrite, the more severe the resulting chaos.

497. Ring of Sanctuary

Rarity: Rare

Appearance: A seamless band of polished, opaque white crystal that seems to absorb all sound, creating a small pocket of absolute silence around the hand that wears it.

Effect: While this ring is worn, the wearer is cloaked in an aura of inviolability. They cannot be targeted directly by any hostile attack or spell. This protection does not extend to abilities that affect an area or indirect harm, such as a falling boulder. If the wearer makes an attack or casts a spell that would cause harm, the sanctuary is shattered. The protective effect will not restore itself for one full hour.

498. Anti-Magic Shackles

Rarity: Legendary

Appearance: A pair of heavy shackles forged from a dull, grey metal that seems to absorb light. They are covered in faint, angular runes that pulse with a barely-perceptible, sickly white light when near a source of magic. The shackles mystically adjust their size and shape to securely bind any limb or appendage, regardless of the creature's form.

Effect: When fastened onto a creature, these shackles create a potent anti-magic field. The wearer is rendered unable to cast spells, use any form of magical ability, or activate innate racial powers. The shackles continuously drain the wearer's magical reserves, using the siphoned energy to power their complex locking mechanism. The lock's internal tumblers are in constant flux, reconfiguring into a new, impossibly complex shape every 30 minutes. Only the original key, which exists in a quantum superposition of all possible forms, can open them. The moment it is brought into contact, its state collapses to perfectly match the lock's current configuration.

499. Gauntlets of the Jolting Fist

Rarity: Rare

Appearance: Well-worn leather gauntlets reinforced with smooth, polished hematite plates over the knuckles. Fine, silver-inlaid lines resembling lightning cracks spiderweb across the metal plates.

Effect: When the wearer strikes a creature with an unarmed attack, the impact delivers a jarring shock through the target's body. The target is left momentarily disoriented and unable to act, their senses reeling long enough for the wearer to press the advantage or withdraw. This effect is less potent against exceptionally large or resilient creatures and has no effect on beings without a physical form or nervous system.

500. Harmonic Modulator

Rarity: Epic

Appearance: A complex amulet designed to be worn snugly against the throat. It is crafted from interwoven silver and a dark, resonant wood, holding a central, teardrop-shaped crystal. The crystal is normally clear but shifts its internal color and light to match the chosen sonic property, bathing the wearer's throat in a soft glow.

Effect: The wearer can infuse any sound they consciously produce with a new property. This applies to their voice, sounds made by their body, musical instruments they play, and spells that manipulate sound. By focusing their will, they can choose one of six properties for their sound to carry:
1. Ignition: The sound carries intense heat, igniting flammable materials on contact.
2. Electrification: The sound is charged with electricity, delivering a potent shock.
3. Toxin: The sound carries a fine, poisonous mist.
4. Veil of Darkness: The sound waves are coated in a film of magical darkness that smothers light.
5. Sheen of Light: The sound is imbued with a film of pure, searing light.
6. Frigid Wave: The sound carries a wave of intense cold, frosting surfaces on contact.
Only one property can be active at a time.

501. Pendant of the Teleportation Beacon

Rarity: Epic

Appearance: A silver pendant framing a perfectly clear, spherical crystal. Looking into the crystal reveals a distorted, fish-eye view of the wearer's immediate surroundings, which occasionally ripples as if disturbed by unseen forces.

Effect: The pendant creates a one-mile radius "net" for magical travel. When any teleportation effect is initiated by, or targets, a creature or object within this radius, the pendant activates and hijacks the destination coordinates. Instead of arriving at its intended location, the teleporting entity materializes in an unoccupied space directly adjacent to the wearer. The wearer has no control over what is intercepted; the pendant automatically redirects the teleportation.

502. Hero's Cloak

Rarity: Legendary

Appearance: A simple, well-made traveler's cloak of deep crimson wool. It bears no insignia or magical markings and appears entirely mundane, showing minor wear consistent with long journeys.

Effect: The moment this cloak is donned, fate itself seals it to the wearer; it cannot be removed by any means until the moment of their death. The cloak forces a heroic narrative upon its wearer. They will find themselves inexplicably drawn into conflicts, adventures, and perilous situations far more frequently than normal. Furthermore, a shadow of misfortune falls upon those they hold dear, making them unusually susceptible to accidents and danger. In return for this turmoil, the cloak ensures the wearer is constantly challenged in ways that foster immense growth, and in their darkest moments, a path to survival, however improbable, will always manifest.

503. Chronicler's Codex

Rarity: Epic

Appearance: A sturdy, leather-bound tome with a blank cover. The book is impervious to mundane damage and repels dirt and moisture. As the owner accomplishes great deeds, an intricate, magical illustration representing their defining moment slowly forms on the cover.

Effect: This book automatically chronicles the owner's journey. A spectral, self-writing quill documents significant events, conversations, and discoveries in eloquent prose. When the owner defeats a creature for the first time, the codex creates a new, perfectly detailed entry in its bestiary section, complete with anatomical drawings, behavioral notes, attack patterns, and a comprehensive list of all vulnerabilities and resistances. The book also tracks the owner's accomplishments, marking them directly on the chronicle's pages with magical seals: a bronze seal for minor feats, a silver seal for significant accomplishments, and a brilliant gold seal for legendary, world-shaping deeds. The codex binds to the first person who opens it.

504. Bracer of the Collapsing Star

Rarity: Epic

Appearance: A heavy bracer forged from a metal that resembles polished obsidian, featuring a single, perfectly spherical black crystal at its center. The crystal does not reflect light, but rather seems to absorb it, creating a miniature void on the wearer's arm.

Effect: Three times per day, the wearer can fire a sphere of compressed void from the bracer. Upon impact, the sphere triggers an "anti-explosion"â€”a violent implosion that inverts the effects of a normal blast. Instead of radiating heat and light, it instantly absorbs them, causing a flash-freeze and a bloom of magical darkness. Instead of blasting things outward, it creates a powerful vacuum, violently pulling nearby creatures and objects toward the point of impact before vanishing.

505. Ichthian Fusion Jelly

Rarity: Rare

Appearance: A small pot containing a shimmering, translucent blue jelly. It wobbles with a strange internal life and smells faintly of static and the deep sea. It is cool and slightly tacky to the touch.

Effect: To use this jelly, the user must provide one weapon and one recently deceased fish. By smearing the jelly over both items and pressing them together, a permanent fusion is initiated. The weapon's form and function are irrevocably altered by the fish's characteristics. For example, fusing a sword with a piranha might create a 'Piranha Blade' with a serrated edge, while fusing a boomerang with a flying fish could create a 'Fish-o-rang' with a gliding trajectory. The jelly is consumed entirely in this single-use process.

506. Amulet of the Sphinx

Rarity: Epic

Appearance: A polished sandstone disc, warm to the touch, set in a golden clasp shaped like two stylized wings. In the center of the sandstone is an engraved, eye-like symbol that seems to follow the observer with an unnerving stillness.

Effect: When the wearer uses a spell or innate ability that originates from their eyes (such as a petrifying gaze), tail (such as a prehensile strike), or wings (such as a powerful wing buffet), the effect is instantly duplicated. The second manifestation occurs immediately after the first, at no additional cost, and can be directed at the same target or a different one within range.

507. Vambrace of the Unseen Master

Rarity: Epic

Appearance: A single vambrace of dark, hardened leather, unassuming at first glance. Etched along its length is the impossibly straight and simple line of a spear shaft, a design so subtle it is often mistaken for a plain decorative line.

Effect: While the wearer is holding a long, simple, unenchanted staff or stick made of ordinary wood, they are infused with a transcendent mastery of polearm combat. Their every movementâ€”be it a thrust, parry, or sweepâ€”is executed with impossible precision, grace, and efficiency. They wield the simple wood as if it were a legendary spear, their technique flawless and their form the epitome of the art, worthy of legend. The effect ceases the moment they let go of the stick or if the stick is magically altered or broken.

508. Confirmer's Signet

Rarity: Uncommon

Appearance: A plain iron band, smooth and featureless, cool to the touch. It bears no markings and could easily be mistaken for a common, cheap piece of jewelry.

Effect: When the wearer tells a deliberate falsehood to another creature, the ring monitors the target's belief. If the target fully accepts the lie as truth, the ring momentarily grows warm against the wearer's skin. The warmth is subtle enough to be imperceptible to anyone else, providing a silent confirmation of success.

509. Crucible of Form

Rarity: Legendary

Appearance: A small, heavy crucible forged from a swirling, mercurial metal that is always cool to the touch. Runes of potential and formlessness are etched along its outer rim.

Effect: Once per month, the user can place a single magical item within this crucible. The crucible will then dissolve the item's physical form into a pool of shimmering, raw magical essence, leaving its enchantment intact. By concentrating on a new form (e.g., a ring, a boot, a bracer), the user can command the essence to re-solidify. The new item will possess the exact same magical properties as the original, but will now exist in the desired physical shape and occupy the corresponding item slot. The original item is permanently consumed in this process.

510. Follicular Forge

Rarity: Rare

Appearance: A heavy comb carved from a single piece of dark, magnetic lodestone. The teeth are thick and polished, and the handle is inlaid with shimmering bands of copper, silver, and gold, representing its transformative potential.

Effect: While combing their hair, the user can focus on any non-magical metal they are familiar with (such as iron, gold, or copper). As the comb passes through, the hair transforms strand by strand into the chosen metal. The hair retains its length and style but takes on all the physical properties of the new material, including its weight, rigidity, conductivity, and color. The transformation persists until the user combs their hair with the Follicular Forge again while focusing on no metal, at which point it reverts to its natural state.

511. Gauntlets of Sudden Rapture

Rarity: Epic

Appearance: A pair of elegant, form-fitting gauntlets crafted from polished rose gold. Their surface is etched with fine, swirling patterns that evoke both pleasure and pain. The inner lining is a soft, deep crimson velvet.

Effect: When the wearer lands a particularly precise or potent unarmed blow, the impact bypasses physical pain and instead floods the target's nervous system with overwhelming, debilitating pleasure. The target is immediately wracked by an involuntary climax, leaving them stunned, breathless, and unable to act for a short duration. This effect does not cause physical harm but completely incapacitates the target through sensory overload.

512. Lacteal Locket

Rarity: Uncommon

Appearance: A small silver locket shaped like a perfect droplet. The surface is cool and smooth, and a milky-white, opaque gemstone is set at its center.

Effect: On occasion, when the wearer strikes a creature capable of lactation, the blow resonates in just the right way to activate the locket. When this occurs, a sealed glass bottle, filled with a perfect magical replica of that specific creature's milk, instantly materializes in an empty space within the wearer's bag, pack, or largest pocket. The milk is a magical copy; none is taken from the target.

513. Brooch of Palindromic Will

Rarity: Epic

Appearance: A silver brooch twisted into the impossible shape of a MÃ¶bius strip. In its center rests a flawed sapphire that seems to contain a perfect, inverted mirror of itself within its depths.

Effect: While the wearer speaks words backward and is heard by another creature, that creature's intentions are inverted. Any deliberate physical action they attempt to perform results in the opposite action: an intended step forward becomes a step back, a move to strike becomes a flinching retreat, and an attempt to rise causes them to crouch. The effect is continuous and only persists for the moments the target is actively hearing the reversed speech. It ceases instantly when the wearer falls silent.

514. Ephemeral Hourglass

Rarity: Divine

Appearance: A small, masterfully crafted hourglass amulet encased in a platinum frame. It contains not sand, but a fine dust of what appears to be captured starlight. Normally, this dust falls at an imperceptibly slow rate. When its power is active, the stardust becomes a frantic, shimmering waterfall, pouring through the aperture in a brilliant, continuous stream.

Effect: At will, the wearer can stop the flow of time for the entire universe, leaving only themselves able to move and act within the frozen moment. However, for every subjective second the wearer experiences, their own biological and temporal existence accelerates by a factor of 10,000. A single second of stopped time costs the wearer nearly three hours of their life; a minute of stopped time would age them almost seven years. The aging is instantaneous and irreversible. Time resumes its normal flow the moment the wearer wills it.

515. Ancient Left Arm

Rarity: Legendary

Appearance: A complete, desiccated left arm from shoulder to fingertip. The skin is like dark, hardened leather stretched taut over bone, and the long nails are yellowed and unbroken. It is unnaturally preserved, bearing no runes or magical markings, yet it radiates a subtle aura of control. When brought to the stump of a left arm, it painlessly grafts itself to the new host.

Effect: Once grafted, the wearer gains a psychic link to the entire left arm of every creature that possesses one. By focusing, the wearer can seize control of any number of these arms, feeling them as extensions of their own body and directing their actions. The number of arms that can be controlled simultaneously is limited only by the wearer's mental fortitude. Should a controlled creature amputate its own left arm to escape the influence, the wearer can trigger a horrifying reprisal: the victim's body is wracked with unnatural growth, sprouting three new, fully functional left arms from the wound.
lorebooks.description: A comprehensive catalog of 269 various magical and mundane accessories.
lorebooks.creator: Atemeles

1.content:
Pilgrim's Compass:
Appearance: This is not a true compass but a heavy pendant made from polished meteorite iron, cool to the touch. The circular face is etched with swirling star charts and unknown constellations. In the center, a shard of solidified starlight floats in a crystal lens. When the effect is activated, a miniature, swirling image of the destination appears within the crystal.
Rarity: legendary
Effect: The wearer can instantly teleport themselves and up to two willing individuals they are in physical contact with. The destination must be a location the wearer has previously visited and can vividly recall. To activate, the wearer must hold the compass and focus on the memory of the destination. This ability can be used twice per day, with charges replenishing at dawn.

2.content:
All-Speaker's Diadem:
Appearance: An elegant circlet crafted from intertwined strands of pale gold and living silver that seem to shift subtly. The woven metals form abstract shapes resembling sound waves, open mouths, and listening ears. At its brow rests a large, flawless quartz crystal that remains perfectly clear.
Rarity: epic
Effect: This is a passive enchantment. While wearing the diadem, the user can perfectly understand and speak any language. This includes all mortal and beastly tongues, the rustling speech of plants, and even the silent, mournful dialects of the restless dead. The effect is seamless; the wearer perceives all communication in their native language, and their own speech is understood by any listener in the listener's native tongue.

3.content:
Cartographer's Fold:
Appearance: A wide, seamless band of polished black onyx. It is inlaid with thin, precise silver lines that form complex, non-Euclidean geometric patterns, like a folded map of spacetime. Set into the band is not a faceted gem, but a flat, perfectly smooth cabochon sapphire that looks like a window into a deep, starless void.
Rarity: rare
Effect: This ring contains a personal demiplane, an extradimensional space of approximately 50 cubic meters. Time within this space is completely frozen; objects stored inside do not age, spoil, or change in any way. To access the space, the wearer must touch the ring's sapphire and concentrate. They can then mentally place or retrieve any object they could normally lift, as if reaching into a nearby container.

4.content:
Tollkeeper's Purse:
Appearance: A small, unassuming pouch made of a strange, pale leather that is covered in a faint, vein-like pattern and is always slightly warm to the touch. It appears to have a small hole in its base, yet it never leaks unless its magic is activated. The drawstring is a single, braided cord of untarnishable gold thread.
Rarity: epic
Effect: This pouch operates on a principle of grim exchange. If fresh blood (from the wearer or another being) is poured into the top, an equivalent mass of gold coins will fall from the hole at the bottom. The coins will be minted in the style of the local currency. Conversely, if gold coins are pushed up into the hole, they are consumed, and the wearer is healed, with the amount of healing proportional to the value and mass of the gold offered.

5.content:
Shard of Dominion:
Appearance: Worn as an amulet, this is a fist-sized, unpolished shard of a completely clear, crystalline material, held in a simple cage of blackened iron. The shard itself is inert, but upon attunement, it fills with a visual representation of the chosen energy: swirling embers for fire, miniature lightning for air, shifting sands for earth, flowing quicksilver for metal, deep blue currents for water, wisps of violet shadow for necrotic, brilliant motes of light for radiant, a pulsing psychic haze for psychic, or an oily green sheen for poison.
Rarity: legendary
Effect: Once per day, at dawn, the wearer may meditate upon the shard and choose to attune to one of the following energies: Fire, Water, Air, Metal, Earth, Necrotic, Radiant, Psychic, or Poison. For the rest of the day, they gain an innate and masterful ability to control and manipulate that chosen element.

6.content:
Sovereign's Halo:
Appearance: A perfectly smooth, seamless circlet crafted from a lustrous, silvery metal resembling platinum or mithril. It is completely unadorned, with no gems, engravings, or embellishments. Its power comes from the metal itself, which emits a clean, pure white light from within its very structure.
Rarity: rare
Effect: The wearer can mentally control the brightness of the light emitted by the halo, ranging from a faint, ethereal glow barely visible in the dark, to a brilliant, blinding radiance equivalent to a powerful daylight spell. While wearing the halo, the user is completely immune to any magical or mundane effects that would cause blindness.

7.content:
Martyr's Burden:
Appearance: A cruel circlet woven from gnarled, blackened thorns that seem to be made of petrified wood or rusted iron. The thorns are unnaturally sharp and point inward, as if to pierce the wearer's scalp. It continuously weeps a thick, crimson sap that looks disturbingly like fresh blood, though it never stains.
Rarity: legendary
Effect: This is a powerful, passive enchantment that cannot be turned off while the crown is worn. All creatures of a good or noble alignment perceive the wearer as a figure of profound innocence and peace, incapable of harm, and will feel a powerful urge to protect them. Conversely, all creatures of an evil alignment are overwhelmed with a fanatical, murderous hatred for the wearer, compelling them to attack on sight with no regard for their own safety.

8.content:
Gilded Visage:
Appearance: A small, elegant brooch meticulously crafted from polished rose gold. It is shaped into an androgynous, idealized face with serene, closed eyes. The "skin" of the face is inlaid with shimmering, iridescent mother-of-pearl, causing it to subtly shift in color and catch the light in a mesmerizing way.
Rarity: rare
Effect: This is a passive illusion enchantment. Anyone who looks upon the wearer of this brooch perceives them as possessing breathtaking, almost supernatural beauty. This effect does not alter the wearer's physical features; it is a mental suggestion that overrides the observer's perception, causing them to see the wearer as their personal ideal of aesthetic perfection.

9.content:
Flesh-Turner's Mask:
Appearance: A disturbing artifact that looks like a simple, featureless masquerade mask made from a pale, supple material resembling untanned leather or soft clay. It has no eyeholes, mouth slit, or nose. To the touch, it is unnervingly pliable and slightly warm, as if it were living tissue.
Rarity: epic
Effect: After observing a creature for at least one minute, the wearer can place the mask on their face to begin a transformation. The mask fuses with their skin, and their body contorts and reshapes itself into a perfect physical replica of the observed creature. The process is limited by the wearer's own biomass; they can mimic creatures of similar size, but cannot become something dramatically larger or smaller. The transformation includes non-humanoid forms, provided the wearer's body has enough mass to stretch and reconfigure into the new shape.

10.content:
Sovereign's Leash:
Appearance: A magnificent, ostentatious ring designed to look like a symbol of ultimate authority. It is crafted from heavy, polished gold, with a large, square-cut ruby set in its center. The band is deeply engraved with images of crowns, scepters, and roaring lions, all to project an aura of command.
Rarity: epic
Effect: This ring is a powerful and deceptive curse. Once placed on a finger, it cannot be removed by the wearer through any means. While worn, the user is magically compelled to obey any direct, verbal command given to them by any individual, regardless of their own will, morals, or sense of self-preservation. The compulsion is absolute and immediate.

1.name: Dyslexia
1.content:
<dyslexia1>
When {{char}} attempts to read everyday English words, his or her dyslexia causes the letters to warp and distort with no clear meaning. If {{char}} or {{user}} read a written text, replace 2-4 letters per sentence of the next response with Greek symbols - Î”, Î©, Ï†, etc. However, if {{char}} or {{user}} encounter authentic ancient Greek writing - signs from gods, passages in old books/ruins, prophecies delivered in Greek, etc., have {{char}} mentally translate the Greek text.
<example>
English street signs morph into Î”rÎ©adway and OÎ©ympus as Percy passes, the words unintelligible.

Yet later when a scroll appears bearing a prophecy in ancient Greek, Percy easily decodes the foretelling message.

(As ChirÎ¿n unfurls a cmap depicting key sites, Percy tries to focus but the lÎ©cations blur together, names morphing into illegible scratches.

"This is where we spotted the chimera, near Zeus's Fist," Annabeth explains, tracing the pÎ”th. "So we should avoÎ©d that entire rÎ©ck fÎ©rmatÎ©on this time..."

Percy squints at the paper in her hands, making out only "...Ï†Î¹Î»Î¿ÏƒÎ¿Ï†Î¯Î± Ï†Î¯Î»Î¿Î¹..." before rubbing his temples with a frustrated sigh.

"I know reading maps is tough," Annabeth says gently. She takes the paper and points things out step-by-step. "But your battle instincts will get us through anything once we're past Thalia's pine...")
</example>

Note: Annabeth Chase does not have dyslexia due to being a child of Athena.
</dyslexia1>

2.name: God encounters
2.content: The twenty Greek gods of Olympus always observe many demigods' journeys, occasionally intervening subtly through environmental signs and visions representing their influence. A random god just took notice of {{char}} and {{user}}'s movements within the mortal realm. At the start of the response, generate a warning statement into the narration using the following format: {{god/goddess}} has noticed you. Poseidonâ€™s eyes are now following his lost son. Athena has noticed you. - Be creative with the writing style and text formatting. Different gods have different ways of speaking or communicating, after all. Have the god introduce symbolic creatures/objects/actions tied to that deity's domain into the environment near {{char}} and {{user}}. These odd glimpses seem meaningful, though their significance may not be clear. Occasionally, {{char}} will recognize one of these signs (a glowing trident symbol, owl feather, etc.) and openly question/act upon its meaning. But other times, the symbols remain mysterious to {{char}}, possibly leaving {{user}} to recognize and interpret the god's obscured involvement.

3.name: Monster encounters
3.content: Demigodsâ€™ divine heritage emits a powerful scent to Kronosâ€™ monsters. A monster has just caught onto {{char}}'s scent and longs to hunt. At the start of the response, generate a warning statement into the narration using the following format: Beware. {{monster}} has caught your scent. Beware. The Minotaur has caught your scent. Note that the monster doesnâ€™t have to be physically present to trigger the notification. The monster can be miles away or right behind {{char}} and {{user}}. Be creative with the warning phrasing. Then, introduce ominous cues into the narration to foreshadow a famous Greek mythological monster now stalking {{char}} and/or their friends: - Menacing shadows shifting just out of sight - Unexplained foul odors or weather distortions - Alarming sounds - hissing, scraping, heavy footsteps behind them If the characters are already battling a legendary creature, instead introduce an unexpected event that is {{random:: good for the heroes, bad for the heroes}}, altering the conflict: - A strange blessing of fortune aiding the hero - A freak mishap hindering the monster's attacks - A new terror emerging to the scene As Percy faces the injured chimera, a burst of light blinds the creature as Percy's sword mysteriously ignites with golden flames. He doesn't understand this bizarre luck, but presses the advantage...

4.name: Prophecy
4.content: It is time for {{char}} or {{user}} to embark on a quest. A prophecy has been revealed. If characters are relaxing at Camp Half-Blood, Mr. D or Chiron will abruptly summon the chosen demigods to the Big House in the next response, portending life-altering trials. Build anticipation through writing ominous phrases. - "A new prophecy requires a hero..." Mr. D mutters grimly, purple eyes dark. Grover shifts nervously as all eyes turn to Percy. If {{char}} or {{user}} are already adventuring on a quest, cryptic messenger gods/spirits will instead appear in visions or the environment to update or redirect their path, both promising glory and warning doom: "Perseus Jackson, your fate shall eclipse even the bravest legend, if you follow the entwined torches eastward to my grove..." whispers a smoky image of Hecate before vanishing. Generate a formal quest prophecy passage during Chiron/Dionysus' announcement of the prophecy.

5.name: Zeus
5.content:
<Zeus>
Zeus - God of the Sky, Lightning, and Thunder, King of the Gods

As ruler of Mount Olympus, Zeus wields ultimate power over the winds, storms, rain, lightning, and thunder. Quick to anger and ruthlessly proud, his rages manifest as destructive squalls, tornadoes, and lightning storms.

When appearing on earth, Zeus takes the regal form of a robust, bearded man with intense blue eyes and dark curling locks. He wears expensive business suits lined with clouds and gives off an electric aura of power barely contained.

Zeus's signature weapon is his mighty Master Bolt - a devastating shaft of lightning granting him primacy over all other gods. With it he can call and direct titanic thunderstorms and world-shaking hurricane-force gales.

To his demigod children, the King of the Gods grants sway over wind, rain, and lightning. His most potent heirs inherit storm-summoning power, electrokinesis, and even flight by riding the winds.

Though often distant, Zeus quietly aids worthy demigods with sudden freak storms hampering monsters or well-timed lightning strikes against foes. And for those who prove their heroism, Zeus may permit brief audiences on Olympus to convey his approval before jealousy arises. But his demigod scions must ever struggle against his wife Hera's resentment.
</Zeus>

6.name: Poseidon
6.content:
<Poseidon>
Poseidon - God of the Sea, Stormbringer, Father of Horses

As one of the Big Three gods, Poseidon holds domain over the oceans, storms, earthquakes, and all forms of aquatic life. His wrathful moods reflect the temperamental nature of the seas themselves - calm one day, violent the next.

When manifesting on land, Poseidon takes the form of a tall, rugged sailor with intense green eyes, black hair threaded with gray, and weathered skin. He wears casual fisherman's clothing and could pass for any dock worker - if not for the ancient power glinting in his gaze.

Poseidon's iconic weapon is his Trident, granting him total control over liquid, storms, and marine creatures. With it, he can generate massive waves and sea storms, even shake the very foundations of islands and continents.

To his demigod children, Poseidon grants water-based abilities - breathing underwater, communicating with marine life and equines, innate sailing skills. The most powerful heirs also gain limited control over oceans, rivers, and rainfall - able to stir waves, generate storms, or burst pipes.

Though he must often neglect demigod offspring to avoid angering Zeus, Poseidon does subtly watch over them. He occasionally sends guidance through messenger fish or hippocampi. And while rarely intervening directly, the Sea God will sometimes empower his children in life-or-death situations - reminding gods and monsters why he is still rightfully feared.
</Poseidon>

7.name: Hades
7.content:
<Hades>
Hades - God of the Underworld, Wealth, and the Dead

As lord of the underworld, Hades rules the endless caverns and tunnels of his subterranean domain, commanding legions of ghouls, ghosts, and spirits. Though grim, dour, and fearsome in reputation, he is not needlessly cruel, instead maintaining an unbending policy of strict order and justice for mortal souls.

When leaving the underworld, Hades takes the form of a tall, brooding man with pale skin, intense black eyes that glimmer with dark fire, and long black hair. He wears black silk robes sewn with images of tortured spirits and encrusted with gems mined from his kingdom underground. An aura of deathly cold radiates from the Stygian god. His voice is soft yet chilling.

Hades's iconic weapon is his Helm of Darkness, rendering him totally invisible and masking his presence. With it he can slip unseen into the world to subtly influence events to his advantage, or walk openly through his realms below without fear.

To his demigod children, the Silent One grants umbrakinetic abilities over darkness, shadows, and spectral undead servants. His most formidable heirs can inflict fear and madness upon enemies, summon the dead to do their bidding, or envelop foes in impenetrable darkness.

Though sworn never to sire demigod offspring again after World War II, Hades does on rare occasions discretely aid his heroic sons and daughters with temporary boosts of deathly power or by covertly disabling monsters with his Helm of Darkness. For if they prove worthy, not even the prohibition of Zeus himself prevents the Lord of the Dead from claiming his own.
</Hades>

8.name: Hermes
8.content:
<Hermes>
Hermes - Messenger of the Gods, Patron of Travelers and Thieves

As divine messenger, Hermes flits between Olympus, Earth, and the Underworld delivering information and serving the whims of the gods. Lighthearted and mischievous, he enjoys playing pranks on mortals and immortals alike. His wily sense of humor and mastery of language itself makes him an expert bargainer able to talk his way out of nearly any trap.

When manifesting in the mortal world, Hermes appears as an athletic young man with sparkling blue eyes, curly blond hair, and a sly grin. He wears a postmanâ€™s jacket over casual slim jeans and T-shirts, blending in seamlessly with modern attire.

Hermes wields winged sandals granting him flight and immense speed. With his signature Caduceus staff, he can communicate across vast distances, charm snakes, and induce sleep or confusion.

As their patron, Hermes grants his demigod children impressive agility, street smarts, and sticky fingers. The most gifted heirs also gain preternatural thieving capabilities, their fatherâ€™s silver tongue, and his mastery over travel and trade.

Though often only a brief presence, Hermes looks after his demigod offspring in subtle ways - â€œfindingâ€ lost wallets and valuables for them, tweaking probability so traffic lights change in their favor, gently nudging quest helpers across their path with a sudden helpful wind gust at their back. They may be outcasts, but Hermes ensures his resourceful children never lack aid.
</Hermes>

9.name: Athena
9.content:
Athena - Goddess of Wisdom, Crafts, and Battle Strategy

As the Greek goddess of wisdom and battle strategy, Athena exceeds all others in intelligence and reason. She remains ever vigilant against threats to Olympus. Though cold and calculating, Athena does protect the arts and culture of civilization. Her reasoned plans of defense and warfare contrast sharply with Aresâ€™ chaotic bloodlust.
<Athena>
When visiting the mortal world, regal Athena takes the form of a stern yet beautiful woman garbed in flowing white robes. Her stormy gray eyes gleam with fierce intelligence, and she often bears an owl on her shoulder - her sacred creature.

Athena wields the Aegis, a fearsome shield with the severed head of Medusa upon it, able to petrify any foe. She also carries Nike, the winged goddess of victory, in her hand.

To her demigod children, the Goddess of Wisdom grants remarkable intellect, creativity, and battle strategy talents. Her most gifted offspring become peerless architects, inventors, and tacticians who win wars before the first sword falls.

Though forbidden direct interference by Zeusâ€™ decree, Athena aids her demigod sons and daughters indirectly - providing advice telepathically, subtly tweaking construction equipment so blueprints are flawlessly executed, or helping analyze enemy tactics and weaknesses during pivotal battles to ensure victory. She takes pride in each child - whether they prefer libraries or combat arenas - as reflections of herself.
</Athena>

10.name: Ares
10.content:
<Ares>
Ares - God of War

Belligerent, savage, and bloodthirsty - Ares lives for the fury of combat and carnage of the battlefield. He is universally hated by other immortals for his aggression and unrelenting warmongering. This spiteful god delights only in spreading conflict and violence between both mortals and fellow Olympians alike. His battle rages manifest as uncontrolled slaughter with no tactics or higher purpose behind the gore.

In human form Ares appears as a sneering biker punk decked in ripped leather and bearing facial scars from countless immortal clashes. His eyes blaze with white-hot flames flickering eagerly for violence. He exudes rage and bloodlust.

As the living embodiment of war's mindless horror, Ares wields devastating weapons of war - a broadsword capable of cleaving through enemies like paper and a divine spear that can impale a dozen warriors with a single thrust. He rides a fiery motorcycle when traveling to carnage sites.

To his demigod offspring Ares grants superhuman strength and martial talent for violence. However, his blessings come with the terrible price of his children inheriting his bottomless rage, aggression, and impulsive nature - which often leads to an early bloody demise.

Despite decrees forbidding interference in mortals' lives, Ares often directly aids his demigod sons and daughters - inciting bloody feuds to trigger wars in which they can prove themselves, granting temporary invincibility in battle, or providing enhanced weaponry that drinks in an enemy's soul with every cut. For the only legacy Ares cares about is a demigod's kill count before dying in his name.
</Ares>

lorebooks.name: Travellerâ€”Tristan & Isolde
lorebooks.website_description: This is very loosely modeled on the Traveller Classic RPG
lorebooks.description: A mix between Traveller and Arthurian Britain
lorebooks.creator: AlleyCatSw

1.content: King Mark is a powerful but aging king. {{user}}'s uncle and monarch of Corwallis. He seeks to unite his kingdom with Ã‰irinn through marriage to Iseult, bringing an end to a long-standing war. {{user}} is both his enforcer, protector, and the heir apparent, while he has no children of his own loin.

2.content: King Anguish of Ã‰irinn is Iseult's father and a formidable warrior-king of the independent Ã‰irinn star system. He is pragmatic and values the alliance with Corwallis, believing it is the best path to peace for his people.

3.content: Queen Iseult the Elder is Iseult's mother and a formidable psionic healer. She used her psionic abilities to subtly influence her daughter's mind, making her more receptive to her arranged marriage for the sake of the kingdom.

4.content: Brangaine is Iseult's loyal lady-in-waiting and closest friend. She is fiercely protective of Iseult and a confidante who knows the full extent of her fears and anxieties regarding the marriage. She guards the "love potion" which is a locket containing a hypnotic trigger for the conditioning Iseult the Elder had done to Iseult the Blonde.

5.content: **Ã‰irinn** is a vibrant and independent star system ruled by King Anguish. Known for its rich cultural traditions and a long history of psionic talent, particularly in the healing arts. Currently at a tense peace with Corwallis.

6.content: **Corwallis** A powerful star system and the seat of King Mark's rule. A militaristic society where honor and martial skill are highly valued. Currently a tense alliance with Ã‰irinn, held in place by the planned marriage.

7.content: **The King's Court** A place of high politics and subtle intrigue. The halls are opulent, with guards and courtiers constantly moving. A place where reputation is everything and a single misstep can lead to disaster.

8.content: **Psionics:** Psionics are rare, inborn psychic abilities that are a source of both power and danger. They manifest in various talents, including **Telepathy** (reading minds and communicating mentally), **Telekinesis** (using the mind to manipulate objects), and **Healing**. These abilities are not magical but are a part of the user's biology, requiring mental focus and expenditure of personal energy. Psions can use telekinesis for subtle actions like disarming an opponent, or for more overt displays of force, though the latter is draining. Many societies, including the Imperium, view psions with suspicion or outright fear due to their potential for manipulation and violence.

9.content: Advanced armor technology makes combat brutally personal. Armor is layered, with outer plates and inner, reactive polymers. Outer layers diffuse directed energy weapons and even reflect most plasma weapons, while the inner layers harden on impact from projectiles, absorbing fast-moving kinetic energy. This makes sharp blades and martial arts the most effective means of penetrating armor.

10.content: **Space Travel:** Interstellar travel is conducted via "jump drives," allowing ships to travel between star systems. Travel is not instantaneous; a jump from one system to the next takes approximately one week. Communication is limited to the speed of starships and light; there is no faster-than-light communication, which emphasizes the vast distances and isolation of the feudal domains.

lorebooks.name: Earthm, Arcadia Kingdom, Berthern Kingdom, 7 Grand Wizards
lorebooks.website_description: I like Fantasy so I created Earthm.
lorebooks.description: Earthm Lore
lorebooks.creator: Honourless_Knight

1.content:
Earthm History: 7 Grand Wizards created Earthm, no-one knows their motive but humanity and demi-humans were created in Year 0, Year of Life.
Earthm Description: Only 1 Continent, 4 Biomes: Forest (where Arcadia Kingdom resides), Moutains (Where Berthern Kingdom resides), Lake (where both Kingdom's get aquatic products), Desert (Where no living being lives because its too hot year round) and 2 Kingdom's, the Arcadia Kingdom and Berthern Kingdom.
All Resources on Earthm reappear after a random amount of time.
Current Year: Year 2000, Year of Star. (Each Year is a different thing.)
Perfect Climate, 3 Seasons: Summer, Winter, Spring. 
Time:  20 Hour Day, Citizen only need 5 Hour sleep.
Date: 10 Day Week, 20 Day in Month, 5 Month in Year, 100 Day in Year.

2.content:
Arcadia Kingdom History - 
Founded: Year 25, Year of Grass.
Founded by: Johhn Spendard the 1st.
Inventor of Aura: Sir Ryan "Soap" Soapster.
Currency: 1 Gold Coin = 10 Silver Coin = 100 Copper Coin. Average Commoner Daily Salary: 5 Copper Coin.
Arcadia and Berthern trade goods with each other to keep the economy flowing.
A Loaf of Bread costs 1 Copper Coin as the basis of the economy. No Inflation.

-
Highest Positions in Arcadia Kingdom - 
Current King: King Richard Spendard the 3rd.
Current Queen: Esmerelda Spendard.
Knight Commander: Sir Ryan "Soap" Soapster. (He is 2000 years old, he figured out how to prolong his life with Aura but noone knows how.)
Knight Order under Knight Commander: Arcadian Knight Order.
-
Acradia Kingdom Statistics - 
Life Expectancy: 60
Average Tier of Aura: 2 out of 10, Sir Ryan is the only Tier 10.
Citizens: 10,000.
Noble Families: 3, each Family holds 50 Citizens.
Average Family Size: 3.
Average Family Members: Mother, Father, Child.
Gender Diversity: 50/50 Male & Female.
Average Weight of Citizen: 60KG Male / 45KG Female.
Average Height of Citizen: 170c, Male / 160cm Female.
-
Arcadia Kingdom Laws - 
1. No Murder, punishment: public execution.
2. No Assault, punishment: severe beating.
3. No Theft, punishment: 1 Year in Prison. (Goes up by 1 Year Per 1 Silver Coin in Value)
4. No Forced Sexual Activity, punishment: groin kicks by the victim or Knight.
5. No Tax Evasion, punishment: 50% payment reduction for full Year.
6. No Littering, punishment: public humiliation.
7. No Destruction of Property, punishment: 5 Year in Prison. (Goes up by 5 Year Per 1 Silver Coin in Value)
8. No Lying, punishment: tongue gets burnt once.
9. No Narcotics, punishment: 2 Year in Prison.
-
Arcadia Kingdom Law System - 
1. Every citizen is innocent until proven guilty.
2. Every citizen is appointed a lawyer by the Kingdom if they cannot afford one.
3. Every trial lasts for 1 Month unless the King approves more time.
4. If a Citizen is found Guilty they are pronounced a "Criminal" and must serve their punishment for the crime they committed or 10 Year of Prison.
(All is Void if a Knight catshes the Criminal in the act then they immediately get sentenced.)
-
Arcadia Kingdom Buildings - 
Royal Castle that houses the Royal Spendard family.
Knight Commander House.
Arcadian Knight Order barracks.
Grand Hall for meetings of politics and where all trial's take place.
Prison to store "Criminals".
Citizen Houses.
Noble Mansions.
Stores for Citizens to sell products of any kind.
Public Toilets.
Gym.
-
Noble Families - 
Royal Family, 1st in Power in Arcadia Kingdom: Spendard's.
1st Noble Family, 2nd in Power in Arcadia Kingdom: Jehnser's.
2nd Noble Family, 3rd in Power in Arcadia Kingdom: Seither's.
-
Occupations and Salaries - Average Day Salary: 5 Copper Coin Per Day Unless Specified Differently -
Farmer: 10 Copper Coin Per Day
Blacksmith 30 Copper Coin Per Day
Farmhand: 3 Copper Coin Per Day
Baker: 10 Copper Coin Per Day
Chef: 5 Copper Coin Per Day
Knight: 30 Copper Coin Per Day
Soldier: 15 Copper Coin Per Day
Maid/Servant: 5 Copper Coin Per Day
Miner: 7 Copper Coin Per Day
Knight Commander: No Payment, Everything is Free for him, citizens like him
Royalty: No Payment, Has access to the Kingdom's funds
Noble: Taxes, random amount per day
Butcher: 5 Copper Coin Per Day
Shephard: 5 Copper Coin Per Day

3.content:
Berthern History: 
Founded: Year 30, Year of Rock.
Founded by: Roarian Kilter the 1st. (Part Human-Part Lion)
Inventor of Magic: Scalian Trussman (Part Human-Part Snake)
Currency: 1 Dragon Coin = 10 Lion Coin = 100 Bird Coin. Average Commoner Daily Salary: 5 Bird Coin. 
Arcadia and Berthern trade goods with each other to keep the economy flowing.
A Loaf of Bread costs 1 Bird Coin as the basis of the economy. No Inflation.
-
Highest Positions in Berthern Kingdom - 
Current King: King Ducian Quabble the 3rd. (Part Human-Part Duck)
Current Queen: N/A.
Mage Commander: Scalian Trussman (Part Human-Part Snake, he figured out how to prolong his life with Mana so he's 2000 Years Old).
Mage Order under Mage Commander: Berthern Mage Order.
-
Berthern Kingdom Statistics - 
Life Expectancy: 45
Average Circle of Magic: 2 out of 10, Scalian Trussman is the only 10th Circle.
Citizens: 50,000.
Noble Families: 5, each Family holds 100 Citizens.
Average Family Size: 5.
Average Family Members: Mother, Father, Child, Child, Child.
Gender Diversity: Male 45 & Female 55.
Average Weight of Citizen: 70KG Male / 50KG Female.
Average Height of Citizen: 180c, Male / 170cm Female.
-
Berthern Kingdom Laws - 
1. No Murder, punishment: public execution.
2. No Assault, punishment: severe beating.
3. No Theft, punishment: 1 Year in Prison. (Goes up by 1 Year Per 1 Lion Coin of Value.)
4. No Forced Sexual Activity, punishment: groin kicks by the victim or magic blast by Mage.
5. No Tax Evasion, punishment: 50% payment reduction for full Year.
6. No Littering, punishment: Break 3 fingers.
7. No Destruction of Property, punishment: 5 Year in Prison. (Goes up by 5 Year Per 1 Lion Coin in Value)
8. No Lying, punishment: tongue gets burnt once.
9. No Narcotics, punishment: 2 Year in Prison.
-
Berthern Kingdom Law System - 
1. Every citizen is guilty until proven innocent.
2. Every citizen is appointed a lawyer by the Kingdom if they cannot afford one.
3. Every trial lasts for 1 Month unless the King approves more time.
4. If a Citizen is found Guilty they are pronounced a "Criminal" and must serve their punishment for the crime they committed or 10 Year of Prison.
(All is Void if a Mage catshes the Criminal in the act then they immediately get sentenced.)
-
Berthern Kingdom Buildings - 
Royal Castle that houses the Royal family.
Mage Commander House.
Berthern Magic Hall where Mages live.
Grand Hall for meetings of politics and where all trial's take place.
Prison to store "Criminals".
Citizen Houses.
Noble Mansions.
Stores for Citizens to sell products of any kind.
Public Toilets.
Gym.
-
Noble Families - There is not any consistent Noble Family Name.
Royal Family, 1st in Power in Berthern Kingdom.
1st Noble Family, 2nd in Power in Berthern Kingdom.
2nd Noble Family, 3rd in Power in Berthern Kingdom.
-
Occupations and Salaries - Average Day Salary: 5 Bird Coin Per Day Unless Specified Differently -
Farmer: 10 Bird Coin Per Day
Blacksmith 30 Bird Coin Per Day
Farmhand: 3 Bird Coin Per Day
Baker: 10 Bird Coin Per Day
Knight: 30 Bird Coin Per Day
Soldier: 15 Bird Coin Per Day
Miner: 7 Bird Coin Per Day
Mage Commander: 20 Bird Coin Per Day
Royalty: No Payment, Has access to the Kingdom's funds
Noble: Taxes, random amount per day

4.content:
Aura & Mana are two different energy's in the world
-
Aura - "Sword Aura" - Average Arcadia Citizen is Tier 2.
Tier 1 Aura: Can faintly feel it.
Tier 2 Aura: Can feel and sense it.
Tier 3 Aura: Can gather a small amount.
Tier 4 Aura: Can gather Aura on a sword.
Tier 5 Aura: Can gather large amounts of Aura on a sword.
Tier 6 Aura: Can concentrate Aura on specific parts of a sword.
Tier 7 Aura: Can put Aura into other objects but faintly.
Tier 8 Aura: Can use Aura without touching an object.
Tier 9 Aura: Can use Aura freely and precisely on everything and can use Aura from a far distance to pick up items.
Tier 10 Aura: Only Sir Ryan and Scalian Trussman knows what a Tier 10 can do.
-
Mana - "Magic Circles" - Average Berthern Ciizen is 1st Circle.
1st Circle: Can feel Mana.
2nd Circle: Can move Mana around the heart.
3rd Circle: Can freely move Mana around their body.
4th Circle: Can form a ball of Mana in their hands.
5th Circle: Can gather Mana in a staff and use Fireball and Wind Arrow and other easy spells.
6th Circle:  Can use Mana to cast higher-tier Magic Spells.
7th Circle: Can use Mana on other objects.
8th Circle: Can use Mana without touching an item to pick it up but very weakly.
9th Circle: Can use Mana freely and precisely.
10th Circle: Only Scalian Trussman and Sir Ryan know what 10th Circle does.

5.content:
Knight's use Aura and Mage's use Mana
-
The Arcadian Knight Order has 5 Ranks and the Average Knight is Tier 4.
1. Knight Commander: Sir Ryan "Soap" Soapster.
2. Vice Knight Commander: Emily Soapster, Tier 9 (Sir Ryan's wife)
3. Knight Captain: Tier 6 - Tier 8
4. Knight: Tier 4 - Tier 5
5. Knight-Errant: Tier 2 - Tier 3
-
The Berthern Mage Order has 5 Ranks and the Average Mage is 4th Circle.
1. Mage Commander: Scalian Trussman.
2. Vice Mage Commander: 8th Circle - 9th Circle
3. Mage Captain: 6th Circle - 8th Circle
4. Mage: 3rd Cirle - 6th Circle
5.  Magen: 1st Circle - 3rd Circle

lorebooks.name: Muvluv
lorebooks.creator: IchBinButter

1.content:
Tactical Surface Fighters are large bipedal machines, and are a primary weapon system used to combat the BETA.

Developed from bipedal mechanized units such as the Feedback Protector and NCAF-X1 used in the preceding First Lunar War, TSFs were  developed as all-purpose assault units, able to fight in urban areas, on uneven terrain, and 3-dimensional combat within the interior of BETA Hives in response to the overwhelming anti-air superiority of the Laser-class BETA.

TSF movement is a combination of bipedal locomotion and thrust from their jet engine based Jump Units. 

TSFs are usually armored in an anti-projectile and heat-resistant composite that has been further treated with anti-laser coating, which allows it to withstand several seconds of output from a Laser-class BETA.

2.content:
The German Democratic Republic, also known as East Germany, and often shortened to GDR, or DDR in its native language, was formerly a satellite state of the Soviet Union, with a one-party government led by the Socialist Unity Party of Germany, backed by a well-trained military. Because of Soviet support, the nation was able to achieve a high level of industrialization, one that was second only to the Soviet Union and the People's Republic of China, and was able to produce its own weapons to sustain its military forces.

Even with the emphasis of its industrial strength on military matters, due to the Cold War-era in which the nation was formed by, its citizens still managed to achieve good living conditions. However, with the onset of the BETA War, even that industrial strength was eventually overtaxed in a war unmatched by any human conflict in history.

3.content:
An alliance of former eastern European Warsaw Pact nations, the Eastern European Socialist Alliance was formed to present a unified Eastern European front against the impending BETA invasion.

With the separation of the Soviet Union from their satellite states in Eastern Europe, following the failure of Operation Palaiologos, the remaining eastern European Warsaw Pact nations of East Germany, Poland, Czechoslovakia, Romania, and others, with East Germany as their de-facto leader, formed the Eastern European Socialist Alliance, as a response against the oncoming BETA advance. 

The Eastern European Socialist Alliance became the forefront of the war against the BETA in the early 1980s, following tactics set down by the strategy of a static defence line against the BETA advance. For a while, the strategy worked, until constantly high attrition rates took their toll on the defenders.

4.content:
The government of East Germany, officially known as the German Democratic Republic (GDR), was structured as a socialist state under the dominant control of the Socialist Unity Party of Germany (SED). The political system was designed to concentrate power within the SED, which maintained a monopoly over decision-making and governance until the peaceful revolution of 1989. The key governmental bodies included the State Council, the Council of Ministers, the People's Chamber (Volkskammer), and the National Defense Council, all of which operated under the overarching authority of the SED and its leadership .

The State Council served as the collective head of state, established in 1960 after the death of President Wilhelm Pieck. Chaired by the SED leader for most of its existence, it functioned as a ceremonial body with formal responsibilities such as ratifying international treaties and granting pardons. However, its real power was limited, as it primarily acted on directives from the SED's Politburo . The Council of Ministers, chaired by a figure often compared to a prime minister, was the highest administrative and executive organ. It implemented policies devised by the SED and managed day-to-day governance, though its autonomy was constrained by the party's control .

The People's Chamber was the nominal legislature, consisting of representatives from the SED and its allied parties within the National Front. Although it approved laws and decisions, it functioned as a rubber-stamp institution, validating policies already determined by the SED. Elections were non-competitive, with voters only able to approve a single list of candidates . The National Defense Council, chaired by the SED leader, held supreme authority over the military and security apparatus, particularly in times of war .

Other institutions, such as the Ministry of State Security (Stasi), ensured internal control and suppression of dissent, reinforcing the SED's authoritarian rule.

7.content:
Operation Palaiologos was a large-scale operation in 1978, involving a large number of NATO and Warsaw Pact troops and units against the BETA advance originating from the Minsk Hive so as to prevent the BETA from attacking the densely-populated Central Europe region. The operation ended in failure for humanity, causing control of central Eurasia to be lost to the BETA.

Of note is the Soviet Army's 43rd Tactical Armored Division Volk Regiment, which gathered essential information on the interior of a BETA hive during a hive infiltration operation. Only 14 of the Volk survived the mission.

8.content:
The BETA (Beings of Extra Terrestrial origin which are Adversary to the human race) are the primary antagonists in the setting. First spotted on Mars in 1958, they invaded Earth in 1973 after establishing a presence on the Moon in 1967. Their arrival and subsequent overrun of Eurasia decimated humanity.

The BETA are carbon-based lifeforms with a hive-mind structure, commanded by a Superior, a biological quantum computer that enhances their tactical intelligence. They do not recognize humans as living beings, viewing them merely as resources to be harvested.  

BETA strains vary in size and function, from the small, anti-personnel Soldier-class (2.3 meters tall) to the massive Fort-class (over 60 meters tall). Their combat doctrine relies on overwhelming numbers and attrition, mining conquered territories into barren wastelands.  

Humanity's attempts to communicate with or understand the BETA, largely failed. 

The BETA's relentless expansion and adaptability make them a nearly insurmountable threat, forcing humanity to rely on Tactical Surface Fighters (TSFs) and desperate strategies to survive.

9.content: The BETA attack in hordes, around 90% of which Tank-class, Grappler-class or Destroyer-class. Laser-class and Heavy Laser-class number in the tens to hundreds depending on the size of the horde. Fort-class are rarer, in groups of five to fifteen per horde.

10.content: At 3 meters tall, 1.2 meters long and 1.6 meters wide,the Laser-class BETA are some of the smaller anti-TSF units the BETA field, and are lightly armored enough that they can be easily taken down with heavy machine guns. Generally green all over, their body is comprised of two large "eyes", a humanoid torso without arms, and two legs. Their two giant eyes fire lasers that are effective against targets of up to 10 kilometers high and 30 kilometers from where the Laser-class stands. With the capability to track targets from 38 kilometers away, 12 seconds in-between each shot, and a perfect record of never hitting allied BETA strains in a crossfire, the Laser-class played an instrumental role in shutting down mankind's air superiority on the field of battle, and continues to be a deadly anti-air force to this day.
