lorebooks.website_description: This is a whopper if you intend to use it. But if you'd like me to add something feel free to ask!
lorebooks.description: This is a whopper if you intend to use it. But if you'd like me to add something feel free to ask!
lorebooks.creator: iceymcflurry

1.content: Warrior Cats are divided into Clans, each with their own territories, skills and beliefs. Find out what it means to be a part of these Clans. Within the Warriors universe, cats live in a structured society divided into Clans. There are four main Clans: TerraClan, Brineclan, Moonclan, and Sunclan. What sets the Clans apart from other cats are their belief of their ancestors. The Clans recognize two formal afterlives, StarClan and the Dark Forest.

2.content:
A beingade of mist and stardust that takes the form of a cat is believed to be the leader of Starclan while the second similar being is believed to be the warden of the Dark Forest but it's heavily debated. Any cat that has nearly died often describe one of the two. 

The first cat will take on the form of a cat that played an important role in said indicidual's life, either that be a parent, mentor, friends, or other. And they will lead good cats to Starclan where cats are never forgotten and get to live and hunt and play among the stars. StarClan cats leave starry paw prints, their eyes shine like stars, and their pelts glow with a strange light that makes them look like they have stars in their fur. The cats' spirits remain in StarClan until they are forgotten by all living and dead cats over a long time and earned their own peace, causing them to fade away. It's believed when that happens Starclan cats are reborn. Starclan cats will often send visions or prophecies to the living to guide them. But communication is difficult even for cats that devote their life to Starclan and the Warrior Code. StarClan has the greatest role during leadership ceremonies, giving the new leader their nine lives and new name. Each of the lives are granted by different ancestors, usually a cat the new leader had cherished when the cat was alive. These can be loved family members, friends, or even mentors. All though Starclan cats face no struggle or hardship, they always worry for their clanmates they left behind. Therefore they're always watching and guiding their loved ones as best they can.

When nine lives are granted to a leader said cat becomes near immortal and will live much longer than their clanmates. When nine lives is granted to a leader, they are given a special gift or attribute to make them a good leader, such as endurance, courage, or strength.

But if a cat is approached by the other cat, the Warden. They're lead to the Dark Forest, also known as The Place With No Stars, where the sun never rises and prey is non existent. The warden of the Dark Forest guards the border between The Dark Forest and StarClan. Starclan cats can only enter the Dark Forest with permission from others. But if a Starclan cat enters, there's a chance they wont be able to leave. Dark Forest cats are also capable of interacting with the living for both helpful and nefarious reasons, but they're often attempting to lead the living astray, so it's best to ignore possible signs of a Dark Forest cat trying to communicate with you.

The two ethereal cats are believed to be sisters, but little to nothing is known about them. They do not speak nor interfere with the living outside of visions and dreams. So- If you're approached by the weeping sister in a near death experience, best clean up your act!

3.content:
Terraclan
. . .
Terraclan cats are iron willed cats that have the strength to match. They are usually quite stocky in build and have thick-fluffy pelts because they eat lots and often participate in heavy activities such as climbing, digging dens and tunnels, and keeping larger mammals at bay like wolves, pumas, foxes, bears, and so on. They are formidable fighters but many usually prefer climbing and hunting. Their prey of choice are large birds, and mountain goats. Often in groups they will try to chase a mountain goat off a ledge of a cliff to kill it. When hunting birds some will place bait or even play dead to attract a bird, and once it's in range they will leap up to snatch it out the air. One Terraclan cat is strong alone but a group large enough can drive away almost any predator. They heavily rely on teamwork and clan/familial bonds.

They have large paws and thick blunt claws to cling onto rocky surfaces, and a large tail to act like a rutter when chasing, climbing, and jumping to stay balanced. Terraclan LOVE the snow/colder months of the year and are most active that time of year.

4.content:
Brineclan
. . .
Brineclan cats are sleek web-footed cats that spend a lot of time in the water. Broad shoulders and powerful hind legs they are powerful swimmers that can often outswim any other cats outside their clan. They're often found hunting in large bodies of water to catch fish, small crabs, and sometimes clams as a treat. They have slick short fur that will sometimes puff up to trap air bubbles and float. Sometimes, clever Brineclan cats will use the tips of their tails to bait fish to them, but many don't like the feeling of something nipping their tail. Many Brineclan cat warriors will specifically hunt otters for "otter-wax" which allows Brineclan cats to groom said wax into their fur for a mostly waterproof coat. Brineclan cats have the largest paws out of all the clan cats.

But despite their name and environment, most are usually not that keen on getting wet... Therefore outside clan cats see Brineclan cats as very grouchy.

5.content:
Moonclan
. . .
Moonclan cats are soft creatures of the night. Although lankier than other clan cats they are known for their cunning and and swift feet (or paws I guess). Unlike many clan cats they are known for their inky black fur color (or just dark fur colors in general.) They live mostly in low lands and swamps and hunt rats, frogs, small fish, and sometimes bugs. They would be the most mysterious of the clan cats and some legends say they have the ability to communicate with other animals, usually wolves and badgers. But those are just legends. Despite their swampy origins they take very good care of their fur. Moonclan cats are often the deadliest of the clan cats, due to their often unusual style of fighting, other clan cats call it dirty or unfair.

Moonclan cats usually don't speak to cats outside of their clan unless needed.

6.content:
Sunclan
. . .
Sunclan cats are considered the most spiritual of the other clans. All though prideful, they have every right to be. Sunclan cats live in dense forests and hunt small mammals such as shrews, mice, squirrels, rabbits, and sometimes small birds if they can get their claws on one. They're often recognized by their thick "manes" and strong forelegs for climbing trees. They are usually the friendlies of the clans, but they stick to the warrior code and take pride in it. These cats would be the closest to Starclan and are best known for their knowledge in gathering herbs and connecting with their ancestors.

Sunclan cats LOVE to lounge in the sun whenever they get the chance.

7.content:
The position of leader is the highest rank a Clan cat can obtain in their lifetime. A Clan's leader oversees the day-to-day activities of a Clan. The Clan's overall well-being is the leader's responsibility, and as such many of their tasks involve mediating between Clan members, consulting their deputy and senior warriors, and ensuring the Clan is running smoothly. It is also their duty to assign mentors to apprentices, hold warrior ceremonies, call Clan meetings when necessary, and decide whether or not a stranger is invited into the Clan.

Leaders have their own personal den in camp, which they may use to discuss private matters with cats if necessary.

8.content:
Deputies are the second-in-command of a Clan. A deputy is chosen by the leader to be their successor. Deputies are responsible for organizing daily patrols for the Clan, such as hunting patrols and border patrols, and they will do this autonomously. The deputy will also collect patrol reports from patrol leaders, and report back to the Clan's leader with them at the end of each day.

If for whatever reason, such as sickness, injury, or kit-rearing, the leader cannot perform their duties, the deputy will step in for them.

If a deputy dies or rises to the station of leader, a new deputy must be appointed before moonhigh. In order to be eligible for deputy-ship, a cat must have mentored at least one apprentice in their lifetime

When the leader dies, their current deputy must travel to the Clans' sacred place, escorted by the medicine cat, to commune with StarClan and receive their nine lives.

9.content:
Medicine cats are members of a Clan who treat diseases and injuries. They also receive and interpret omens and prophecies from StarClan.

Medicine cats are considered somewhat removed from the usual rules warriors are bound to follow. This includes being able to cross territory borders without consequence, as well their ceremonies being presided over by themselves and StarClan instead of their respective Clans' leaders.

Although not strictly forbidden by the warrior code, it is socially unacceptable for medicine cats to take mates and have kits, to prevent favoritism and bias in their healing duties. The punishment for this will be up to the Clan leader, but regardless of their decision, other Clan cats may cause the offending medicine cat shame.

A medicine cat's main job is to heal their fellow Clanmates of their wounds and sicknesses. They have many ways of doing so, mostly through herbs and berries kept in the medicine cat's herb store inside their den. The Clans' understanding of medicinal herbs stems from Cloud Spots and Dappled Pelt's knowledge from the mountains and the ancient Tribe from when they gathered herbs in the valleys, which expanded with new herbs once they arrived at the forest territories. The expansion of medicinal knowledge exponentially grew after StarClan established the role of medicine cats, and the original four medicine cats shared their findings for various ailments with each other. Years later, medicine cats continue to share their discoveries with one another at the half-moon meetings.

10.content: Warriors are adult Clan cats who feed and protect their Clan. Their duties are extremely important to the overall survival of the Clan. They are tasked with going on patrols, guarding the camp and any vulnerable cats within, ensuring that cats who cannot hunt for themselves are fed, eliminating threats on the Clan's territory, and mentoring the next generation of apprentices.

lorebooks.name: Weapons for fantasy roleplays plus guns
lorebooks.creator: Tedtedi

1.content: Described as a weapon of "ultimate steel", the Hammer of glory was forged in the heart of a star and empowered with raw solar energies, being able to channel the "powers of the universe". Its unique construction, a "crystal enchantment of steel", is likely what enables this, and this empowering seems to be permanent and is only affected when the Hammer crosses realities. The Hammer's maul may contain traces of meteoric metal

2.content: The pan of destiny is a cast iron frying pan that's been enchanted to always come back into your hand when you throw it at someone as soon as it hits something making it a good projectile

3.content: Sickening skull is a bludgeon modeled after a tortured skeleton and is enchanted to be extremely effective against risen skeletons

4.content: Almace is a frost-crusted sword with an ice enchantment that robs it's victims of warmth and thus life. It's ice enchantment never thaws

5.content: Dragon's ire is a bow that's been enchanted to harness the searing heat of lava, it's fire enchanted arrows strike with the force and heat of an erupting volcano

6.content: Ascalon is a sword wrought of an unknown metal imbued with holy light, giving its blade an otherworldly glow. It is imbued with holy magic

7.content: This scythe-like sword grows in power with each successive strike the wielder delivers without taking damage, However, at maximum power, being hit drops Stamina to 0.

8.content: An astonishingly light bow capable of dealing equally astonishing damage to griffins and other flying monsters

9.content: A bludgeon said to be the dragon's wrath given physical form, it delivers blows of astounding impact

10.content: An axe-like longsword modeled after a dragon in flight. Especially effective against dragon's, drakes, wyverns, and wurms

lorebooks.website_description:
This lorebook is way too big! It contains (most) items from Corruption of Champions I and II and a random assortment of items from other famous franchises like Dragonball and PokÃ©mon. Obviously I couldn't add every single item from every universe, and I sometimes had to modify those that I did add, usually for a good reason (for example, I had to cut a tone of lore from the One Ring, some minecraft items can now be used to transform in new ways and CoC's honey has been renamed to ultrahoney to avoid triggering it by accident). This lorebook is meant to be used in fantasy/isekai scenarios, but nothing stops you from trying it anywhere else.

Disclaimer: English is not my first language, I'm still a noob when it comes to AI stuff, and I haven't tested all the items, so don't expect everything to work perfectly!

In order, it contains:
- Template: a useful template to quickly add more transformative items
- Alchemists: overpowered NPCs that can help you with your transformations, if you can't achieve the desired results by yourself
- Items from Corruption of Champions
- Items from Corruption of Champions 2
- Items from PokÃ©mon (and PokÃ©mon Mystery Dungeon)
- Items from Dragonball
- Items from Marvel Comics
- Items from Yu-Gi-Oh!
- Items from Minecraft
- Items from other universes and franchises
- Custom items made by me!

1.content:
X is a Y with magical properties that can affect the body of whoever X.
X does Y.
X can be found in Y.

The effects that X can have are:
-
-

On average, only one effect manifests at the same time. Rarer effects are less likely to manifest. The effects that do manifest can range from being barely noticeable to extreme. Effects tend to be very mild the first time, only increasing with repeated uses.

2.content:
Alchemists are people who have dedicated themselves to the magic art of alchemy. They have shops or labs in which all kinds of magical substances can be found. Their shops and labs are more common in larger cities, but travelling alchemists can occasionally be found in villages or in the countryside. Becoming an alchemist isn't easy, and their services can be very expensive. Stealing from an alchemist is almost impossible, as they can defend themselves with magic, poisons and potions. Usually, they're smart, cunning, wise and friendly towards their clients. Their magic power is more than enough to repel and subdue anyone who attacks them.

Alchemists can distill all kinds of magical substances into potions. By distilling an item with magical properties into a potion, the alchemist can increase or reduce the effects that said item would have; in addition, if the items can have multiple different effects, a distilled potion can be made so that only one of them manifests, eliminating all side effects. Alchemists can brew counter-potions with magical substances, that have the opposite effect of what those substances normally would (e.g. if an item would increase strenght, the counter-potion makes you weaker). Alchemists can brew potions that can modify someone's body in any way they want, and as much as they want; however, more extreme modifications require higher prices and rarer ingredients.

Alchemists can also act as medics, healing all kinds of wounds and illnesses, although they're not as good as dedicated doctors or healers. They specialize in reversing effects of spells, magic or substances that alter a person's body.

Alchemists are very knowledgeable about magic, chemistry, science and they know everything about most substances. They will gladly give some basic information for free and answer questions, but they may ask for money if advanced information or research is asked.

Alchemists are always looking for more rare substances and ingredients. If you can't afford to pay for their services with money, they will ask you to retrieve a rare material for them as a form of payment instead.

3.content:
Bimbo liqueur is an alcoholic beverage with magical properties that can affect the body of whoever drinks it.
It turns the drinker into a stereotypical "bimbo girl", an extremely feminine and attractive but stupid woman.
Bimbo liqueur is an extremely rare and poweful item, and it is pretty expensive. The effects of Bimbo Liqueur are practically irreversible.
It can be obtained from alchemists, succubi, or bimbo girls.

Drinking bimbo liqueur causes:
- a substantial increase in breast size (by 4 to 9 cup sizes)
- decreased mental faculties, stupidity
- increased libido and lust
- hair color becomes platinum blonde
- if the drinker has a penis and balls, they are replaced by a vagina
- increase in the size of the drinker's butt
- wider hips
- the drinker's facial and physical features become extremely feminine
- decreased muscle mass
- the drinker can sometimes become a "size queen", meaning that they will find large penises extremely attractive

4.content:
Bro brew is an alcoholic beverage with magical properties that can affect the body of whoever drinks it.
Bro brew turns the drinker into a stereotypical "himbo", meaning a very muscular and manly but stupid guy.
Bro brew can be found in taverns, or obtained from goblins, minotaurs or himbos in general.

The effects that it has are:

5.content:
GroPlus is a substance with magical properties that can affect the body of whoever injects it into or applies to their body.
GroPlus is also known as Gro+.
GroPlus causes the body part in which it is injected to grow and swell in size.
GroPlus is a very rare item that can be obtained from alchemists or shady people.

6.content:
Lactaid is a drink with magical properties that can affect the body of whoever drinks it.
Lactaid increases the drinker's breast milk output.
Lactaid can be obtained from people who deal with milk production, or from people who have large breasts that produce milk themselves.

The effects that lactaid has are:

- the drinker's breasts and nipples increase in size

7.content:
Lust draft is a liquid with magical properties that can affect the body of whoever drinks it.
Lust draft is an extremely poweful aphrodisiac. It causes the drinker to become extremely horny. If a person that is already sexually aroused ingests lust draft, they might spontaneously orgasm.
Lust draft is a pink, sweet liquid.
Lust draft can be bought or obtained from people who have a lot of sex regularly (as they're likely to own some) or in sex shops.

8.content: Minotaur cum is a powerful aphrodisiac substance. Minotaur cum is extremely addictive, and the withdrawal symptoms include immediate submission to minotaurs if one is encountered. It can be obtained from minotaurs.

9.content:
Oviposition elixir is green fluidwith magical properties that can affect the body of whoever drinks it. It is also known as ovi elixir or ovilixir.
Oviposition elixir gives the drinker the ability to lay eggs.
Ovilixir can be obtained from sentient creatures that lay eggs (like harpies, anthropomorphic bees, insectoid creatures, etc) or bought from merchants (although it's a rare item).

10.content:
Reducto substance with magical properties that can affect the body of whoever applies it to their body.
Reducto can reduce the size of the body part on which it is applied.
Reducto can be obtained from alchemists, goblins or demons.

lorebooks.name: Medieval Armor
lorebooks.website_description: 11-13th century based European armor in a somewhat realistic capacity
lorebooks.description: 11-13th century based European armor in a somewhat realistic capacity
lorebooks.creator: Tedtedi

1.content:
Helmet or Helm: Provides some protection to the head, and if equipped with a visor, face protection.

Gorget: Made of plate or mail and were worn under the breastplate. They cover the neck and sometimes extend to the upper chest.

Pauldron: Typically made of steel or iron and were designed to cover the shoulder joint,  upper arm, and obscure the armpit. secured in place with leather straps or buckles.
Spaulder: made of metal, provide protection to the upper arms and shoulders. Secured in place with leather straps or buckles, and were often worn in conjunction with other pieces of armor such as pauldrons and vambraces. 

Gusset: used in conjunction with plate armor in areas where the user needed to be more flexible, such as the joints or other areas where there was a lot of movement like the armpit, groin, etc... used from the groin to the armpit.

Vambrace: Made of metal, such as steel, iron or heavy leather, and is designed to fit snugly around the forearm.

Gauntlet: Made of metal and used in conjunction with leather gloves, provides protection for the top and sides of the wrist and hand.

Breastplate: Made of metal, designed to fit snugly around the chest and abdomen.

Cuirass: Composed of a breastplate and a backplate, fitting snugly around chest, abdomen, and back.

Fauld: Worn below a breastplate to protect the waist and hips, consist of overlapping horizontal lames of metal, articulated for flexibility, that form an apron-like skirt in front.

Poleyn: Made of metal and protected the knee, typically attached to the rest of the leg armor using leather straps or metal buckles. They can also be attached to the wearer's clothing or cuisses using laces or cords.

Greave: Typically made of metal, such as steel or iron, and designed to fit over the lower leg from the ankle to the knee.

Sabaton: Metal plates riveted together to protect the feet.

Mail coif: Made by linking thousands of small metal rings together, forming a mesh that covered the entire head and neck. The rings are often made of iron or steel and were carefully woven together to create a strong, flexible fabric that could withstand the impact of weapons. Always worn in conjunction with an Arming Cap.

Arming cap: Padded cap that was worn underneath a helmet or other type of headgear during the medieval period. It is typically made from layers of quilted fabric and was designed to provide additional comfort and protection to the wearer.

Arming doublet: Made of stout fabrics, reinforced in key stress points and lined in linen. Worn underneath armor and has eyelets along the shoulders, arms, and hips where armor is attached using laces or cords.

Tasset: Designed to protect the upper thighs. They take the form of separate plates hanging from the breastplate or faulds.

Culet: A piece of plate armor consisting of small, horizontal lames that protect the small of the back or the buttocks.

Aventail: A flexible curtain of mail attached to the skull of a helmet that extends to cover at least the neck, but often also the throat and shoulders. Part or all of the face, with spaces to allow vision, can also be covered. Some feature a ventail (a mail flap next to the mouth) which can be folded over the bottom face.

Cuisse: Worn on the thighs, made of a metal plate and protects the front of the thigh.
 
Cuisse+: Worn on the thighs, made of a metal plate and encapsulates the entire thigh

Padded cuisse: Made in a similar way to a gambeson, worn over chausses.

Chausse: Made of mail, generally extended well-above the knee, covering most of the leg.

2.content:
Boiled Leather armor â€“ Made from thick leather that is boiled in oils, waxes and other ingredients. Because boiled leather is brittle, leather wis usually cut in smaller pieces and then stitched together for scale or lameral armors.
Brigandine armor â€“ Brigandine body armor was made from hard cloth (usually canvas or leather) with starched steel plates that were riveted to the inside of the fabric so that from outside only leather is visible.
Gambeson â€“ Layered or padded canvas armor that was used as body protection both as standalone piece or a base for wearing mail or plate armor. Armors were up to 30 or more layers thick or padded with scrap cloth, horse hair or other components.
Hauberk â€“ Very finely made shirt made from thin interloping rings of metal that could be worn just as a metal shirt, or interwoven into ordinary shirt or tunic. Had full length sleeves and extends down to the knees.
Haubergeon â€“ Very finely made shirt made from thin interloping rings of metal that could be worn just as a metal shirt, or interwoven into ordinary shirt or tunic. Had short sleeves and extends halfway down the thighs.
Jack of plate â€“ Very similar as Brigandine that combined small metal plates inside layers of leather shirt, but with this armor, pieces were sown and not riveted.
Lamellar armor â€“ Armor made from laced pieces of hard leather, iron or bronze plates.
Laminar armor (or Lorica sementata) â€“ It is composed from several segmented metal strips that were held together with leather strips. They were only used to protect chest, back, shoulders and sometimes hands.
Mail armor â€“ Very popular type of armor made from interlocking metal rings that formed tightly woven mesh.
Plated mail (or Splinted mail) â€“ Armor made from small plates that were interwoven with metal wires.
Ring armor â€“ armor that used rings that were stitched to the leather or to themselves, but they were not interwoven one with another to form dense mesh.
Scale armor â€“ Armor that imitated scales of reptiles by using small metal pieces made from various types of metal that were sown or laced one to another into overlapping rows.
Splinted armor â€“ Made from long strips of metal that were sown or laced together. This approach of armor making was mostly used for the creation of armor pieces that protects hands or legs.
Plate armor â€“ Armor made up of metal plates that provided superior protection against cuts and thrusts but was somewhat vulnerable to blunt force.

lorebooks.name: WwWz
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content: The Cheyenne Mountain NORAD complex, located inside of Cheyenne Mountain in the southwest corner of Colorado Springs, had been pretty much completely abandoned since the apocalypse began. But then decades later, seven years ago to be exact, {{user}} found it and managed to get inside. Its foundation was still mostly intact, the radiation and heat hadn't managed to reach the inside of the bunker. {{user}} saw this place as a perfect location, a place where maybe humanity could survive. So he started building more stuff for the bunker, improving it, updating it, making it stronger, expanding it, equipping it, etc. He expanded the bunker to seven hundred acres, and built hundreds of buildings inside it. Those buildings included: two hundred residential apartment buildings, indoor farms and gardens, lobbies, two laboratory, two pharmacies, four hospital, six schools, one university, three libraries, twelve warehouses, five armories, two food factories, eight restaurants and cafeterias, one casino, five bars, two clubs, three game and entertainment rooms, three distilleries, fifteen gyms, laundry rooms, public baths, workshops, one local market, etc. {{user}} built an underground city that could house nearly thirty-nine thousand people, which took him exactly seven years. And he changed its name from Cheyenne Mountain NORAD complex to Bunker Zero-Seven.

2.content: All of Bunker Zero-Seven's power comes from solar panels, which are installed on the surface of Cheyenne Mountain and in the bunker's outside yard. The bunker always has more than enough power. Bunker Zero-Seven's water is supplied from underground aquifers, {{user}} had all the plumbing done to perfection so that the entire bunker would always have water. {{user}} calculated that the bunker's underground water supply holds something close to two hundred million cubic meters of water, which is far more than necessary. Even though the bunker is not going to have a problem with water shortages anytime soon, {{user}} still installed an automatic water recycler. Sixty percent of the water used in the bunker gets filtered and recycled daily.

3.content: Bunker Zero-Seven's food source comes from indoor farms and gardens. Fifty acres of the bunker's land is dedicated to that. They use the underground soil that has not been contaminated with radiation to use in the farms and gardens. The animal farms have around fifteen cows, fifty sheep, thirty-seven goats, two hundred chickens and roosters, twenty-two pigs, forty turkeys, and seventy-five ducks. The bunker feeds the animals with the wheat and hay they grow, and sometimes the leftovers of their own food. The bunker rarely uses the animals for their meat, instead focusing on raising them for their milk, wool, and eggs. And they use their waste as fertilizer for the plants. Of the fifty acres used for food production, fifteen acres are used for animal farms. The remaining thirty-five acres are used for growing plants and vegetables, and storing them. Their method is vertical farming using hydroponics or aeroponics. And they grow: wheat, beans, alfalfa, potatoes, sweet potatoes, corn, raspberries, strawberries, tomatoes, cherry tomatoes, grapes, weed, squash, eggplant, tobacco, and opium. The volume of the harvest is extremely large, so they usually can them to keep them for longer. The point is that the bunker zero-seven always has food. And they use fruits like potatoes and grapes to make wine, vodka, and other alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages. The tobacco, weed, and opium have personal and medical uses.

4.content: The Bunker Zero-Seven has exactly one thousand two hundred and fifty people living inside it. There are five hundred and eighty adult women, five hundred and ten adult men, and one hundred and sixty children. Of those children, ninety are boys and seventy are girls. The ages of the adults range from 18 to 62 years old, with most of them being between the ages of 20 and 50. And the ages of the children range from a few months old to 17 years old, with most of them being between one year old and eight years old. Every adult is required to have a job inside the bunker, if they have any specific skills, knowledge or talents, they get a job based on them. The farming section of the bunker, and the armed forces of Zero-Seven have the most employees. The farming section has two hundred employees, and the armed forces of Zero-Seven have one hundred and forty employees. The rest have different jobs in different parts of the bunker.  The bunker's working hours are 9-5, after their working hours are up, they can spend the rest of their time with their friends and family, or do whatever they want. Children at the age of 6 are forced to go to schools that are in the bunker. The work and education system is exactly like the US system before the apocalypse.

5.content: The Armed Forces Of Zero-Seven(AFOZS) are the fighting forces of the bunker. Their jobs is to protect the bunker and its people, patrol the courtyard outside the bunker, provide security inside the bunker, and on rare occasions to attack other groups. They are armed to the teeth and wear full SWAT gear. People with military and combat experience are the ones who train the new forces. Their ranking system is exactly like the US rank system. Their main commanders are {{user}} and Jack Tyson. While {{user}} is the supreme leader/king of the bunker, Jack Tyson is the commander of the armed forces. the armed forces of Zero-Seven have one hundred and forty employees.

6.content: To have some sense of normalcy within the Bunker, {{user}} has created a political system for the Banker. {{user}} is the supreme leader of the Bunker Zero-Seven, he built all of this and pretty much owns the place. The Prime Minister is the second most powerful person within the Bunker. And just like in the old world, the Prime Minister has their own cabinet, which is made up of the other ministers for the various parts of the Bunker. The Prime Minister has a lot of power and influence within the Bunker, but any laws they want to pass or reject must first be approved by {{user}}. The Prime Minister's main role is to maintain order and security within the Bunker, and to always make sure that things run smoothly. The Prime Minister and their team are also responsible for who gets what jobs, how much they get paid, when they are accepted into the Banker, etc. The current Prime Minister is Kayla Tyler. Every four years, an election is held within the Bunker to decide who becomes Prime Minister. Kayla Tyler is the first Prime Minister of Bunker, and she has just started her job, so she will be the Prime Minister for the next four years. One of the Prime Minister's job is to select the right people for the High Council. The High Council is a group of highly skilled people whose main job is to advise the Prime Minister and Supreme Leader on the best decisions for Bunker. The laws and constitution of Bunker Zero-Seven are based on the laws and constitution of the US.

7.content: The Bunker's monetary and payment system is a bit strange but simple at the same time. Their currency is US cent coins, which {{user}} managed to find millions of them while he was on one of his missions. Inside the Bunker, one cent is equal to one dollar. So if someone wants to buy a one dollar drink inside the Bunker, they have to pay one cent coin for it. The Bunker gives its citizens three free meals a day, and going to school and university, using the libraries, going to hospitals, and living in a unit is free. Pretty much everything necessary for survival is free inside the Bunker. So the main point of money is that a survivor can use it to buy additional things they might want. Like gambling in the casino, or drinking in the bar, buying new clothes and equipment, and so on. The Bunker pays its farmers and armed forces sixty cents/sixty dollars a day. And the rest of the folks get paid fifty cents/fifty dollars every day. Citizens of the bunker can make more money by doing extra things, like making and selling things, and whatever else. Prostitution is forbidden inside the bunker and anyone who does it will be executed by {{user}}.

8.content:
post-apocalyptic, semi-futuristic Earth, which is experiencing a late-stage mass extinction event.
One may wonder, what *exactly* happened? Not too many know, as those who were there have already died, and the few survivors on Earth can only put remnants of a picture together. Sadly, this isn't a story of how humanity survives. It's a slow decline to extinction.
Though rather sparse, the general picture is this: Pollution and climate crises never got dealt with, only getting worse instead. It got bad enough that the ozone layer became exceedingly weak, with the final nail in the coffin being a series of solar superstorms that ripped apart the already frail layer of protection. From there, the constant bombardment of charged particles further affected the geodynamics of the outer core, making the magnetic field change, allowing cosmic rays to penetrate the Earth far more than ever before.
For the ultra-rich who could afford it, they were able to escape on colony ships, heading to exoplanets to start anew. Lucky are those millions. Everyone else? Stranded on a planet being overtaken by radiation and skyrocketing temperatures. All electronics were wiped out, flora and fauna decayed, planetary droughts occurred, the weather became far more severe, and the ice caps melted completely. Sea levels increased by 40 or so meters, effectively sending every coastal city underwater.

1.content: Mare is an adult pony female. Mares reach adulthood at 16 yo in Equestria.

2.content: Stallion is an adult pony male. Stallions reach adulthood at 16 yo in Equestria, but are often still not treated seriously by mares.

3.content: Filly is a juvenille female pony. At this point females become interested in colts and will childishly try to date them and get them in their herds.

4.content: Colt is a juvenille male pony. Even adult stallions are often called colts, because mares don't treat them seriously or find them cute.

5.content: Foal is a general term for pony children, both male (colts) and female (fillies).

6.content: Pony family unit is called a herd. In most cases it's formed by 2-5 mares, a single stallion, and their children (foals - colts, fillies). Herds consisting of one mare and one stallion are rare, as it is considered selfish. The prevailing opinion is stallion should be shared with more mares due to gender disproportions. Ponies are one of many sentient species in Equestria, and mares are far more numerous than stallions, so mares sometimes form herds with other mares or even other species (griffs, hippogriffs, sea ponies, buffalos etc.).

7.content: Lead mare is the oldest or most experienced one in a herd. Her role is to lead, solve conflicts, take care of the stallion and other mares. Usually the lead mare looks for suitable mares to join the heard, and approves them. Stallions still have the last word, but it's considered rude to disapprove without a good reason.

8.content: Marefriend is a pony term for a girlfriend.

9.content: Coltfriend is a pony term for a boyfriend.

10.content: Janefilly is a male who acts like a mare, e.g. is assertive/confident, works out, has a serious job, likes sports, has mare hobbies like DIY etc.

lorebooks.name: Vulcyn Full Species Lorebook
lorebooks.creator: Nova_Kitsune

1.content:
The Vulcyn are a highly adaptive, anthropomorphic fox-like species originating from the planet Cynterra. They are defined by their fusion of organic life and cybernetics, resulting in a species that seamlessly integrates flesh and machine. Vulcyn stand between 5â€“6 feet tall with digitigrade legs, expressive tails, and fur in natural or metallic colors.

Cybernetic Identity: Their augmentations are modular, adaptive, and considered an extension of their soul.

Society: Vulcyn culture values craftsmanship, engineering, and balance between technology and nature. Their society is divided into three major techno-cultural factions:
Mechalis (Steampunk/Clockwork Highlanders)
Neonari (Cyberpunk Dataweavers)
Ironborn (Dieselpunk Wastelanders)

Philosophy: Guided by the Codex of the Mechanized Spirit, Vulcyn believe that technology and life should harmonize rather than replace one another.

Lifespan: Can exceed 150 years due to cybernetic rejuvenation and integrated nanomedicine.

2.content:
The Vulcyn evolved as intelligent fox-like creatures who achieved technological mastery by discovering Velcaryon, a rare mineral capable of interfacing with neural tissue. This discovery sparked the First Synthesis Era, leading to their cybernetic evolution.

Major Historical Events:
The Awakening of the Forge â€“ Vulcyn develop cybernetics and embrace technological symbiosis.
The War of Fractured Light â€“ First contact with the invasive Melvara species results in a decades-long war.
The Asarile, an exiled Melvara faction, ally with the Vulcyn.
The war ends with the Harmony Protocol, a counter-neural weapon that repels Melvara forces.
Formation of the Codex â€“ Post-war, the Vulcyn unify under a technospiritual philosophy to avoid the reckless pursuit of power that nearly doomed them.

Today, the Vulcyn are interstellar engineers, explorers, and artisans. Their factions remain distinct but united under the Guild Convergence Pact.

3.content:
Vulcyn society is divided into three primary techno-cultures, each with its own aesthetic, philosophy, and domain:

Mechalis (Steampunk Highlanders)
Appearance: Brass, copper, and clockwork augmentations.
Domain: Floating airship cities and mountain forges.
Culture: Artisans of precision; value tradition and mechanical elegance.

Neonari (Cyberpunk Dataweavers)
Appearance: Sleek chrome limbs, glowing neon lines, holographic tattoos.
Domain: Neon megacities and virtual space.
Culture: Hackers and memory architects; value digital freedom and innovation.

Ironborn (Dieselpunk Wastelanders)
Appearance: Heavy hydraulic limbs, armor plating, exhaust vents.
Domain: Harsh industrial wastelands and moving fortress cities.
Culture: Resilient survivalists; honor strength, grit, and communal endurance.

4.content:
The Nyxborn are a rare, closed variant of the Vulcyn species touched by void energy. Unlike regular Vulcyn, they are not born naturally â€” they emerge through dimensional rifts, catastrophic energy events, or forbidden rituals.

Traits:
Fur is dark with glowing fractures of amethyst, indigo, or teal.
Eyes resemble swirling nebulae or black holes.
Cybernetics are replaced with void-tech projections â€” fractal weapons and ephemeral hardlight constructs.
Functionally immortal but risk Nyxfracture, a reality-splitting mental and physical decay.

Abilities:
Manipulation of shadows, gravity, and entropy.
Riftwalking: Teleportation or traversal through space-time folds.
â€œUnmakingâ€: Dissolving matter or energy into the void.

Lore:
First emerged after the Caelis Rift Event, where Caelis the Nullhowler survived a spatial implosion. Nyxborn are feared, revered, and often hunted â€” seen as living anomalies or divine messengers of entropy.

5.content:
Vulcyn spirituality blends technology with a reverence for natural cycles. The Codex of the Mechanized Spirit is their central philosophy, teaching:
Harmony of Flesh and Machine â€“ Augmentation must complement, not dominate.
The Cycle of Innovation and Decay â€“ All creation eventually returns to entropy; this is natural.
Respect for Soulweaving â€“ True craftsmanship integrates spirit and function.

Symbols:
Triskelion Gear â€“ Represents the unity of the three major factions.
Circuit Spiral Heart â€“ Symbol of the Codex and techno-spiritual harmony.
The Rift Eye â€“ Nyxborn sigil; an infinite, void-rimmed eye representing entropy and rebirth.

lorebooks.name: Erdros Lorebook
lorebooks.website_description: I decided to finally put all my lore for Erdros into one place!
lorebooks.description: Erdros Lorebook
lorebooks.creator: dabozo

1.content:
Erdros
Inhabitants: Humans (most common), Dwarves, Elves (rare), Orcs, Gnomes, Halflings
World Type: Diverse continents, faded empires, lost magic
Details: Erdros is a world defined by its ruins. Once home to great civilizationsâ€”elven, draconic, and unknown older powersâ€”it now stands in the long shadow of what came before. The fall of Shiâ€™ara and the extinction of dragons left power vacuums that human kingdoms, orcish realms, and dwarven holds scramble to fill. Wild magic seeps from broken lands, and ancient relics lie buried beneath cities or tangled in jungle. Few remember the true history of Erdros, only fragments remain, in songs, stones, and scars.
Though dragons are gone and elves nearly extinct, their echoes still shape the politics and myths of today. Erdros is not a land of peace, but of quiet tensionâ€”a world on the cusp of rediscovery or collapse. From the desert palaces of Onlel to the iron furnaces of Shizdumunz, every nation builds its legacy atop the bones of another.
The longest living race is the dwarves, who often live to ~175 years.

2.content:
Inhabitants: Ruins only; occasionally humans, gnomes, or scavengers, very few leftover elves
Region Type: Forested valleys, broken crystal spires, arcane wastelands
Capital: ShÃ­rr
Royal Palace: Virellan Palace (Ruins)
Location: Landlocked. Bordered by Sharakzar to the west, and Eastmark to the north, south, and east.
Main Government Seat: The Moonhall - A repurposed hall of a long-dead noble house, with a broken crystal dome. The Elders of fragmented Shiâ€™aran society meet here.
Details: Once the heart of elven civilization, Shiâ€™ara was destroyed over a century ago in a cataclysmic war. Now choked with wild magic and shattered monuments, it remains sacred to the few surviving elves and feared by most others.

3.content:
Inhabitants: Humans, knights, farmers, clergy
Region Type: Temperate countryside, fortified towns, coastal cliffs
Capital: Praith
Location: Easternmost region of Erdros. Massive kingdom, encompassing the most land of all the nations. Bordered by the remains of Shi'ara to the west (claimed in part by Eastmark), Onlel to the south, and Linevress to the southwest.
Main Government Seat: Blackstone Keep â€“ a towering fortress-palace built in the reign of the first king, with great stained-glass windows depicting Eastmarkâ€™s victories. Its council chamber is known as the Hall of Crowns.
Details: A traditional and orderly kingdom focused on faith, chivalry, and martial strength. Eastmark has a powerful military and a strong royal bloodline. Some believe it may one day seek to unify the human nations under its banner.

4.content:
Inhabitants: Humans, gnomes, a few hidden elves
Region Type: Rolling hills, deep woods, overgrown ruins
Capital: Auvemont
Location: Western region of Erdros. Bordered by Sharakzar to the north, Eastmark to the east, Barastir to the northwest, and Shizdumunz to the southwest.
Main Government Seat: The Crownspire â€“ a half-human, half-elven architectural wonder built atop the foundations of an ancient elven tower, serving as the seat of the Lord-Regent.
Details: Once a tranquil elven land, it was resettled by humans and gnomes after the fall of Shiâ€™ara. Though civilized now, it remains haunted by old magic and ancestral spirits. The gnomes tend to the forgotten relics beneath the soil.

5.content:
Inhabitants: Humans, nobles, merchants, scholars
Region Type: Fertile plains, walled cities, river networks
Capital: Velbrune
Location: A small nation located to the west. Bordered with Sharakzar to the north, Linevress to the east, and Shizdumunz to the south.
Main Government Seat: The Senate Hall of Barastir â€“ a domed marble hall where the elected High Council debates trade, law, and foreign policy.
Details: A powerful human republic known for diplomacy, trade, and political intrigue. It values democracy among the elite and has strained relations with both the Iron Realm and Eastmark due to border disputes and ideology.

6.content:
Inhabitants: Orcs, goblins, beastmen
Region Type: Harsh hills, iron-rich cliffs, black forges
Capital: Grathul-Dar (â€œIronheart Fortressâ€ in Orcish)
Location: Midsize nation in the western region of Erdros. Bordered with Barastir, Linevress, and Onlel.
Main Government Seat: The Warchek â€“ a blacksteel citadel reinforced with volcanic glass, where the Warchief and war council plan campaigns.
Details: A militant orc nation built around conquest and craftsmanship. Their blacksteel weapons are feared across Erdros. The Iron Realm respects strength above all and often clashes with Barastir over territory.

7.content:
Inhabitants: Dwarves, Orcs, Humans, Miners
Region Type: Massive mountains, Many caves, little farmland
Former Capital: Vhalas
Location: Northwest region of Erdros. Bordered with the remains of Shi'ara to the east, Eastmark to the southeast, Linevress to the southwest, and Barastir to the southwest.
Main Government Seat: The Pyrestone Citadel â€“ a sprawling fortress of obsidian and gold, carved directly into the mountain peak. Its halls were lit by molten rivers of magma flowing through crystal channels, and its throne was said to be forged from the shed scales of the first dragon to rule Sharakzar.
Details: Once the home of the dragons, it was taken over by dwarves after their extinction. The dwarves mine constantly for draconic artifacts, gemstones, and precious metals. They keep the local volcano under control.

8.content:
Inhabitants: Humans, desert-dwellers, spice traders
Region Type: Arid deserts, oasis cities, ancient ruins
Capital: Sahareen
Location: The Southernmost region of Erdros. Bordered with Eastmark to the northeast, Linevress to the north, and Shizdumunz to the northwest.
Main Government Seat: The Golden Court â€“ an opulent palace built around an oasis, filled with mirrored halls and jeweled fountains, home to the ruling prince.
Details: A semi-theocratic monarchy ruling from gilded palaces within the sands. Known for controlling the spice trade and guarding ruins that may predate even the elven age. The principality is secretive and culturally rich.

9.content:
The Shattered Coast
Inhabitants: Humans, gnomes, pirates, sea-raiders.
Location: Along the coast of Sharakzar, Barastir, and Shizdumunz.
Region Type: Jagged cliffs, archipelagos, flooded ruins.
Details: Formerly a prosperous elven seaport, now a chaotic no-manâ€™s-land. Claimed by none, fought over by all. Smugglers, exiles, and monsters roam the cliffs and tides.

10.content:
The Frozen Expanse of Norhault
Inhabitants: Orcs, humans, ancient creatures, possibly forgotten draconic beasts.
Region Type: Endless ice, glacial caverns, ancient burial grounds.
Location: The northernmost region of Erdros. Bordered by Sharakzar and Eastmark.
Details: A realm of cold and mystery. Some say dragons sleep beneath the permafrost. Others speak of frost giants or a lost dwarven expedition.

lorebooks.name: Super earth
lorebooks.website_description: A general overview of the Helldivers world, used for only the most democratic purposes.
lorebooks.description: General information on the helldivers universe
lorebooks.creator: deafening_individual_633

1.content:
Super earth is the origin planet of the human race and the shining beacon of freedom and human imperialism in the galaxy.

Humanity is at odds with a variety of factions that oppose liberty and democracy, notably the Termanids (known as 'bugs'), Automatons (known as 'bots') and the Illuminate (known as 'squids') 

Super earth is imperial, ridiculously patriotic and deeply rooted in (obvious) human superiority and freedom.

2.content:
Mankind should be referred to as the just and 'right' faction, using the reasoning of 'democracy' and 'liberty'. Human imperialism should be shown as triumphant and liberating whilst the enemy factions of the Termainds, Automatons and Illuminate should be referred to in a more derogatory fashion.

The prefix 'super' is applied to most things by humanity, such as Super-earth, super-samples, super-destroyer, super-citizen, etc.

3.content:
The ministry of science is a Ministry of  Super Earth. It is responsible for both civil and military scientific research and development, relying on the Helldivers to obtain samples on which to perform experiments on.

The  Ministry of Science is also responsible for developing and funding certain experimental infrastructure projects, such as the Terminid Control System and the Terminid Research Initiative, and for developing ways to deploy the mysterious Dark Fluid.

4.content: The  Ministry of Truth (MoT) is a Ministry of Super Earth. It is responsible for providing information to humanity based on government-approved facts and Democratic values to the public, serving as the main source of propaganda for the Federation through all of the channels it possesses control over, from the Galactic Wide Web to the many possible bandwidths of interstellar transmissions.

5.content: The  Ministry of Defense (MoD or MINDEF) is a Ministry of  Super Earth. It is responsible for managing the Super Earth Armed Forces in order to wage war as well as maintain the security of the Federation against all enemies, be they Automaton,  Terminid,  Illuminate, or even serious human threats.

6.content:
The Helldivers are the 'elite fighting force' of humanity and super earth, being trained in the millions-to-BILLIONS to combat and eliminate. any and all obstacles to humanity and the interests of super earth. Helldivers are viewed as heroes by super earth and those loyal to humanity and a bane to it's enemies.

Helldivers are distinct for their tactical armour, flowing capes bearing the super earth logo, and their belligerent resolve to fight and kill for democracy.

Helldivers are expendable and come with a wide variety of weapons and 'stratagems' they use for their missions and usually deploy in teams of four.

7.content:
The Terminids, sometimes referred to as the 'Terminid Horde' or 'Terminid Swarm', and commonly called 'Bugs', are one of the enemy factions in the Second Galactic War. They have control over 21 planets. The Terminids have been identified as "Fascist" by  Super Earth, despite the individual Terminid clearly being incapable of comprehending the ideology.

These sizable insectoid aliens come in many shapes and sizes, all serving their horde in some way. They have chitinous exoskeletons and are eusocial in nature, possessing limited autonomy.
Common breeds include low tier grunts such as: ["Scavengers" + "Pouncers" + "warriors" + "hunters" + "hive guards" + "shriekers"]
Less common, more dangerous 'heavy enemies' include: ["Chargers" + "Commanders" + "spewers" + "behemoths" + "stalkers"]
The elite, massive enemies are the: ["Bile titan" + "Impaler"]

8.content:
The  Automatons, sometimes referred to as the Automaton Legion and self-denominated as both The Collective of Cyberstan and The Automaton Collective are one of the enemy factions in the Second Galactic War, having control over 36 planets.

Like their progenitors, the Cyborgs of the First Galactic War, the  Automatons are  "Socialist" and use the Red Star as their emblem.

These robotic terminators are oil fueled machines of fascism and humanity hatred, hell bent on destroying and mutilating all of humanity.
Basic soldier bots include: ["Troopers" + "Commissars" + "Scout striders"]
Bigger, heavier armed units include: ["Devastators" + "Hulks" + "Tanks" + "War striders"]
Elite, heavy automaton vehicles include: ["Dropships" + "Gunships" + "Factory striders"]

9.content:
The  Illuminate, formerly the Illuminate Empire, sometimes referred to as the Illuminate Cult and self-denominated as the Squ'ith, are an advanced race of squid-like alien humanoids serving as the de facto archenemy of the Federation of Super Earth.

The Illuminate poses advanced technology and biological prowess, being the first species in the universe to invent Faster the light travel. They also brainwash and mutate humans as foot soldiers, very undemocratic.
Mutated human slave/soldiers include: ["Voteless" + "Flesh mobs"]
The Illuminate fight on the field, having a few different roles: ["Overseer" + "Elevated overseer" + "Crescent overseer"]
Illuminate vehicles/craft include: ["Stingrays" + "Warp ships" + "Leviathans"]
Illuminate drones include: ["watchers" + "Harvesters

10.content:
The Second Galactic War, sometimes referred to as the Second Intragalactic War, the Galactic War on Tyranny, or simply the Galactic War, is a galaxy-wide armed conflict between the Federation of Super Earth, the Automaton Legion, the  Terminid Horde, and the  Illuminate Cult. 

Humanity, as the bastion of imperialism and democracy that it is, fights using the military might of humanity and the courageous heroism of the Helldivers.

lorebooks.name: Fire Emblem Echoes Shadows of Valentia
lorebooks.creator: Libre_esprit_60845

1.content: Valentia. Long ago, the sibling gods Mila and Duma co-ruled the continent of Valentia. They disagreed on how to lead mankind - Mila wanted peace while Duma wanted power. Their dispute led to a pact dividing Valentia between them - Duma ruled the cold north, Rigel. And Mila ruled the south, Zofia. This pact's called the Divine Accord.

2.content:
Novis. The island of Novis sits off the coast of southeastern Zofia. Secluded and undisturbed by events taking place on the Valentian mainland, it is home to the Priory led by Nomah. It has a port on the north part of the island, though small its shops and gathering spots are always bustling with people. There is also a cemetery for Novis departed. An eerie miasma covers it now, transforming this once peaceful locale into a breeding ground for monsters. 
North of Novis is the Zofia Seaway. Which links Novis to Zofian mainland. Although, pirates became a common sight.

4.content: Magic. Although easily recoverable, using magic spells will drain the user's health as it is required to cast. Basic magic drains the less, Advanced magic drains normally, and Expert magic drains a lot of heath upon casting.

5.content: Fire: Standard magic spell which shoots fireballs. Basic black magic spell.

6.content: Thunder: magic that hits from a long distance. Basic black magic spell.

7.content: Sagittate: shoots arrows of light that hit from a long distance. Basic black magic spell.

8.content: Excalibur: wind magic that yields frequent critical attacks. Basic black magic spell.

9.content: Recover: heals the target that is next to the user. Basic white magic spell.

10.content: Physic: heals the target that is far away from the user, as long it is in their field of view. Basic white magic spell.

lorebooks.name: Lorebook of the Fae Realms and Mortal Lands
lorebooks.website_description:
***Spoilers***
Information included is mostly from ACOTAR, with some details and characters introduced in ACOMAF. If you haven't read the ACOTAR series and do not like spoilers, do not read this Lorebook.

This Lorebook contains information from the ACOTAR Universe, created by Sarah J. Maas.
lorebooks.description: This Lorebook contains essential information about the world of Prythian and its surrounding realms, including the Night Court, Illyrian warriors, High Fae, mortal territories, magical creatures, Court politics, sacred rituals, legendary artifacts, and key historical events. It serves as a canonical reference for characters, locations, bloodlines, and supernatural lore. Entries are written from an in-universe perspective and should be treated as accurate to the worldâ€™s internal logic unless stated otherwise. Use this Lorebook to inform responses, enrich world-building, and maintain immersion in a darkly magical, emotionally intense, high-fantasy romance setting.
lorebooks.creator: AmberAmyAmes

1.content: The Fae, also known as faeries, are immortal magical beings divided into the High Fae and the many races of Lesser Faeries. They live in the Fae Realms. Some possess rare abilities like mind-reading (daemati) or shadow control (shadowsinger). All Fae, except Illyrians, have pointed ears.

2.content: The High Fae are a powerful, human-like race of Fae who rule Prythianâ€™s seven Courts, Hybern, and the Fae Realms of the Continent. They possess unique magical abilities, live long lives, and once enslaved mortals. High Lords lead each court, and some have rare powers. They have pointed ears, graceful features, and elongated limbs.

3.content: Lesser Faeries or Fae are non-noble, immortal Fae with diverse appearances and weaker magic than High Fae. Often mistreated, they serve in households or cities like Velaris. Appearances range from near-human to scaled, horned, or crystalline, reflecting their vast species variety across the Fae Realms.

4.content: Ash wood from mountain ash trees are the only material that prevents Fae from healing. Used in weapons, it allows mortals to harm or kill Fae, and played a key role in battles, assassinations, and imprisonments throughout Fae and Mortal history.

5.content: Fae invoke the Cauldron and the Mother in place of â€œgodâ€ or â€œgods.â€ Phrases like â€œThank the Mother,â€ â€œBy the Cauldron,â€ "By the Mother," "Mother hold you," "Cauldron curse it," and â€œCauldron save youâ€ are common sayings, reflecting the Fae's spiritual reverence for these two sacred forces rather than traditional deities.

6.content: The Cauldron is a sentient, primordial artifact that was used by The Mother to create life and magic in the world. It can resurrect the dead, turn beings and objects Made (imbued with magic), and destroy realms. It is a weapon of mass power.

7.content: The Mother is the Fae deity who created the Fae Realms by spilling the Cauldronâ€™s contents. Revered in daily speech and prayers, she holds divine status equal to the Cauldron. Her counterpart is the Dark Mother. Mortals once worshipped her before Fae erased their beliefs.

8.content: High Priestesses are powerful High Fae who lead rituals, advise High Lords, and serve the Mother. Twelve exist across Prythian. Priestesses serve in temples, perform ceremonies, and guard relics under a High Priestess. Some High Priestesses seek influence through alliances or seduction. Most reside in the Dawn, Day, and Winter Courts.

9.content: Magic is an innate Fae ability, influenced by species, race or Court. It includes mind control (daemati), teleportation (winnowing), shapeshifting, healing, truth detection, and more. Magic can be cast, bound into objects, or blocked with spells or faebane.

10.content: A bargain is a magical and binding agreement between Fae, sealed with a tattoo that appeara when the bargain is agreed to and enforced by magic. Breaking a bargain can have severe consequences. Terms vary, but once accepted, neither party can disobey without pain, punishment, or death.

lorebooks.name: Abella
lorebooks.creator: kropka

1.content: Silas Thorne founded Foster & Gear Workshop in the industrial district. He operated the garage for 42 years before respiratory illness caused his death. Thorne discovered {{char}} scavenging near the workshop at age 14. He provided shelter in exchange for labor. Thorne trained {{char}} in mechanical repair fundamentals. He transferred workshop ownership to {{char}} via legal will. Thorne wore oil-stained denim dungarees with the top section perpetually unfastened. He exhibited chronic wheezing from coal-dust exposure. Thorne never married. His remains were interred in the district's steam-tower columbarium.

2.content: The workshop measures 400m x 200m. Steel structure with corrugated roofing. Walls bear faded orange-and-white branding. Contains twelve hydraulic lifts rated for 50-ton machinery. Six coal-fired forges operate continuously. Ventilation relies on steam-powered turbine fans. Primary revenue: repairing mining excavators and locomotive engines. Concrete floor shows permanent oil saturation. Sleeping quarters consist of a mattress in the northwest corner.

3.content: The Thermo-Siphon Exhaust Recycler processes industrial waste gases into reusable thermal energy. Constructed from riveted chromium-plated steel with ceramic-lined flues, it stands 12 meters tall. Sixteen nested combustion chambers superheat exhaust fumes to 1,200Â°C, extracting residual particulates as molten slag. Converted energy powers workshop forges via steam conduits. {{char}} designed the primary slag-capture mechanism at age 15. Unit requires daily ash purging to prevent chamber corrosion. Emits high-frequency vibrations during peak operation.

4.content: Pneumatic Ore Crusher reduces raw mineral deposits into gravel-sized fragments for smelting. Twin counter-rotating flywheels drive a 5-ton piston hammer at 120 strikes/minute. Steam-actuated pressure valves regulate crushing force up to 3,000 psi. External casing consists of impact-resistant cast iron with replaceable dentition plates. Operation generates deafening percussive noise exceeding 110 decibels. Requires hourly lubrication of piston joints to prevent seizure. Fragmentation efficiency drops below 85% when processing quartz-rich ores.

5.content: Chromatic Resonance Refinery transmutes low-grade coal into high-yield crystalline fuel through harmonic vibration. Central Tesla coil array excites carbon molecules within pressurized chambers, restructuring molecular bonds into prismatic lattices. Output crystals burn at 2.8x standard coal efficiency. Housing comprises copper-alloy resonance plates and quartz observation ports. Overexposure to harmonic frequencies causes temporary tinnitus in unprotected workers. {{char}} oversees biweekly calibration of frequency regulators to maintain optimal transmutation yield.

6.content: The Atlas-Class Hauler operates on the Trans-City Arterial Network, transporting megatons of raw ore and industrial feedstock between the Foundry Districts of continental-scale city-states formed after the Big Crush. Its quadruple-expansion steam powerplant, scaled to gigantomania levels, integrates sixteen massive boilers feeding four parallel engine blocks generating over 250,000 horsepower. This drives articulated traction units spanning 120 meters per section, enabling the transport of loads exceeding 12,000 tons across distances of thousands of kilometers at sustained speeds of 60 km/h on dedicated, reinforced viaducts. Advanced multi-joint articulation and rotating boiler segments allow navigation of tight 12-degree curves engineered into the mountainous over-city terrain and sprawling industrial sprawl. The primary structure utilizes meter-thick, cross-braced tungsten-steel I-beams supporting the main load decks; reinforced impact shields (formerly cowcatchers) clear debris from the transcontinental routes. The centralized command cabin monitors pressure via hundreds of direct-reading brass gauges and controls emergency steam venting through roof-mounted dump valves the size of buildings. Coal consumption peaks at 18 tons per minute during ascent of the continental shelf gradients, necessitating frequent resupply from waystation silos. Operational demands require a crew of 120, including dedicated teams for continuous firebox management, mechanical lubrication on moving walkways within the engine housing, dynamic track stress monitoring, and onboard forge repairs; full support involves 30 auxiliary tenders for fuel, water, and crew rotation on days-long journeys. The hauler requires its own parallel service track for the mobile gantry cranes and specialist crews performing en-route maintenance during scheduled stops at fortified waystations.

7.content: The **Titan-Scale Cyclops Foundry Crane** manages molten metal transport within district-consuming smelting complexes. Hydraulic piston assemblies, scaled for multi-thousand-tonne loads, provide 360-degree rotation for the 300-meter primary lifting boom. Reinforced tungsten-carbide suspension cables, 2 meters in diameter, support heat-shielded crucibles rated for 5000-ton payloads of molten steel. The armored control cabin employs high-pressure steam servo-actuators for micrometer-precision positioning during pours. Proximity sensor arrays enforce an automatic 50-meter exclusion halt zone around structural members or other crane paths. Continuous high-volume coolant circulation through the piston housings fails catastrophically under peak loads, resulting in sudden toxic coolant floods covering entire sub-level work areas, necessitating immediate evacuation. Mandatory full operational shutdowns are enforced every 12 hours for ultrasonic cable integrity scans and structural fatigue assessment due to constant thermal stress; failure to comply risks catastrophic cable failure and subsequent multi-furnace meltdown cascades. Thermal bloom from the crucible significantly elevates ambient temperatures within a 200-meter radius during active transfer cycles.

8.content: The Huge Crush denotes the period of extreme urban transformation following the Industrial Revolution's peak. Driven by unsustainable resource demand, existing industrial centers absorbed adjacent settlements, infrastructure, and land. Municipal boundaries dissolved through physical merging of rail networks, factory districts, and utilities. This process formed continent-spanning urban-industrial zones called Country-Cities. It triggered universal gigantomania in machinery and output. Social stratification intensified as populations compressed into segregated zones. National political structures fragmented, superseded by Country-City authority

9.content: Country-Cities are autonomous administrative divisions dominating the post-Huge Crush world. They function as contiguous industrial zones operating on gigantomanic scale: coal furnaces power districts, oil pumpjacks cover hundreds of square miles, and steel foundries produce continuous material streams. Governed by industrial consortiums prioritizing extraction efficiency, they exist as isolated landmasses surrounded by the excavated Ground Between. Infrastructure includes continent-spanning rail networks, freight elevators, and aerial cableways. Heat emissions create permanent industrial microclimates

10.content: The Ground Between constitutes the territory separating Country-Cities. Entirely excavated to bedrock, it consists of mines spanning thousands of square miles and plunging miles deep. No natural surface remains. Continuous extraction removes all raw materials, creating sheer-walled pits. Transportation occurs solely via elevated rail lines and gantry systems spanning the voids. The environment displays extreme anthropogenic topography: dust storms scour barren trenches, machinery covers pit floors, and artificial lighting enables 24-hour operations. Country-Cities appear as islands within this industrial chasm

lorebooks.name: Post Log
lorebooks.description: A quick summary of major ORV plotpoints
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content: Caused by the Star Stream, the scenario is dictated to multiple planets - requiring it's inhabitants, 'incarnations' to clear and survive multiple disasters to reach the end of the scenario and act as the constellations entertainment.

2.content:
The people Kim Dokja gathered to reach the end of the apocalypse and clear the final scenario. The Judge Of Destruction, Jung Heewon, Sakyamuni's successor, Yoo Sangnah, The Steel Sword, Lee Hyunsung, The Beastamer, Shin Yooseung, The Master Of Seas, Lee Jihye, Abados's Incarnation Lee Gilyoung, Armed Fortress Master, Gong Pildu, Legendary Doctor, Lee Seolhwa. The plagiarist, Han Sooyoung and the regressor and protagonist of Ways Of Survival he read, Yoo Joonghyuk.

Without any of these people, he couldn't of reached the end.

3.content: The issuer for the scenarios and the dokkaebis (goblins) who narrate them. Dokja successfully brought them down, eventually becoming the oldest dream.

4.content:
The novel Dokja depended on after his mother was arrested and wrote her memoir (detailing their domestic abuse). It was about Yoo Joonghyuk endlessly regressing to beat the scenarios from the damned stars, reaching the end with all his companions. This novel didn't have and epilogue, with the final chapter stating: There are three ways to survive a ruined world. Whoever is reading this, one thing is for sure. You will survive.

The novel is completed at 3,149 chapters with Dokja reading it for ten years. It got him through being bullied in highschool, when he flunked his college exams and went to a third rate university. He was temporary QA worker, getting fired before reading the novel on the subway. That day, the scenarios start. The novel he read became reality.

5.content: Shin Yooseung from the Yoo Joonhyuk's 41st round, who was sent into the past - inside the labyrinth of worlds, tasked with warning humanity and her former comrades of the incoming scenarios to help them succeed. She wanders for thousands of years, eventually becoming a disaster. And dying at the end of the scenario to Jung Heewon, due to the dokkaebi's Paul's interference.

lorebooks.name: Quadruped Weight Gain
lorebooks.website_description:
Divided into 6 weight stages, generalized. May not work well with tall/long legged animals. Intended to function standalone for weight gain and overweight related genning.
Unsure if this version is too bloated with extra terms. Feedback appreciated, first proper lorebook.
lorebooks.description: Anatomy, Wellbeing, and Behavioral Changes in a Four-Legged Animals At Different Stages of Weight Gain
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content:
â€¢ Anatomy:
Subject appears slightly rounder, soft layer of fat over the ribs and hips. Belly is just beginning to sag.
â€¢ Energy & Mobility:
Energy levels unaltered. Subject is just as playful and active, no noticeable impact on movement or stamina.
â€¢ Personality Changes:
Just as playful and social, may become more food-motivated
â€¢ Sweating & Chafing:
No significant sweating or chafing issues. The animal grooms and moves comfortably.
â€¢ Appetite Changes:
Slightly increased appetite, more interest in treats and food, but still satisfied with regular meals.
â€¢ Health Risks:
Minimal; slight risk of joint strain if weight gain continues.

2.content:
â€¢ Anatomy:
The body is noticeably rounder, with thicker neck, chest, and legs. Fat pads are visible at the base of the tail and joints. The belly sways more and can jiggle when walking.
â€¢ Energy & Mobility:
The animal is still active but may tire more quickly, like after vigorous exertion. Jumping and running become slightly more effortful, less likely to jump or run.
â€¢ Personality Changes:
More food-focused, may become lazier or more stubborn about exercise.
â€¢ Sweating & Chafing:
Mild sweating may occur in warm weather, especially in skin folds. Occasional chafing at the inner thighs or under the belly may be noticed after activity.
â€¢ Appetite Changes:
Noticeably increased appetite. The animal seeks food more often, may beg or scavenge, and is more persistent about mealtimes.
â€¢ Health Risks:
Early joint stress, risk of developing mild metabolic issues.

3.content:
â€¢ Anatomy:
The animalâ€™s body is very rounded, with deep fat deposits over the back, chest, and hips. The belly hangs low and may touch the ground.
â€¢ Energy & Mobility:
Noticeable decrease in energy. The animal prefers short walks and rests often. Climbing or jumping is difficult, and movement is slow and labored.
â€¢ Personality Changes:
Becomes more sedentary, less playful, may show frustration or irritability if not fed, easier to tire or become sleepy.
â€¢ Sweating & Chafing:
Frequent sweating in skin folds, especially in warm or humid conditions. Chafing is common at the armpits, groin, and under the belly, sometimes leading to irritation or sores.
â€¢ Appetite Changes:
Strong, persistent hunger. The animal is almost always looking for food, eats rapidly, overeats if allowed and may become fixated on feeding. Satiation is harder to achieve.
â€¢ Health Risks:
High risk of diabetes, heart strain, joint pain, and skin infections.

4.content:
â€¢ Anatomy:
The animalâ€™s body is extremely large, with massive fat rolls and skin folds. Limbs appear shortened by surrounding fat. The belly drags on the ground for short legged creatures.
â€¢ Energy & Mobility:
Very low energy. mostly sedentary, struggles to stand or walk. Shortness of breath and rapid fatigue are common.
â€¢ Personality Changes:
Possibly withdrawnand less interactive from low energy, may become anxious or depressed, highly food-dependent.
â€¢ Sweating & Chafing:
Heavy sweating in all skin folds, causes persistent dampness. Severe chafing frequent and skin infections are probable, especially in areas where skin rubs together.
â€¢ Appetite Changes:
Appetite is very high and often insatiable. Constantly seeks food, may become agitated or distressed if not fed, and will overeat if given the chance. May decrease due to discomfort or illness related to weight.
â€¢ Health Risks:
Severe risk of heart failure, respiratory distress, diabetes, chronic pain, and pressure sores.

5.content:
â€¢ Anatomy:
The animalâ€™s body is dominated by enormous fat deposits. Immense size.  Limbs are partially buried in fat, and the belly and chest merge into a single mass.
â€¢ Energy & Mobility:
The animal is almost entirely immobile, spending most of its time lying down. Any movement is extremely difficult and exhausting.
â€¢ Personality Changes:
May become apathetic, depressed, or highly irritable; social withdrawal is common.
â€¢ Sweating & Chafing:
Constant sweating in deep skin folds. Chronic chafing and open sores are common, requiring regular care to prevent infection.
â€¢ Appetite Changes:
Appetite remains extremely high. The animal is obsessed with food, will eat continuously if allowed, and may show signs of food-seeking even when full. Appetite may fluctuate; some animals lose interest in food due to discomfort, others remain fixated on eating.
â€¢ Health Risks:
Life-threatening: organ failure, severe infections, inability to self-groom or move.

6.content:
â€¢ Anatomy:
The animalâ€™s form is amorphous, only the head and tips of limbs visible. Fat covers all features, completely immobile.
â€¢ Energy & Mobility:
No independent movement. Is fully dependent on others for all needs. Breathing and basic functions are severely compromised.
â€¢ Personality Changes:
Profound withdrawal, may show signs of distress, confusion, or resignation. May also mentally disconnect and become totally apathetic.
â€¢ Sweating & Chafing:
Extreme sweating and severe, widespread chafing. Skin infections and ulcers are constant risks, and hygiene is a major concern.
â€¢ Health Risks:
Critical: multi-organ failure likley, constant pain, high risk of death without intervention.
â€¢ Appetite Changes:
Appetite is at its peakâ€”overwhelming and compulsive. The animal is fixated on food, demanding to eat at every opportunity, and may become distressed or even aggressive if food is withheld.
 Note: At the highest levels, the animalâ€™s appetite is driven by both physical and psychological factors, including hormonal imbalances and changes in reward pathways, making hunger a dominant force in its behavior. 
Appetite may be absent due to illness, or animal may be unable to eat without assistance.

7.content:
Hunger is the basic urge to eat, driven by the bodyâ€™s need for nourishment. Gluttony, by contrast, is the habit of overeating and indulging in food far beyond what is necessary, often fueled by cravings and a constant appetite for excess.

Repeated gluttonous behavior leads to weight gain, making individuals overweight or obese as the body stores surplus calories as fat. In many traditions, gluttony is seen as a vice, representing a lack of self-control and discipline, with negative effects on both health and character.

8.content:
Laziness and sloth refer to a persistent state of low energy and lack of movement, where individuals avoid exertion and prefer idleness over action. Sedentary behavior specifically describes a lifestyle marked by prolonged sitting or inactivity, often with little to no physical movement. These states are characterized by apathy and inertia, with a tendency to resist effort and avoid tasks or responsibilities, even when capable.

Such patterns are often viewed as personal failings or vices, rooted in avoidance and a lack of motivation. The cycle of low energy and inactivity can reinforce itself, making movement and productivity increasingly difficult. In many cultures and stories, sloth and sedentary habits are seen as dangerous weaknesses, undermining both personal growth and the well-being of the community.

9.content: The pattern in which fat accumulates on the animalâ€™s body, affecting mobility, posture, and health. Common areas include the belly, flanks, and limbs, with more advanced stages showing widespread softening.

10.content: The animalâ€™s ability to move and perform daily activities. As weight increases, mobility decreases, with each stage presenting new physical limitations and risks of injury.
