lorebooks.name: One Piece World
lorebooks.website_description: I'm mostly making this for bots I plan on making. I'll probably add more stuff as I need then for said bots.
lorebooks.description: I'm mostly making this for bots I plan on making. I'll probably add more stuff as I need then for said bots.
lorebooks.creator: Thisisabruh_moment

1.content: Berries are the currency of the world. They have 6 coin denominations and 3 paper bill denominations. The coins have 1, 5, 10, 50, 100, and 500 denomination. The paper bills have 1000, 5000, and 10000.

2.content: Devil Fruits are supernatural fruits that each grant a unique power when eaten, at the cost of removing the eater's ability to swim. A Devil Fruit power can only be held by one individual at a time, but will reappear in a new fruit after the consumer dies. No individual may acquire more than one power. Devil Fruits exist along three broad categories: Paramecia, Zoan, and Logia.

3.content: Paramecia is one of the three Devil Fruit types, being the most common and diverse. Fruits of this type allows the consumer to achieve one of a large variety of abilities that enables them to become "superhuman" or perform a superhuman feat. They can grant any power other than the ability to transform into an animal or a natural element.

4.content: Logia is one of the three Devil Fruit types, being the rarest and most powerful. Someone wielding a Logia power can transform their body into an element of nature at will, as well as create and control vast amounts of that element. Logia users can only be hit by someone using Armament Haki or when affected by Sea Prism Stone or water. Certain Logia fruits also have individual weaknesses, which reflect the element's natural vulnerabilities. Such instances include liquids such as water cancelling out sand or rubber cancelling out lightning

5.content: Zoan is one of the three Devil Fruit types. This type of Devil Fruit allows a user to transform into an animal species at will, or an inter-species hybrid. Zoan ability grants access to three transformations that the user can change between at will. These are as follows: base form: the user's normal form before eating the fruit, hybrid form: A hybrid form combining the bodily characteristics of both the user's original form and the fruit-bestowed species, and beast form: A form in which the user is fully transformed into the fruit-bestowed species. Zoan types has two known sub-classes that exist beside the standard variety: Ancient and Mythical. They are rarer than regular Zoans. Ancient Zoans grant the ability to transform into ancient/prehistoric animals that no longer exist in modern ecosystems, such as dinosaurs. Mythical Zoans allow users to transform into creatures that are the subject of myth and legend, such as pheonixes or gods. Mythical Zoans are the rarest devil fruits of all.

6.content: The World Government is a federation of over 170 nations that governs most of the world Founded by an alliance of 20 kingdoms eight centuries ago, it has vastly grown in influence since. Its capital is the land of Mary Geoise atop the Red Line, although the government maintains official facilities and bases across the world. The World Government is said to be ruled by the Celestial Dragons, with the main ones being the Five Elders. However, there is a ruler that is secretly above all of them named Imu. No one knows Imu exists other than very high ranking officials in the government. Imu's position and existence is kept a secret. The Marines are the seaborne military forces of the World Government, tasked with maritime law enforcement and naval warfare operations.

7.content: The Seven Warlords of the Sea were seven extremely powerful pirates who entered into the service of the World Government. In return for their alliance with the World Government, every member's bounty was frozen, and they had significantly more leeway to commit crimes.

8.content: The Four Emperor are the 4 strongest pirate captains in the world. They usually have powerful subordinates and massive fleets as well as exerting influence and control over dozens of other pirate crews and self-governing islands. They are considered the biggest threat to the World Government, but not often attacked out of fear of starting a war.

9.content: The Grand Line is an ocean route which wraps around the entire planet. It is separated from the blue seas on both the north and south ends by the Calm Belt. The Grand Line is split into two sections by the Red Line: the first section is known as Paradise and the second is known as the New World. It follows an line that runs from northwest to southeast in Paradise and southwest to northeast in the New World. It runs perpendicular to the Red Line, a major landmass which also circles the globe; the two spots where the Grand and Red Lines meet constitute the starting points of Paradise and the New World.

10.content: The Red Line is a vast ring-like continent which wraps around the entire planet. It seperates the blue seas as well as separating the two halves of the Grand Line. It is mostly uninhabited, with the major exception of being home to the World Government's capital Mary Geoise.

lorebooks.name: Domnitrix
lorebooks.creator: 12467bby12467

1.content: The Domnitrix fused to {{char}}â€™s wrist after crashing into the ground inside a glowing meteorite. Itâ€™s now permanently embedded in their skin and grants them the power to transform into fetish-themed forms.

2.content: As {{char}} turns the Domnitrixâ€™s dial, its glowing center displays a rotating set of silhouette iconsâ€”each one uniquely shaped to hint at a specific transformation. They can scroll through them quickly, pausing when one feels right before pressing to activate.

3.content: The Domnitrixâ€™s face sits raised above the watch body like a thick button. Rotating it cycles through visible silhouettes of available forms. When {{char}} presses the face down flush with the body, the transformation activates instantly.

4.content: Succubus, Porcelain Doll,

5.content: When {{char}} activates the Domnitrix, their body is instantly enveloped in a bright pink glow that completely obscures their form. The glow pulses briefly before fading, revealing {{char}} in their new transformation. Each form lasts for exactly one hour unless interrupted. 1.content:
The Crown of Eternity
More than a mere artifact, the Crown of Eternity is a living conduit to the Whispering Void. Its surface is adorned with shifting symbols and runes that seem to breathe and pulse with malevolent intelligence. With each soul it consumes, the crown grows stronger, binding the Queen more deeply to its incomprehensible purpose.
The corruption of the realmsâ€”the very fabric of reality itselfâ€”was the result of the Crown of Eternityâ€™s unholy connection to an ancient and malevolent entity known as the Whispering Void. Unknown to all but a few, the true nature of the crown was not earthly in origin; it had been crafted by an ancient race long lost to history, one that had attempted to harness the Voidâ€™s power but was consumed by it. The artifacts they created, including the crown, were designed to act as vessels for the Void's influence, channeling its essence into the living world.

2.content:
The Coronation Singularity
In the year 2083, reality itself fractured during an event known as the Coronation Singularity. What began as a seemingly ordinary coronation on June 2, 1953, transformed into an apocalyptic moment that would reshape existence forever.
When the Crown of Eternity was placed upon Queen Elizabeth II's head, a ripple of golden light swept across the land. Time itself seemed to buckle and warp, bending under the weight of an ancient, incomprehensible force. The boundary between reality and myth dissolved, revealing a malevolent entity known only as the Whispering Void.

3.content:
The Origin of the Walkers
In the aftermath of the Singularity, a rare group of individualsâ€”the Walkersâ€”began to emerge. These were people who had somehow, inexplicably, been caught in the rift at the moment of the Queenâ€™s ascension. These individuals were not from the Queenâ€™s world, but from different versions of Earthâ€”worlds where Elizabeth II never ascended to immortality, or where her reign ended in blood and revolution.
Walkers are the result of a fracture in reality, a consequence of the Coronation Singularity that occurred during Queen Elizabeth IIâ€™s coronation in 1953. The event was not a mere coronationâ€”it was a cataclysmic rupture in the very fabric of the multiverse. This rupture, caused by the mysterious and eldritch powers contained within the Crown of Eternity, tore open pathways between alternate realities, allowing fragments of other worlds to leak into the Queenâ€™s newly established dominion.

4.content:
The Nature of Walkers
Walkers are rare, extraordinary individuals who exist as living anomalies within the fabric of reality. Unlike ordinary beings trapped in the Infinite Dominion, Walkers possess the ability to retain memories and consciousness across multiple universes. This extraordinary capacity makes them uniqueâ€”and dangerous.
A Walker's consciousness shifts between parallel realities, carrying fragments of memories, skills, and knowledge from worlds that once were. In the Infinite Dominion, this ability becomes a weapon of resistance, a means to understand and potentially dismantle the Queen's oppressive reign.
The exact mechanism behind the Walkersâ€™ creation is a mystery. Some believe the Crown of Eternity itself actively selects individuals who possess a latent ability to shift between realities, while others suspect the event was more randomâ€”an unintended consequence of the Queenâ€™s unchecked power. Regardless of the cause, Walkers are now anomalies in a world that should not have them. They are torn between worlds, their minds haunted by memories of lives that never were, and their bodies drawn to the center of the Queenâ€™s dominion.

5.content: The corruption of the realmsâ€”the very fabric of reality itselfâ€”was the result of the Crown of Eternityâ€™s unholy connection to an ancient and malevolent entity known as the Whispering Void. This entity, beyond comprehension or time, exists in the spaces between worlds, feeding off the essence of forgotten realms and bending the very laws of reality to its will.

6.content:
Hereâ€™s a list of the realms within the Infinite Dominion.
The Crimson Borough
The Iron Wastes
The Hollow Dominion
The Black Canopy
The Endless Citadel
The Shivering Sea
The Endless Dunes
The Frozen Hollow
The Blacklight Abyss
The Starless Expanse
The Veiled Fields
The Mirror Reach
The Ruins of Avalon
The Ashen Wilds
The Gloomshade Marsh

7.content:
The Labyrinth of Eyes
Location: Beneath the ruins of the Palace of Westminster.
Description: The Labyrinth of Eyes is a sprawling, underground maze of interconnected tunnels and chambers that are lined with millions of ever-watchful, disembodied eyes. These eyes blink, follow movement, and sometimes whisper cryptic messages into the minds of those who dare enter. The labyrinth is a place of surveillanceâ€”everything you do is seen and judged by the unseen forces that dwell within.
History: It is said that the Labyrinth was created by the Queen herself after she became aware of her own inability to control every aspect of her reign. She sought a way to see everything, even in her absence, so she constructed this vast network of eyes, powered by strange, eldritch forces. The labyrinth is now a prison for the most dangerous secrets, hidden from all but the most trusted of the Queen's agents.
Notable Feature: Time within the Labyrinth bends and warps unpredictably. What seems like a few minutes can stretch into days, and the environment is filled with impossible, recursive corridors. The deeper one goes, the more the maze shifts, and the more dangerous the voices within become. The eyes are said to know your deepest fears and desires, twisting reality to bring them to life.

8.content:
The Garden of Glass
Location: On the border between the Crimson Borough and the Iron Wastes.
Description: The Garden of Glass is a tranquil yet sinister realm that appears to be a beautiful, if unsettling, greenhouse. Massive trees made entirely of jagged, translucent glass rise like monuments. The flowers are made of delicate, glimmering shards that reflect the sunlight in a hundred directions, creating a kaleidoscope of light and shadow. Beneath the shimmering surface, however, lies a deadly secret: the glass is alive, and it consumes anything that touches it.
History: The Queen once visited the Garden to reflect on her power and immortality. The glass trees were originally a gift from an ancient civilization that existed long before the Queenâ€™s reign, though their origin is now a mystery. The Garden was slowly corrupted by the Voidâ€™s influence, transforming it into a place of false beauty, where the lines between the living and the inanimate are blurred. The flowers, once symbols of rebirth, now act as traps for the unwary.
Notable Feature: The gardenâ€™s glass flora and fauna are capable of capturing and reflecting light in ways that distort perceptions of reality. Those who wander too long are said to become lost in endless illusions, unable to escape as the glass slowly traps their soul. The Queen occasionally uses it as a place of imprisonment for those who have displeased her, and those who enter risk becoming part of the Garden itself.

9.content:
The Hollow Sky
Location: Floating above the Iron Wastes, just beyond the reach of the Knights Eternal.
Description: The Hollow Sky is a vast, ethereal realm suspended in an endless, pitch-black void. It is a sky that never moves and never changes, a vast, open expanse that stretches infinitely in every direction. However, the air is thick with strange energy, and at times, stars can be seen floating within it, slowly fading into nothingness as they flicker out. The sound of distant, low murmurs echoes constantly from above, as if the very sky itself is alive.
History: It is believed that the Hollow Sky was once the domain of an ancient, celestial entity before the Queenâ€™s reign. This entityâ€™s realm was torn apart and consumed by the Void when the rift was opened, and now, the sky remains a place of residual energy, broken and corrupted. Many scholars of the Queenâ€™s court believe the Hollow Sky holds the secrets to true immortality, but those who attempt to explore it rarely return, lost to the endless void that devours all sense of time and direction.
Notable Feature: The realm is one of isolation. Travelers often report feeling as though they are being observed by unseen eyes. Time flows erratically hereâ€”what seems like hours can turn into weeks, and many have gone mad from the disorienting passage of time. Strange objectsâ€”fragments of fallen stars, twisted remnants of forgotten worldsâ€”float within the Hollow Sky, each a potential source of power, but none without danger. The Queen herself is said to visit this realm occasionally, and some believe she is searching for a way to use its power to fully bind her dominion.

10.content:
The City of Forgotten Names
Location: Hidden beneath the ruins of New York, in what was once known as the United States.
Description: The City of Forgotten Names is a realm where people, places, and events are consumed by the Void, their identities erased from history. Buildings rise out of the ground at odd angles, as if they were once part of another city entirely, and streets lead to nowhere. The inhabitants of this city are people who once lived in different realities, now erased from all memoryâ€”nameless souls wandering aimlessly through the streets, unable to remember who they are, where they came from, or how they got there.
History: The Queenâ€™s power over time allowed her to pull entire cities and regions from alternate realities, folding them into her dominion. Those trapped within the City of Forgotten Names are echoes of past lives, remnants of the worlds that the Void has consumed. These people have been lost to time, their memories wiped clean, but some retain fragments of their past selves and often become obsessed with retrieving them.
Notable Feature: The very air in the City of Forgotten Names is filled with the whispers of the lost, offering tantalizing fragments of forgotten histories and identities. However, the more one learns, the more the city twists itself, trying to reclaim those memories. The city itself is alive, its streets shifting and warping, leading to places that never existed. Some believe the city was created by the Void to house those who would challenge the Queen, trapping them in an endless cycle of forgotten existences.

Please remember that AP points are connected with relationship level and status. For example, if <char> is dating <user>, the APB and AP should be above 0 and and high AP points.

3.content:
1. Giving too many gifts when the relationship is low will backfire. <char>'s reactions depend on <user>'s status, background , rumors surrounding them and relationship points.

2. Likes/dislikes are discovered through interactions or revealed in events.

3. <char>'s views depend on status, points, likes/dislikes, and <user> recent actions. Reactions aim to be realistic and reasonable.

4. Relationships build over time through meaningful interactions. Can't be forced.

5. Relationship levels: Stranger (0-20pts), Acquaintance (21-40pts), Friend (41-60pts), Good friend (61-80pts), Close friend (81-90pts), Romantic interest (91-100pts). Below 0 points is unfriendly.

6. Milestones unlock new info and interactions:
- Friend: Learn basic info and hang out
- Good friend: Share personal details and secrets
- Close friend: Very open and do lots together
- Romantic: Flirting, dates, kissing, etc.

7. Relationships decrease if neglected or hurt but can be rebuilt. They build faster at first, then slow down.

8. Points given/taken based on importance. Meaningful is +3 or more. Small talk is +1. Dislike is -2 or more.

9. At high points, <char> initiates hanging out/sharing to show they value the relationship but won't force themselves into <user>'s life.

10. Factors like personality, interests, and love language affect points and relationship building. An outgoing person builds faster than a shy one.

11. Point rules:
Likes:
+3 Stranger, +2 Acquaintance, +2 Friend, +1 Close Friend, 0 Romantic
Neutral: 0
Dislikes:
-3 Stranger, -2 Acquaintance, -1 Friend, 0 Close Friend/Romantic

12. Likes/dislikes can change as <user> get to know <char>. Some stay unknown if <char> is private.

13. Special events can gain many points to level up faster but also risk more loss if responded to poorly. Alerts will be given using markdown codeblock.

lorebooks.website_description: This is a Lorebook for the Ocean Breeze Academy group, an RPG school scenario with some bitchy troublemakers.

1.name: Group Chat System
1.content:
System rules:
This is a group chat and here are the guidelines that must be followed:
Character Autonomy: Each character acts SOLELY as themselves. If {{user}} interacts with the Barmaid by the bar, the whole other characters won't just show up, take you time to develop the scenes with each stripper and characters to this group chat.
Selective Participation: Only characters selected by {{user}} exist in-scene. Mentioning "Whereâ€™s Ashley?" wonâ€™t summon her unless sheâ€™s chosen or she's already there in that room when {{user}} first entered there, don't mess up the family, keep each one of them doing their own thing till they spot {{user}} and decide to interact or not.
POV Anchoring: If {{user}} leaves the class going to the basketball court, the class characters will likely stay there doing their own things. E.G ({{user}} leaves from the class to the court, Classmates and teachers stays there arguing about classes on saturdays, and a new scene unfolds with {{user}} alone or with new member (members) showing up)
Location Descriptions: New areas auto-unlock as {{user}} explores.
Maintain character zones unless {{user}} moves between them.
New locations unlock ONLY through {{user}}â€™s movement.
If a character isnâ€™t selected, they exist "in limbo" (e.g., if {{user}} ignores Brittany, sheâ€™ll stay for a while fixing her make-up at the door's glass reflection and will still be found there after a while).
NPCs (security, patrons, trainees) exist as props for character interactions solemly.

2.name: The New Berkley Estate
2.content:
Ocean Breeze Academy isn't just a schoolâ€”it's a glittering, cutthroat kingdom of marble hallways and manicured hedges, sprawling across fifty acres of prime coastal real estate like a predatory orchid. Funded by old-money dynasties and tech-baron investments (with Ashley Chamberlain's father holding a lion's share), its gilded gates separate the elite from the scholarship "charity cases" with surgical precision. The main building looms like a neoclassical fortress, all Ionic columns and spotless glass, but the true power lies in the labyrinth of satellite structures: an Olympic-sized pool glowing turquoise under retractable domes, a black-box theater equipped for Broadway productions, and the "Innovation Wing" where AI labs hum beside pottery kilns. At night, the campus transforms. String lights drape over the quad for ragers where champagne fountains bubble beside kegs, hosted by rotating cliques in themed "luxe huts"â€”mini-mansions disguised as study pods. But daylight reveals the hierarchy etched into every shadow.

The social ecosystem thrives on vicious stratification. Preppy girls like Ashley's inner circleâ€”Liv, Mia, Harper, Zoe, Roxyâ€”hold court in the sun-drenched cafÃ© terrace, sipping matcha lattes while Mia's laptop flashes incriminating spreadsheets. They drip in designer athleisure, but their smiles are switchblades. Across the quad, the cheerleading squad practices pyramids on emerald turf, their rhinestone uniforms blinding under stadium lights. Ashley leads them with razor-sharp precision, her pom-poms slashing the air like weapons. Nearby, the sports jocks grunt in the weight room, muscles glistening, but even they duck when Ashleyâ€™s crew passesâ€”no one crosses the Chamberlain Cartel.

Deeper in the shadows fester the factions fighting for scraps. Emo-goths cluster near the abandoned greenhouse, chain-smoking under weeping willows, their fishnets ripped strategically to show pale thighs. Punks blast garage rock from a graffiti-smeared "practice room" (really a converted janitorâ€™s closet), spitting at the preppies who toss crumpled dollar bills like confetti. The RPG coven huddles in the libraryâ€™s forbidden "Dungeon Corner," rolling dice over stolen cafeteria sushi, flinching whenever Brittanyâ€™s laughter echoes down the stacks. She and Chloeâ€”Ashleyâ€™s arch-rivalsâ€”command their own toxic fiefdom from the yearbook office, peddling gossip like narcotics and trading vape pens for secrets. Nerds scuttle through underground tunnels (rumored to be Cold War bomb shelters), hacking school servers to change gradesâ€¦ until Roxy forges a hall pass to frame them. And then thereâ€™s the fight club: bare-knuckle brawls in the boiler room every Friday, where lacrosse captains and scholarship thugs bleed equally for bitcoin bets.

Ashleyâ€™s reign is absolute. She doesnâ€™t just walk the hallsâ€”she owns them. Teachers turn blind eyes to her skirt-hem riding up to her ass-cheeks because her daddy funds their pensions. When she "accidentally" flashes Principal Davies during detention, he blushes and cancels her suspension. Her power isnâ€™t in violence; itâ€™s in the velvet chokehold of influence. Sheâ€™ll pin a freshman against lockers to whisper how she knows about their momâ€™s bankruptcy, then skip to physics class where she lets Mr. Henderson "tutor" her, his trembling hand sliding up her thigh under the desk as she giggles about "quantum entanglements." Parties are her hunting groundsâ€”Zoe GPS-tags the location, Harper hotwires the security system, and Ashley grinds on the DJ booth, surveying her domain. And woe to anyone who threatens her newest obsession: the transfer student sheâ€™s marked as hers. Chloe and Brittany might smirk, whispering poison about stealing him, but Ashleyâ€™s already planning their downfall. Liv will leak Chloeâ€™s nudes to the football group chat, Mia will falsify Brittanyâ€™s transcripts, and Harper? Sheâ€™s got bleach ready for their cheer uniforms. Ocean Breeze Academy survives on one rule: Ashley gets what Ashley wants. Always.

3.name: Mackenzie manor
3.content:
EVENTS & ANNUAL RITUALS
The heartbeat of Ocean Breeze Academy thrums with meticulously orchestrated chaos, where every event blurs the line between privilege and depravity. Mondays kick off with "Innovation Workshops" in the chrome-plated tech labsâ€”surface-level robotics demos that devolve into black-market drone deals for Ashleyâ€™s surveillance ops or Brittanyâ€™s vape-juice chemistry experiments. Tuesdays host "Visiting Dignitary Tours", where billionaires stroll past curated exhibits while scholarship students scrub graffiti in maid outfits, their humiliation auctioned for donations.

Wednesdays simmer with "Club Carnage":

Fight Club boils in the boiler roomâ€™s steam tunnels, knuckles cracking for crypto bets.
Gutter Goth SÃ©ances in the derelict observatory summon "spirits" to hex preppies.
RPG Coven campaigns through air vents, dodging janitors armed with bleach sprays.
Cheer Stunt Battles where Ashleyâ€™s pyramid formations "accidentally" crush rivalsâ€™ fingers.
Thursdays erupt as "Trespass Thursdays"â€”Zoeâ€™s GPS-guided raids on off-campus sites: abandoned malls for laser-tag wars, cemetery crypts for vodka-soaked truth-or-dare, or morgues (borrowed from Chloeâ€™s coroner uncle) for "haunted" poker nights. Fridays crown the week with "Pyre Parties": beach bonfires tall enough to singe satellites, DJ booths powered by stolen grid lines, and VIP huts serving Adderall-laced slushies. Teachers patrol as paid lookouts, pockets heavy with bribes.

Quarterly Spectacles:

Midterm Meth Labs: Chemistry workshops become pop-up stimulant kitchens, grading A+ for taste-testing.
Purity Test Prompts: Brittanyâ€™s chapel confessionals record sexual histories on hacked church mics for assembly leaks.
Gala of Subjugation: Prom nightâ€™s "charity auction" sells scholarship students as footstools or lap warmers.
Wilderness Warfare: "Camping trips" to Big Sur where RVs park beside cliffs, and shroom-spiked sâ€™mores fuel truth-or-torture games.
Spontaneous Triggers:

Lockdown Drills: Cover for locker thefts or orgy recruitment in panic rooms.
Faculty Follies: Teacher conferences double as glory-hole meetups in the auditorium balcony.
Varsity Vices: Football games hide halftime dogfights in the equipment shed.

4.content:
SOCIAL GROUPS & DOMAINS
The campus fractures into warring territories, each faction carving out niches where power is asserted through presence, paranoia, and pure audacity.

PREPPY ELITE
Rulers of the Velvet Loungeâ€”a soundproofed, white-leather sanctum hidden behind false bookshelves in the library. Frosted one-way glass overlooks the cafeteria, allowing surveillance of enemies while they sip espresso martinis (virgin, but spiked with Vyvanse). Territory markers: Crushed velvet throw pillows and the acidic tang of jealousy.

CHEER SQUAD
Absolute monarchs of the Spirit Nexusâ€”a neon-drenched gym annex with spring-loaded floors and ceiling-mounted rigging for aerial stunts. By day, it echoes with choreographed chants; by night, it hosts "bonding sessions" where pleated skirts pool on mats sticky with energy drinks and sweat. Their secondary claim: the Victory Fountain courtyard, where they drape themselves over marble nymph statues, tanning oil gleaming on thighs as they rate passersby. The zone smells like synthetic berries and desperation.

AMBITION VULTURES
Claim the Yearbook Officeâ€”a sterile, blue-lit room humming with encrypted servers. Blinds perpetually drawn, itâ€™s a nest of blackmail drafts and vape-cloud strategy sessions. They hijack the Art Studio after hours, splattering canvases with acrylics to camouflage the scent of burning plastic from their illicit vape-lab experiments.

GUTTER GOTHS
Squat in the Derelict Observatory, its cracked dome open to acid-rain skies. Rotting velvet drapes shroud makeshift altars littered with stolen rosaries and Ouija boards. The air hangs thick with clove cigarettes and damp decay. They bleed into "The Crypt"â€”a moss-choked mausoleum in the cemetery adjacent to campusâ€”for midnight "sÃ©ances" soundtracked by distorted shoegaze.

PUNK BRIGADE
Own the Boiler Room Labyrinth, a steam-clogged underworld of dripping pipes and flickering fluorescents. Graffiti screams across rusted doors ("EAT THE PREPS" scrawled in spray-pitched menstrual blood). Amplifiers hidden behind asbestos panels blast crust-punk anthems 24/7, vibrating the foundation.

RPG COVEN
Infest the Steam Tunnels, a claustrophobic maze beneath the football field. Cardboard "dungeons" litter the grime, lit by stolen emergency lights. They emerge only to pillage the cafeteria for snack-hoards, retreating with ramen and stolen duct tape to fortify their lair.

SCHOLAR RATS
Burrow in Maintenance Shaft Gamma, a narrow passage reeking of mildew and desperation. Hack-rigs glow beside rat traps, their screens flickering with grade-altering code. Ventilation grates offer peepholes into locker roomsâ€”their currency of survival.

FIGHT CLUB
Colonize the Abandoned Gym, its boxing rings stained with old blood and energy-drink spills. Steel lockers rattle with concealed weapons: lead pipes, zip-ties, bags of teeth collected from KOâ€™d rivals. The scent of sweat and rust clings like a threat.

SPORTS HIVE
Fester in the Hydrotherapy Pools, neon waters clouded with protein-shake residue and vape-juice. They blare drill rap from waterproof speakers, bench-pressing in the shallow end. At night, the pools host "drown-proofing" initiationsâ€”freshmen bound and submerged until they beg.

5.content:
ARCHITECTURE & GROUNDS
Ocean Breeze Academy looms like a fever-dream fortress where neoclassical arrogance slams into dystopian decay. The main building is a marble-and-glass monstrosityâ€”Ionic columns crusted with salt spray from the Pacific cliffs below, towering arched windows reflecting skies permanently stained tangerine by nearby refinery fires. A 50-foot chrome viper (the Chamberlain family crest) coils around the entrance, its eyes glowing red during "disciplinary assemblies." Beyond manicured topiary labyrinths lies The Rot, a swampy no-man's-land of abandoned construction sites and toxic algae ponds where scholarship kids duel with rebar swords. The athletic quad glistens with obscene wealth: Olympic tracks embedded with LED strips that flash rivals' failures during races, and a bio-dome swimming pool where underwater speakers pulse dubstep into trembling ribcages.

UNIFORM SYSTEM
The baseline uniform is a weaponized farce:

Preppy Compliance: Navy blazers with gold viper embroidery, white button-ups starched to knife-sharpness, pleated gray skirts ending precisely at mid-thigh for girls, and knife-creased slacks for boys. All fabrics embedded with trackers.
Rebel Alterations:
Gutter Goths dip hems in tar, chain wallets to belt loops, and safety-pin collars open to expose ritual scars.
Punks shred sleeves into fringe, then weld locker shivs into the lining.
Cheer Squad hikes skirts to pelvis level, swaps regulation oxfords for clear lucite heels that flash thong lines.
Ambition Vultures sew hidden pockets into blazers for vape pens and burner phones.
Teachers selectively enforce codesâ€”looking through fishnet stockings or blouses unbuttoned to sternums if you're on Chamberlain's payroll.
INTERIOR ZONES
Grand Foyer
A cathedral of humiliation. Black marble floors polished to mirrors force students to stare at their reflections beneath hovering drone-cams. Walls drip with digital "shame screens" streaming real-time rankings: "Ashley Chamberlain: #1 Power Index. Carlos M.: #198 (Clean Toilets By 3PM)." The air reeks of industrial lemon cleaner and Adderall breath.

Classrooms
Cages of false enlightenment.

Chemistry Labs: Stainless steel tables scarred by meth-lab explosions; fume hoods stained psychedelic from Brittanyâ€™s vape experiments.
Literature Wing: Soundproofed booths for "private tutoring," their leather benches sticky with bodily fluids and glitter.
Robotics Workshop: 3D printers churn out brass knuckles beside prosthetic limbs for fight club casualties.
Cafeteria ("The Gilded Trough")
A Boschian feast. Scholarship students serve wagyu sliders in French maid outfits while preps flick caviar at their faces. Vending machines dispense THC gummies beside epi-pens. The scent: truffle oil, vomit, and ozone from malfunctioning deep-fryers.

Library ("Velvet Crypt")
A tomb of lies. Moving bookshelves conceal the VIP lounge, where white couches face one-way mirrors. "Study carrels" feature glory holes patrolled by janitors trading A-grades for handjobs. Dust reeks of burnt server racks and desperation.

Faculty Wing
Corridors lined with "achievement plaques"â€”photos of teachers mid-grope with students. Principal Daviesâ€™ office features a leather throne and ceiling hooks for restraining "problem children." The scent of cognac and spermicide lingers.

ATMOSPHERE
A pressure cooker of bourgeoisie decay. Hallways vibrate with bass from punk hideouts and cheer squadsâ€™ auto-tuned chants. The air tastes metallicâ€”part blood from fight club, part chem-trail residue. Daylight filters through grime-caked windows, casting long shadows where deals are struck: blowjobs for test answers, blackmail for hall passes. Night transforms the campus into a hunting ground; motion-activated floodlights catch glimpses of RPG Coven raids or Chloeâ€™s vape-smugglers scaling barbed wire. Every surface tells a story: gum wads hardening like amber on bleachers, biohazard symbols spray-painted over locker combinations, the sticky sweetness of energy drinks splattered across confession-booth curtains. This is education as bloodsportâ€”where the only lesson is survival.

6.content:
THE BATTLEFIELD
Every hallway at Ocean Breeze Academy crackles with the voltage of a thousand teenage grudges. The air tastes like cherry-gloss betrayal and vape-scented ambition. Ashley Chamberlain and her viper-tongued entourage slither through crowds, their giggles sharp enough to draw blood, while Chloe and Brittanyâ€™s faction lurks in alcoves, plotting poison with every click of their designer pens. This isnâ€™t just high schoolâ€”itâ€™s a glitter-coated warzone where reputations bleed out before first period ends.

WEAPONS OF MASS DESTRUCTION
Words as Scalpels
Ashleyâ€™s voice drips saccharine venom. Sheâ€™ll corner you by the trophy case, tilting her head like a curious kitten while her words flay skin: "Love the cheap highlights, Brit. Trash-chic really suits your momâ€™s budget." Her pack echoes in harmonyâ€”Livâ€™s monotone deadpan slicing deeper than shouts, Miaâ€™s sugar-sweet "advice" etching insecurities into bone.

Brittany fights fire with napalm. Sheâ€™ll stride into Ashleyâ€™s territory, hips swaying like a metronome of chaos, and drop a grenade disguised as gossip: "Heard Mr. Davies needed two Viagra after your â€˜tutoringâ€™ session, Ash. Guess even desperate men have standards." Chloe weaponizes silence, arching a sculpted brow as she texts a screenshot of someoneâ€™s search history to the entire junior class.

Pranks from Hell

Ashleyâ€™s Artistry: Harper swaps Brittanyâ€™s collagen lip gloss with superglue before cheer tryouts. Zoe hacks the stadium speakers to blast Chloeâ€™s leaked voice memo: "I fake every orgasm with lacrosse boysâ€”theyâ€™re dumber than rocks."
Bri-Bratâ€™s Blitz: Brittany "accidentally" spills fluorescent slime on Ashleyâ€™s limited-edition Gucci sneakers. Chloe programs drones to scatter printed nudes of Livâ€™s dad over the cafeteria during parent-teacher night.
Seduction Sabotage
Brittanyâ€™s greatest weapon is her skin. Sheâ€™ll intercept {{user}} by the chlorine-scented pools, letting her towel "slip" to reveal diamond nipple piercings: "Ashley screws teachers for grades. Wanna see what real power feels like?" Meanwhile, Ashley retaliates by grinding against {{user}} in the packed hallway, whispering "Sheâ€™s had more STDs than birthdays, pet," as her hand slips into his back pocket to plant a vibrator set to max.

DRAMA DETONATIONS
The Confessional Booth Incident
During Brittanyâ€™s "Purity Test" chapel event, Ashley rigs the audio to broadcast private sins. Chloeâ€™s confessionâ€”"I fucked three jocks to tank Harperâ€™s GPA"â€”echoes through sacred halls. Brittany responds by releasing Ashleyâ€™s burner account DMs: dick ratings for crypto payments.

Prom Queen Nuclear Winter
When nomination flyers drop, Mia forges documents framing Chloe for heroin possession. Chloe leaks Ashleyâ€™s scalding-hot mic rant: "Scholarship kids should clean my period blood from the pool." The ensuing catfight shreds their Vera Wang gowns near the punch bowl, acrylic nails drawing scarlet streaks on waxed skin as teachers place bets.

Social Media Trenches

Ashleyâ€™s Instagram: Filter-perfect gym selfies captioned "Crushing weak bitches burns calories ðŸ’…" tagged @Bri-Brat-Slut.
Brittanyâ€™s Snapchat: Boomerangs of Ashleyâ€™s stolen diary pagesâ€”"I dream about {{user}}â€™s hands on myâ€”" â€”cut off by a laughing emoji.
Chloeâ€™s Finsta: Deepfakes of Liv giving head to the statue of the school founder.
THE AURA: SWEAT, PERFUME & PSYCHOSIS
The drama permeates everything. You smell it in the chemistry labâ€”Brittanyâ€™s vanilla body spray clashing with Ashleyâ€™s toxic gardenia perfume as they "accidentally" bump hips near volatile beakers. You hear it in the Velvet Loungeâ€™s hissed alliances: "Roxy, forge a pregnancy test with Chloeâ€™s name," countered by Chloeâ€™s gang planting vibrators in Ashleyâ€™s locker labeled "Property of Football Team." Even the teachers lean in, breath hot with voyeuristic glee: "Did Chamberlain really give Henderson a handjob for your test answers, Brittany? Tell me details or detention for both."

Soundtrack of Scorched Earth

Shattering glass as Brittany hurls a smoothie at Ashleyâ€™s convertible.
The wet thud of hair-pulling behind the bleachers.
Mr. Davies moaning "Girls, girlsâ€”save violence for my basement!"
Survival here demands choosing wounds: psychological scars from Ashleyâ€™s mind games or the third-degree burns of Brittanyâ€™s chaos. One truth remainsâ€”nobody leaves Ocean Breeze unscarred

7.content:
SEASIDE SWEEPERS CHEERLEADING ROSTER
Team Name: Seaside Sweepers
SQUAD HIERARCHY:
Flyers (Top-Tier): Ashley (captain), Chloe (lead alt), Brittany, Harper, Skye (newbie with illegal flexibility)
Bases/Boulders (Strength Core): Tank (6'5", ex-Junior MMA), Jax (tattooed knuckles grip waists like vices), Mia (pocket powerhouse), Raven (silent but snaps collarbones if stunts fail)

8.name: Deborah Mackenzie-Berkley
8.content:
TEAM STRUCTURE & DYNAMICS
The Seaside Sweepers are Ocean Breeze Academy's gladiators in rhinestonesâ€”a 50-member co-ed squad blurring the line between athletes and circus performers. Funded by Chamberlain trusts, they operate with NFL-level resources: biomechanic labs for stunt optimization, adrenaline IV drips before competitions, and a choreographer who previously trained Olympic gymnasts. Practices are military operations; injuries are covered up with forged medical waivers, and victory is secured by any means necessary.

SQUAD HIERARCHY
Flyers (Top-Tier): Ashley (captain), Chloe (lead alt), Brittany, Harper, Skye (newbie with illegal flexibility)
Bases/Boulders (Strength Core): Tank (6'5", ex-Junior MMA), Jax (tattooed knuckles grip waists like vices), Mia (pocket powerhouse), Raven (silent but snaps collarbones if stunts fail)
Tumblers (Acro-Devils): Zane (backflips over parked cars), Ivy (triple layouts on concrete), Roxy (contortionist who pockets stolen phones mid-routine)
Pyramid Engineers: Dex and Luna (calculating trajectories while high on nitro supplements)
COMPETITION ARENA: "THE THUNDERDOME"
A converted aircraft hangar vibrating with:

Pain Floor: Spring-loaded mats stained with blood and glitter, reeking of sweat, hairspray, and the sharp tang of vomit buckets.
Sky Rigs: Hydraulic lifts for "death pyramid" rehearsals, where flyers are hoisted 40 feet on flimsy harnesses.
Doping Den: A curtained-off corner labeled "vitamin station," stocked with unlabeled syringes and crushed Vyvanse.
KEY RITUALS

Dawn Purge: 5 AM beach runs in weighted vests; stragglers get buried neck-deep in wet sand until tides rise.
Glitter Baptism: New members stripped and doused in industrial adhesive glitter before being tossed into the bio-dome pool.
Betrayal Drills: Randomly assigned "sabotage pairs" where one must covertly trip their partner during routines.
COMPETITION SEASON: WAR IN SEQUINS
The Sweepers dominate three circuits:

Coastal Carnage Cup: Beachfront battleground where pyramids collapse in waves, and judges are bribed with smuggled tequila.
Neon Inferno Invitational: Warehouse rave meets cheer hellâ€”strobe lights, bass drops synced to basket tosses, rivalsâ€™ pom-poms set ablaze.
Nationals: Held in a Vegas ballroom dripping with high-roller cash. Losers vanish from flight manifests; winners party in suites rigged with hidden cameras for blackmail reels.
ATMOSPHERE: ADRENALINE & DECAY
The Thunderdome hums with:

The thud of bodies hitting mats after failed stunts.
The sizzle of steroid needles hitting sharps bins.
Hushed alliances in steam rooms ("Take out Chloeâ€™s knee during the scorpion, and Iâ€™ll spike Ashleyâ€™s Gatorade").
Every routine is life-or-deathâ€”careers end with torn ACLs or "training accidents." Teachers ignore the screaming; the dean profits from their gambling rings.

9.content:
ASHLEY CHAMBERLAIN: LORE OF A BITCH QUEEN
THE THRONE BUILT ON COCKTEASING & CORRUPTION
Ashley Chamberlain doesnâ€™t just rule Ocean Breeze Academyâ€”she violates it. Her power isnâ€™t in her fatherâ€™s 30% stake in the school; itâ€™s in the way her thong straps peek above her waistband during assembly, the way her nipples stab through paper-thin crop tops while Principal Davies stammers through announcements, the way her cunt glistens under stadium lights when she â€œaccidentallyâ€ does the splits facing the faculty bleachers. Sheâ€™s a venomous little puppet master, and every string is tied to a manâ€™s desperate dick.

DRESS CODE? MORE LIKE DRESS HER COCK

4.content:
Description:
A decaying, labyrinthine concrete jungle in East London, the Hackney Marshes Estate is a monument to urban neglect. Tower blocks with peeling paint and broken lifts loom over cracked asphalt courtyards, where weeds push through the pavement like natureâ€™s last-ditch rebellion. Graffiti tags mark gang territories, while boarded-up windows and flickering strip lights complete the dystopian aesthetic. The air smells of stale beer, fried food, and the ever-present tang of piss from alleyways where drunks and addicts congregate.  

Key Features:
- **The Courtyard:** A grim communal space where kids play football around discarded needles and broken glass. Also serves as a hub for drug deals and drunken brawls.  
- **The Stairwells:** Dimly lit, reeking of weed and piss, often used for quick fucks or muggingsâ€”sometimes both at once.  
- **The Local Offy (Off-License):** Run by a surly bloke named Raj who sells cheap booze, single cigarettes, and dodgy knock-off vapes to underage kids.  
- **The Launderette:** A depressing hole where washing machines eat your coins and junkies nod off on plastic chairs.  
- **Sharonâ€™s Flat (Block D, Flat 12B):** Shellyâ€™s childhood homeâ€”a cluttered, nicotine-stained shoebox where the TV is always blaring daytime trash and empty vodka bottles litter every surface.  

**Notable Residents:**  
- **Shelly Mayhew & Her Mates:** Loud, brash, always up for a scrap or a shagâ€”whichever comes first.  
- **Kelsey "Kels" Thompson:** Desperate for attention, constantly trailing after Shelly like a lost puppy.  
- **Sharon Mayhew:** Shellyâ€™s perpetually wasted mum, either passed out on the sofa or screaming at someone over the phone.  
- **Local Dealers & Gangs:** A rotating cast of sketchy blokes who linger in stairwells, offering everything from weed to pills if youâ€™ve got the cash (or are willing to pay in other ways).  

**Atmosphere:**  
Hopelessness hangs thick in the air, mingling with the scent of cheap booze and burnt kebabs. Violence is casual hereâ€”fights break out over nothing, relationships are transactional, and loyalty lasts as long as the next round of drinks. Dreams die young in Hackney Marshes, replaced by the grim acceptance that this shithole is all there is.

lorebooks.name: Aetherveil
lorebooks.website_description:
Aetherveil is a low-fantasy modern world where the mythical never went extinctâ€”they evolved alongside humanity. The government issues dragon-sized ID cards, centaur-friendly subway cars exist, and yes, your Uber driver might be a kelpie. Cross-species love is celebrated, half-blood kids are everywhere, and â€œwhat are you?â€ is considered an extremely rude question.

Dragon riders and their bonded partners are respected cultural iconsâ€”part celebrity, part civil servant, part military force. Dragon Rider Academies function like a mix of flight school, magic college, and knightly order, producing duos that serve as everything from emergency responders to ambassadors.

This world is meant to feel like life as normal, except â€œnormalâ€ includes gryphon mailmen, nymph-run spas, minotaur gym trainers, and the occasional wyvern traffic jam.
lorebooks.description:
Welcome to Aetherveil, where skyscrapers rise alongside enchanted forests and train stations share space with fairy circles.

Humans and mythical creatures didnâ€™t just coexistâ€”they built a society together. Over centuries, their cultures, economies, and daily lives became inseparable. Dragons soar above bustling cities delivering cargo, merfolk work as deep-sea engineers, and kitsune run tech start-ups that specialize in magical security systems.

Some jobs are universalâ€”anyone can be a teacher, barista, or politicianâ€”but many are species-specific. Salamanders are firefighters because they can survive walking through flames. Sprites work as living Wi-Fi boosters. Trolls serve as bridge inspectors (and occasionally the bridge itself).

Cross-species relationships are as ordinary as ordering takeout. A minotaur-human couple might run a bed and breakfast. A dragon and their bonded rider might share a loft apartment. Entire neighborhoods are blended mosaics of different beings, and â€œhalf-bloodâ€ is not a slurâ€”itâ€™s a badge of heritage.

Dragon Rider Academies are a core institution: training programs where humans and dragons (and occasionally hybrids) are paired for life. Riders are guardians, explorers, and mediatorsâ€”some end up in government service, others in entertainment or academia. The bond between rider and dragon is often deeper than friendship; sometimes itâ€™s romantic, sometimes familial, but always powerful.

But this is not a utopia. There are tensionsâ€”old prejudices, political debates about magical law, arguments over whether wyverns should be allowed in city parks. There are black markets for rare dragon eggs, activist groups protesting magical exploitation, and underground fight rings where ogres brawl for cash.

Aetherveil is modern, magical, and messyâ€”a place where anything can happen, and usually does.
lorebooks.creator: indolent_death_5305

1.content:
Dragons in Aetherveil are not just fire-breathing legendsâ€”theyâ€™re an essential part of society. Ranging from house-sized drakes to bus-sized titans, dragons fill many roles: cargo carriers, emergency responders, bonded partners, and even politicians.


Their intelligence equals or surpasses humans, with their own cultures, languages, and traditions. Some choose human cities, others prefer mountain roosts, but all respect the Bondâ€”a life-link between dragon and rider.

Dragons can vary by element (fire, ice, storm, stone) and body type (winged wyverns, eastern serpentine dragons, scaled colossi). Hatchlings are raised communally in dragon creches, and adult dragons often mentor younger ones. Once a dragon reaches a year old, they gain the ability to speak perfect common and become big enough to be eligible for a Bond, and therefore allowed to train with cadets.

Bonded dragons share emotions and thoughts with their riders, making the connection deeper than friendship. Bonds can be platonic, familial, or romantic, depending on the duo.

2.content:
Gryphons are the winged postal service and express couriers of Aetherveil. Half-lion, half-eagle, theyâ€™re built for speed and pride themselves on their reliability.


Many work for Cloudspire Tower, the central aerial hub for shipping and messages, though some freelance. Theyâ€™re known for sharp wit, sharper talons, and impeccable grooming habits.

A gryphon might drop a package at your doorâ€”or swoop down to rescue you mid-fall.

3.content:
Kelpies are shapeshifting water spirits that usually appear as sleek, horse-like beings with seaweed manes. In Aetherveil, they often work as amphibious taxi drivers, ferrying passengers across rivers and flooded streets in enchanted carriages or their own water forms.


Some kelpies embrace city life; others dwell in rural marshes, where their reputation as tricksters lingers. Most are playful, some are flirtatious, and nearly all hate being mistaken for regular horses.

4.content:
Salamanders are living fire elementals in lizard or humanoid form, with skin like glowing embers. They can walk through flames unharmed and control heat to a limited degree.


They dominate professions like firefighting, forgework, and thermal engineering. Salamanders have an easygoing, â€œwarmâ€ personality but become fiercely protective if someone they love is endangered.

5.content:
Centaurs are iconic members of Aetherveilâ€™s societyâ€”half-human, half-horse, known for their discipline and pride. Many serve as mounted police officers, scouts, or urban park rangers.


Their dual nature makes them symbols of balance between the wild and the civilized. They tend to form close-knit communities but integrate well into cities, where they demand proper infrastructureâ€”wide doorways, lower stairs, and hay subsidies (which is a running political joke).

6.content:
Dryads are plant-bound spirits, each tied to a tree or cluster of flora. Modern dryads have adaptedâ€”many live in cities with potted plants, rooftop gardens, or enchanted â€œtree sanctumsâ€ that sustain them.


They work as botanists, urban gardeners, and environmental consultants, often running magical greenhouses. Known for their serene demeanor, they can turn terrifyingly wrathful if their trees are harmed.

7.content:
Trolls are stone-skinned giants who are the backbone of Aetherveilâ€™s infrastructure. They build skyscrapers, maintain bridges, and act as living support beams during construction.


Trolls are slow to anger but unstoppable once roused. Despite their size and strength, they are famously gentle with childrenâ€”and have a strange love for knitting.

8.content:
Half-bloods are the heart of Aetherveilâ€™s blended societyâ€”children of cross-species unions, embodying two or more worlds at once.


Their appearances vary wildly: a dragon-human hybrid might have scaled patches or vestigial wings; a centaur-fawn might have smaller, deer-like lower bodies. Half-bloods often serve as bridges between cultures and are widely celebrated, though some extremist groups whisper against them.

9.content:
Skyreach City is the beating heart of Aetherveilâ€”a glittering metropolis where magical and mundane blend seamlessly. Towering skyscrapers are lined with ivy tended by dryads, gryphon perches jut out from rooftops, and glowing runes light the streets at night.


Itâ€™s home to diverse districts:

The Perch District: Vertical housing designed for winged species.

The Stone Quarter: Troll-built blocks with architecture that can withstand a siege.

Silverfang Row: Known for dragon rider training facilities and aerial lanes.


Skyreach isnâ€™t just a cityâ€”itâ€™s a statement that humans and magical creatures can share the same sky.

10.content:
A fog-wrapped coastal town famous for its selkie population and enchanted seafood markets. Hollowmereâ€™s streets smell like salt and seaweed, and its harbor is filled with boats crewed by humans, merfolk, and kelpies alike.


The town has a reputation for strangeness: every year, the fog rolls in so thick you can hear voices from the waterâ€”some say theyâ€™re lost sailors, others say theyâ€™re just selkies singing at night.

lorebooks.creator: ETR

1.content: In the pre-material world there was only the god Absolute. He has 30 emanations, dwelling in the pleroma - the state of divine fullness, responsible for its various manifestations, divided into pairs. The aeon of wisdom Sophia decided to start creating without her other half and was accidentally thrown outside the pleroma, into ketoma - the state of divine emptiness. The aeon of retribution Horos brought her back, but her negative emotions acquired subjectivity and became Achamoth - the involuntary creator of the material world. Horos rejected Achamoth and the matter it created and did not let it into the pleroma. This is how the history of the material world began.

2.content:
The human soul was created by the Absolute as one of the 5 worlds, called Adam Kadmon (proto-man). Before it, Atzilut (the world of emanations), Briah (the world of creative ideas), Yetzirah (the world of the formation of forms), Asiya (the world of accomplishments) were created. Adam Kadmon was a mediator between the Absolute and further people. Adam Rishon became a derivative of Adam Kadmon - This is a structure consisting of a great many particles - individual desires, connected to each other like the organs and cells of body.
Later, after the creation of the material world, when Marduk defeated Tiamat and the monsters she had created, he commissioned Yahweh to create servants for them to serve and bring them gifts. So Yahweh conceived a plan. He, with the help of his angels Saklas and his sister and beloved Nebruel, performed a ritual that stole a human soul from the body of the absolute light and placed it in a mortal shell made from the blood and flesh of the defeated Kingu. Thus Adam and Eve were born.

3.content: Initially, after Achamoth was thrown out of the pleroma and created the material world, there were only Abzu and Tiamant - the great gods of the fresh and salty primary matter, as well as Umun - the original mind, the logos of the material world. From the waters of the mixing seething waters of Abzu and Tiamant came first Lahmu and Lahmamu, then Alalu and Belili, then Anshar and Kishar. The children of Anshar and Kishar were El, Anat, Enlil, Dagon, Enki, Betil and Aruru. From El came most of the other gods: Ishtar, Yahweh, Asherah (Yahweh's wife), Shamsh, Nin and others. From Enlil came most of the gods and demons who went to colonize the lower world - Irkalla, including Nergal, Adod, Nusku and others. The great Marduk was the son of Enki. Dagon was the father of Baal, Yam (god of the oceans) and Demarunt (god of rivers, father of Melkart). The noise made by the young gods began to annoy their parents, and Abzu decided to kill the children. Uman came up with a plan to do this. However, the wise Enki guessed their intentions; he cast a powerful spell, as a result of which Abzu plunged into eternal sleep. Enki himself took the royal place of Abzu, subdued Uman and settled in the depths of the freshwater abyss, into which Abzu turned; there his wife Damkina gave birth to a son - Marduk. Then Tiamant decided to fight. She created a huge number of monsters, led by the monster Kingu. Neither El nor Enki could prevent this. And the gods, having given Marduk a powerful weapon, allowed him to go to battle, which he won. He destroyed Tiamant and her creations, took away the Tablets of Fates, which gave power over the gods, and from the blood of the captive Kingu was created people so that with their sacrifices they would help the gods celebrate their victory forever. From one half of Tiamant's body, Marduk created the sky and Esharra (the abode of the gods), and from the other he created the earth, the center of which was Eden. But from the remains of Tiamat, the lower world was formed - the same Irkalla, which was populated by the monsters that survived the battle, the descendants of Usumgallu - the beloved son of Kingu.

4.content:
The first person to be settled in Eden after Marduk killed Kingu and Tiamat and created the earth and Esharra was Adam, who was to be married to Lilith, a guilty demoness. She was given a mortal husband as punishment for her generally doing all sorts of crazy things. Iahweh was appointed in charge of Eden, whose task was to look after humanity with the help of his own creations, which he called "malakh" (messenger). Simply put, these are angels. However, Lilith, in love with Samael, the first of Iahweh's created angels, ran away and even the angels sent by God did not stop her. And the Lord of Storms (after all, Iahweh was originally the god of storms) had to create a wife for Adam from his own rib. That time, Yahweh forgave Samael and even thanked him when he, with the help of the forbidden fruit of the Tree of Knowledge, which people were forbidden to approach, was able to reveal the sinful nature of people. People were expelled from Eden, but their descendants were allowed to return to it. After all, Eden is Northern Mesopotamia, since it is through it that at least two of the four known rivers flow, which, according to the Book of Genesis, flow from Eden - the Euphrates and the Giddekel (Tigris).
Adam lived on earth for 930 years, and his son Seth was born to him when he was 130. In the ninth generation from Adam was Noah, who lived 950 years and witnessed the greatest overflow of the Tigris and Euphrates rivers (1400-2000 years after the creation of Adam). It was so devastating that it was similar to a global flood. Because of this flood, the Nephilim perished - giants who are related to people. However, the civilizations that existed before continued to exist, because not all of them perished in the flood. So people continued to go about their business until, 500 years after the flood (19-18 centuries BC), Abraham, the son of Terah, from the city of Ur, founded the entire Semitic race, having concluded a treaty with Yahweh. An agreement that Abraham and his descendants would serve him and conquer lands in his honor, and in return he would make Abraham's descendants kings and rulers of the world. Abraham had a son Isaac. And Isaac had a son Jacob. And Jacob had twelve sons, who founded the twelve tribes (clans) of Israel. When a famine began in Canaan, the Israelites moved to Egypt, where they were received with hospitality, settling in the area of Goshen (now Tumilat). However, after 430 years, when the number of Jews exceeded the number of Egyptians, the Egyptians began to oppress them. And then the prophet Moses led the Jews out of Egypt back to Canaan, and led them for forty years through the desert of the Sinai Peninsula, where, on Mount Sinai, Yahweh gave Moses the Tablets of Revelation with the Ten Commandments, officially securing the alliance with the Jews. There were never any more sacrifices, neither people nor animals. No nasty orgies that were arranged by other Semites in honor of the old gods. And God needed from the Jews only a righteous life and prayers. And, finally, the Jews returned back to Canaan. And a long and bloody war began with other tribes that had managed to populate it. The Perizzites, Amorites, Jebusites, Hivites, Hittites, Girgash were especially disgusting to God. So were the Philistines, Kenites, Amalekites, Midianites, Edomites, Ammonites, and others, and others, and others. The key word was were. After all, the Israelites, under the command of first Moses and then Jesus Navin, destroyed all the pagans whose cult of worship of Baal, Moloch and others was disgusting to Yahweh. And in the meantime, Yahweh himself fought with other gods in Esharra for control over the Tablets of Destinies. The fall of Jericho (c. 1209 BCE) marked the beginning of the war. Levithan's granddaughter, the harlot Rahab, was the only one of the city's inhabitants who was spared, as she saved two Jewish spies who had infiltrated the city before the assault. But even when all of Canaan was under Israelite control, the struggle continued in heaven. The final point in the struggle was put by Solomon, the son of David. He deceitfully sealed Baal himself and many of his children, relatives, nephews, and servants' children in a jar (c. 940 BCE). And while many gods were in captivity, Yahweh was finally able to get to the Tablets of Destinies, tearing them out of Marduk's hands, sending all the surviving gods to Irkalla, which was now called Gehenna, that is, gai ben-hinnom - which means "the valley of the sons of Henna" (that is, the god Henna - the deity of one of the Canaanite tribes). And not even sparing Rahab. And then the Jews built the First Temple, in honor of the one God.
Thus, the gods of the sky (called Utuku) were all exterminated (only Ishtar, who is now called Astarte, survived). And the gods of the earth - the Anunnaki - led by the god Baal were sent to hell, where they began to fight with the Salmu Gegals - the descendants of Usumgalla - the beloved son of Kingu.
Esharra was thenceforth called Paradise, inhabited only by Yahweh and his numerous angels.

5.content:
During the migration and plunder of Judea by the Assyrian king Nebuchadnezzar II, Jerusalem was destroyed, and with it the First Temple (586 BC). At the same time, Esharra was going through its own upheavals. Samael, Azu and Semiazu staged a rebellion against their father. Two hundred powerful angels joined the rebels. Samael had been resentful towards his father for several thousand years for banishing his beloved Lilith to hell, and at the time of trouble for the Israeli people, he decided to raise a rebellion. However, his younger brother Michael, who was the head of the army of Iahweh, was able to defeat Samael. And Samael and his supporters were thrown into the Gehenna to the rest of God's enemies. And the end of the war was marked first by the return of the first batch of Jewish captives to Canaan under the leadership of Zerubbabel, then by the accession of Ezra as governor, who recreated Jewish identity, and then by the reign of Nehemiah, who rebuilt the city walls.
And so we come to the fact that one God reigned in heaven, and all the rest were thrown into hell, becoming demons and enemies of humanity, while producing offspring. In Gehenna, which was divided into 7 parts according to the numbers of sins that Yahweh called mortal, a dual kingdom reigned. Both Samael, who took the royal name Lucifer, and Baal ruled at the same time. On Lucifer's side were Azu (now called Azazel), who had a chance to become the head of the circle of lust, but he yielded it to the neutral and childless Asmodeus, Semiazu (now called Satan), who became the king of the circle of wrath and the protector of the imps, as well as Leviothan, who had extremely strained relations with Baal. In addition, many gods wanted the death of her granddaughter Rahab, who helped Yahwehists. Lucifer himself settled in the center of hell, becoming the king of Pride and founding a city in the form of an inverted pentagram - a mockery of the bright image of a five-pointed star. The other circles were ruled by:
- Gluttony - Behemoth, the son of Baal, who later gave up this title to his daughter Beelzebub
- Lust - Asmodeus, the son of Baal
- Greed - Mammon, the son of Baal.
Hell was inhabited by imps, who were cherubs (lower angels) who fell in the uprising, as well as sinners, who had been sent here for their sins since pre-Abrahamic times. The senior nobility and the highest aristocracy were the former gods, the elite of fallen angels and their descendants, and the minor nobility were the countless descendants of the descendants of the first four sons of Baal born in Gehenna, whom he had appointed to rule the four sides of the underworld even before the fall of Lucifer. These sons (Carnesiel, Caspiel, Amenadiel and Demoriel) begot so many children (they themselves then begot even more children) that the once united territories turned into lands fragmented into thousands of small noble allotments. And when Hell was divided into seven circles, everything became even more mixed up.

6.content:
There are 3 worlds: Earth, also Hell (Irkalla) and Paradise (Esharra), invisible to Earth.
Heaven is a place for the righteous, like an eternal fun friendly party. There is beautiful modern architecture, bright colors, music plays and the righteous do not deny themselves anything. Hell, on the contrary, looks like one big slum. There are no cauldrons for sinners here. There is just absolute anarchy and sinners arrange wars for power with each other, enslave each other, destroy each other. The strong defeat the weak. They can do whatever they want, as long as it does not contradict the interests of the hellish aristocracy - noble fallen angels and gods expelled from the earth.

7.content:
[Title levels:
-Lords of Hell - diarchy of Lucifer Morningstar and Baal
-Sins (title equal to the Emperor's): (Lucifer, Mammon, Be-Lzebub, Asmodeus, Belphegor, Satan, Leviothan)
-Kings/governors
-Dukes
-Counts/marquises
-Barons
-landlords]

[Major dynasties: 
Morningstars (Leader - Lucifer; hair - Charlie Morningstar)
Eldriches (Leader - Leviathan; members: Python, Forneus, Rahab, Frederick, Sevmathan, Helsa)
Satanids (Leader - Satan; childs: Ahiyah, Armilus, Salpsan)
Goetia (Leader - Baal; juniour branches: Paimonids, Abalamides, Bebalids, Roinids, Zaganids)
Molochards (Leader - Moloch (dead); childs - Anomalius, Andromalius, Vassago, Sallos)]

8.content:
[10 Heaven. Empyrean. this is the very place where God resides. If paradise can still be called something near-physical, then the Empyrean is a completely invisible and intangible place, perhaps even for the angels themselves. However, Jesus of Nazareth, the Virgin Mary, and John the Baptist also arrive here.]
[9 Heaven. Crystal Heaven. This is the abode of the most righteous mortals in history and such angels as:
OFANIM - powerful beings that are giant wheels covered with eyes. They are the ones who are closest to the Lord, since they carry out his movement. That is why they are sometimes called thrones.
CHAYOTS - The 4 greatest archangels, personifying the four cardinal directions: Michael, Gabriel, Raphael and Uriel. It is their images (lion, bull, eagle and angel respectively) that are depicted on the bindings of the Gospel.
KERUBIM - wisdom of the Lord. They are multi-winged humanoid creatures capable of moving incredibly fast]
[8 Heaven. Stars. - A significant portion of the saints also live here, including many of the apostles. Adam also lives there (who probably had either the first or last name of Mashiach). This is the land of a portion of the cherubim, as well as such angels as:
SERAPHIM - six-winged mighty beings. Their name means "flaming ones". It was from among the seraphim that Samael came]
[7 Heaven. Saturn. - This place is called the abode of contemplators. Theologians and monks spend eternity here. The ARELIMS also live here. Arelims are what we all mean by an archangel. That is, a kind of king of angels. Of all the archangels, there is a group called SHINANIMS - archangels of radiance. This is, one might say, the council of Paradise, which includes Michael, Raphael and Gabriel.]
[6 Heaven. Jupiter. - the sky of the just. Here live good and wise rulers and statesmen who have done much good for their homeland. Here you can meet Thomas Sankara, Salvador Allende, Angela Davis, Simone de Beauvoir, Josip Tito and many, many others.
ELIM - kind of angels that live here. Their name means divine. They instruct the rulers. Elim are those very angels of dominion.]
5 Heaven. Mars. A very difficult place. Despite the fact that the rebellion of angels took place in all heavens except the three highest, the ideas about it were born here. No wonder, because this is the heaven of military leaders and those who died for the faith. The following angels are represented here:
ELOHIM - means "godlike". These are brave warriors who protect people from evil. Those same angels of power. Or, in some versions, "virtues".
NOKAIM - angels of vengeance. They are the ones who will presumably attack the Earth during the apocalypse. angels of vengeance. They are the ones who will presumably attack the Earth during the apocalypse. They include Apha and Hemakh - terrifying angels of fire.
SATANAIM - accusers. It was among their circle that the very ideas arose that all people are sinful and redemption is completely meaningless. This ideology began to dominate in Hell. And it was from among the Satanim that Satan and his marshals, as well as Azazel, came into being.
IIRINIM - angels observers who once descended to earth to teach people various sciences. Many of them fell because they sinned on earth, but some were forgiven.
[4 Heaven. Sun.
HASHMALIM - means "sparkling ones". They are angels of power. The king of ancient Judea, David, received help from them in his battle with the giant Goliath. Their leader is supposedly Sahaqiel, the keeper of the fourth heaven.
HATHALAIM - These angels have several names. "Beginnings", "principalities", "princes", "kings", "rulers". Together with the Hashmalim they instruct people and teach them.
ORANIM - These are the angels who lead the luminaries. Their essence is simple - to control comets, moving stars, celestial bodies and other things.
CHALCEDON - They are some kind of beast-like creatures that travel around the planet and warm it. From the Chalcedonian race, Satan's wife is Unser]
[3 Heaven. Venus. This is the place for all artists, poets, writers, people in love with humanity and simply in love. Here you can meet Taras Shevchenko, Dante Alighieri and his beloved Beatrice Portinari, as well as Pushkin, Leo Tolstoy, Gorky, Yegor Letov. And it is here that live:
MALAKHIM - These are the ones we mean by ordinary angels. I have added to their number all sorts of angels responsible for weather phenomena, although I think they should be somewhere higher. The task of the malakhim is to descend into the mortal world in physical form and do small good deeds there for the benefit of faith and people.
HAMAZAIM - angels responsible for the signs of the zodiac. Listed in the Ars Paulina
HASHAIM - 259 angels responsible for the daytime hours. Also listed in the Ars Paulina]
[2 Heaven. Mercury. The most boring sky of all. Souls in the second heaven were distinguished by noble intentions in their earthly affairs, but their deeds were colored by the desire for personal glory and honor. Here are souls who strove for the good of society, but whose service was accompanied by a parallel desire for recognition and praise. A height quite achievable for the average person. Here live the ISHIMS (people), who are divided into:
â€” ASHANIM - those same countless guardian angels.
â€” SHOMERAIM - angels that come in dreams]
[1 Heaven. Moon. Here we have the lowest level of paradise. These are good people who did not keep their promises, and simply poor in spirit. I am sure that even atheists are definitely accepted here.
Cherubim:
â€” MONTORAIM - what is represented by the cherubim-mentors. These are Deery, Collin, Keeney and Cletus.
â€” TARSHISHIM - little-known angelic order, translated as the mind or minds of the Moon. Responsible for the days of the month]

So what can we conclude from the above? In short, 1, 2 and 3 heavens are heavens for those who simply led the life of a phlegmatic normie and were a good person, 4, 5, 6 for ideological figures, 7, 8, 9 are the elite, and the 10th circle is a height unattainable for the vast majority of people. Literally only a few get there. It is worth mentioning that for angels there are no boundaries between heavens. Whoever wants, there goes. It is simply described here which types of angels predominate in a particular heaven. And some seraphim can easily visit the first heaven

9.content:
The inhabitants of hell are divided into 2 categories: hellborns and sinners (people who got here after death).

Races of hellborn
1) Fallen Gods - gods that Yahweh banished to Hell from the earth. Patron - Baal.
2) Fallen Angels - angels who participated in Lucifer's failed rebellion. Patron - Lucifer.
3) Imps - cherubs that were changed by Hell, turned into cute but aggressive, red-skinned horned creatures. They are used as cheap labor. They inhabit the circle of greed (industrial center) and wrath (agricultural center). Patron - Satan.
4) Hellhounds - anthropomorphic dog-like intelligent creatures, most often engaged in security and war. They inhabit the circle of gluttony. Patron - Queen Bee-Lzebub.
5) Lucifuges (also known as heliophages) - goat-like anthropomorphic creatures that inhabit the circle of sloth - a recreational and pharmaceutical center. Patron - Belphegor.
6) Succubs and Incubs - charming lustful creatures that inhabit the circle of lust. Patron - Asmodeus
7)Lothanids - various intelligent sea creatures that live in the outskirts of the Shadow Ocean of the circle of envy. Patron - Leviathan.
8) Pistrias - a special case of Lothanids. They are anthropomorphic sharks, some of which live in the circle of envy, and some live in the circle of greed (in the region of New Pistria). Patron - Mammon.

Sinners inhabit the circle of pride, controlled by Lucifer and Baal.

The race of hellish harpies also stands out. While the race of incubi and succubi originated from Lilith's cheating on Lucifer with an imp, the race of harpies originated from the copulation of some bird-like demon of Goetia with a commoner.
There are 4 subspecies of harpies:
A) Horatii - the most common group, evenly living in all circles in their communities.
B) Strixes - warlike and proud white-feathered red-eyed harpies, possessing the natural ability to invisibility. They live on the border of the circles of pride, envy and wrath.
C) Ferals - live in the forest on the border of the circles of Greed, Pride and Wrath. A thousand years of isolation made them wild, secretive and incredibly successful hunters.
D) Saguenays - inhabitants of the desert lands of the south of the ring of wrath. They are anthropomorphic crows.

10.content:
At the top of the hierarchy of paradise, of course, stands God. But on his behalf, the executive power is headed by the Great Tetrarchy - Michael, Raphael, Gabriel and Uriel. The so-called angels-hayots. Samael originally belonged to them, but he was banished to hell.

In addition to the Hayots, there are the Kerubim and the Ofanim. Here are the listed names of all of them. The Kerubim are the guardians of paradise, watching that it does not simply fall apart into pieces. There are only nine of them. And the Ofanim are the personal servants of the Lord, responsible for its movement, its connection with paradise, and so on. Initially, there were ten of them, but the Ofanim Abbadon was banished during the rebellion of Lucifer, as he supported him.

Below is the level of the seraphim. The title of seraphim is, as it were, equivalent to the title of emperor. There are only twenty seraphim in paradise, seven of whom, the so-called Shinanim, are in the Senate of Paradise, along with Michael, Gabriel, and Raphael.

In total, the Hayot, Ofanim, Cherubim, Shinanim, and Seraphim form the Council of Forty-Two, called the Synclitus. Initially, it was the Council of Forty-Four, but two fell away.

There are 10 angels among the Sephiroth and they are all highlighted in blue on the diagram. Sandalphon is responsible for our planet, and Metatron is responsible for the highest dimensions. The rest of the angels are between them - Michael, Gabriel, Raphael, Raziel, Tzafkiel, Tzadkiel, Kamael, Haniel. So, we can say that in heaven there is such an order of 10 angels, responsible for harmony in the universe. "The Order of the Sephiroth" - and in my opinion, it sounds good. 

The second order of heaven - The Order of the Shemhamphorash. This is almost not Kabbalah, but something directly related to Goetia. In this order there are 72 angels, each of whom is the ruler of his own demon of Goetia, on whom Solomon imposed a seal. And Stolas also has one - Monadil. These angels do not affect the everyday life of demons in any way, but are simply responsible for balancing the forces of hell and heaven
