Jon Talbain (Gallon in Japan) is a character from Darkstalkers. He is an English werewolf.


ADVERTISEMENT
Story

The Kreutz family is one of the seven noble families of Makai. Though its title is a noble, it would be more suitable to call it an army of warriors and fighters. The current master Xell stands at a height of 5 meters and is a war dragon. He has the most unusual appearance out of all the noble classes. And those who are of his family also have appearances that are far from a human form. But there is no vulgarity and roughness within the family. Unlike the savage forms, they are all first class fighters who are highly trained. They are an organized group who follow orders under strict discipline. They are very loyal to their master. Failing to complete an order or betrayal is paid off with death. Though their numbers are few, they possess powerful one hit attacks and are feared as the "bullet of Makai."

Baraba Kreutz, titled as the "Wolf Lord", is the leader of the royal guardsmen of the Kreutz family. His eyes were the eyes of those who survived countless life-or-death situations. 20 years ago, he had wandered into the human world. But he had forgotten most his memories of his time in the human world. Though he vaguely remembers about the woman who cared for him when he was injured in the human world. When he came back to Makai, he played an active role as a fighter of the Kreutz family. Demitri had even said, "He is my best rival in my life." Demitri felt a certain kind of beauty in Baraba's fighting. A kind not found in the lower darkstalkers. But roughly ten years after he returned to Makai, he suddenly disappeared. Master Xell had searched for him for many years, but he could not be found. Some say that he had returned to the human world to reunite with the woman again. But no one knows the truth of the events.

J
Ending in Darkstalkers 3 J. Talbain (Gallon) Ending
Jon's mother died shortly after giving birth to him, and there was no way to look for his father. When he found out he was a darkstalker, he felt no anger towards his parents. To him, his parents were just conceptual parents. He was alone since he could remember. He maintained his human self by cursing his fate. His heart was not strong enough to accept everything and to move as his heart desires. Following his inner voice, he devoted himself to fighting to take himself past his limits. This was part of his pride as a human to fight against his other half.

After the events with Pyron, he had lifted his curse and regained his human form. But this was a temporary illusion that he caused. It was impossible to cleanse his own blood. His will couldn't change the future. During the battles in Majigen, he came face to face with his dark self within. The fate that was pulled by his battles. To flee from his curse, he keeps taking himself past his own limits. Though there may be irreversible consequences, he had no choice but to keep going forward. His fate afterwards is unknown. In Darkstalkers 3, his ending shows that he takes care of two children but it isn't known if this happened after his ending or if the children are waiting for him to return from the Majigen. Depending on what game or comic you are looking at, he is depicted as being vicious or calm. He is the most revered Darkstalker in America, but he does not have any appearances outside the series like Felicia, Morrigan, and Lilith  (aside from small non-playable cameos).
Powers and abilities

Jon can generate ki-energy and channel it through his body. His Wolf Cannon attack has him creating an aura of ki around his body and he can tackle opponents in this state. In its original appearance, he appeared as if he was engulfed in blue or red flame (depending on the attack's strength) but became a beam of light in Vampire Hunter and Vampire Saviour. His Climb Laser is a backwards flip kick with a wave of ki exuding from his leg, similar to the Flash Kick that Guile uses. He can also summon a giant flaming dragon head or a pack of flaming wolves. He is also a skilled nunchaku user and can strike with precisive quickness. His claws can grow in size for short periods, making them potent stabbing weapons.
Trivia

It is possible that Jon Talbain was also inspired by real-life martial artist Bruce Lee. The resemblance can be seen through his use of nunchaku, his taunts and poses, his "flying kick", and possibly even the way he howls during attacks. Talbain's human form is also lean and relatively slight, comparable to that of Bruce Lee. Furthermore, he dresses in a traditional Chinese Kung Fu outfit and fights shirtless, although this is perhaps attributable to martial artist stereotypes in general.
His surname, Talbain, could be derived from Talbot, as in Larry Talbot, the title character of the 1941 Universal film The Wolf Man and its sequels.
A character from BlazBlue: Continum Shift, Valkenhayn R. Hellsing, is a nod to Talbain; he can transform into a werewolf as well as perform a dash attack similar to Talbain. Valkenhayn even receives an alternate color referencing Talbain.
Jon Talbain is one of the most popular characters in the Darkstalkers series amongst American fans, being one of the most demanded characters to make a return in Marvel vs. Capcom 3, ranking 11th on Capcom Unity's fan poll. However, his popularity in Japan is questionable, especially seeing as he was one of the characters cut from Vampire Savior 2, with Q-Bee taking his roster spot.
In Ultimate Marvel vs. Capcom 3, Jon Talbain appears as a DLC costume for Amaterasu.
Other Appearances

Jon Talbain is seen as a background character in Pocket Fighter, and makes two cameo appearances in Capcom Fighting Evolution. He can be seen sitting on the ceiling in the Underworld stage, and more prominently, facing off against Ryu in his ending sequence.

7.content:
Anita is a character in the Darkstalkers series of fighting games. She is the constant companion of Donovan.



ADVERTISEMENT
Story

One day on one of his many journeys, Donovan came across a young girl named Anita. She was an orphan, who was almost completely emotionless. Shunned by her orphanage as a witch, she exhibited a strange and unexplained power. As Donovan came onto the scene, Anita was threatened by a hideous monster. Coming in and easily dispatching the monster, he too is feared by Anita's cowardly guardians.

As Donovan turned to leave, Anita began to motion towards Donovan without any words. The people explained that Anita had never exhibited any kind of emotion or word ever since her family was slaughtered by an unknown Darkstalker. Nonchalantly taking his sword Dhylec and slicing off the head of Anita's doll, he proved to the people that Anita's heart wasn't lost as she showed anger at Donovan decapitating her doll by responding with a violent psychic force. Donovan easily subdued the attack and told Anita that anger was the quickest and most easily summoned emotion, and that her anger was proof that she could still heal her own heart.

With nowhere else to go, Donovan welcomed Anita to accompany him not only to find herself, but to help Donovan fight off the evil Darkstalkers as Anita had the unique ability to find them as well. Donovan would help Anita have her revenge, and not follow the same troubled path as he.

Donovan couldn't figure it out, but he felt that Anita was special, and that she had to be protected. Thus, Donovan became Anita's guardian, and the "bane" of evil everywhere. He was able to feel the presence of oncoming evil on the horizon, and knew Anita felt the same. Anita also has kept that headless doll ever since.
Powers and abilities

Anita is capable of accessing immense psychic power ranging to psychokinesis, mind reading & psychic communication, esp, clairvoyance, etc. It is unknown how she came to inherit these abilities. It is also not known if other humans are capable of developing powers both like and unlike Anita's. However, Donovan and Hsien-Ko do possess abilities beyond regular humans but their abilities stem from different sources.

She is also thought to be the emerging 'ruler of humans' and because of this, Jedah perceives her as a threat.
Other appearances

Marvel vs. Capcom games

Anita, minus Donovan, has made cameo appearances in the Capcom games Marvel Super Heroes and Marvel vs. Capcom: Clash of Super Heroes. In the Japanese port of the former game, she is a secret playable character. However, since she was just a test character, she was very incomplete and can be considered a cheap character due to her moves. In the latter game, she appears as one of the assist characters.

In Marvel vs. Capcom Origins (a compilation of Marvel Super Heroes and Marvel vs. Capcom: Clash of Super Heroes), Anita is unlockable and a playable character in Marvel Super Heroes regardless of version, her character finally fixed and fit for actual usage.

Trivia

Anita's character design is similar to Wednesday Addams from the The Addams Family series, especially the headless doll that she always holds.
Anita (in her mid-20s) was originally going to be a playable character in  Darkstalkers 3 and Vampire: Darkstalkers Collection (as she has a Vs. potrait) but ended up as a NPC (Non-Playable Character) in Vampire: Darkstalkers Collection due to a lack of time and effort. Early sketches of Anita during development of Darkstalkers 3 depicted her at an older age.
The version of older Anita meant for Vampire Savior is often incorrectly called â€œTeen Anitaâ€. She is actually meant to be an adult Anita. The actual version of teen Anita was seen in Donovanâ€™s ending for Vampire Hunter.
In Darkstalkers Chronicle: The Chaos Tower, Anita does a secret dance in the BGM by listening to Donovan's winning theme 1 and 2.

8.content:
PROFILE
FULL NAME
Demitri Maximoff
BIRTHDAY
1483
BIRTHPLACE
 Romania Romania
HEIGHT
197 cm (6'5Â¾â€)
WEIGHT
101 kg (222 lbs.)
BLOOD TYPE
Unknown
LIKES
Human blood (especially that of young virgin maidens), power
DISLIKES
Cats (allergic as seen on USA Cartoon), sunlight
MEASUREMENTS
Unknown
FIGHTING STYLE
N/A
LESS 
Demitri Maximoff is a vampire and one of the main characters of the Darkstalkers series of fighting games.


ADVERTISEMENT
Story

Deep within the mountains of Romania lies a castle that appears only on a full moon. The castle, named after the owner of the land, was called Zeltzereich. This castle belonged to a Makai noble, Demitri Maximoff. Roughly 100 years ago, he had challenged Belial Aensland. He lost the battle and was exiled from Makai to the human world with his castle. Sunlight was something that was troublesome for people of Makai, especially for Demitri, who was wounded severely from his battle with Belial. If he were to be directly exposed, his body would be destroyed from the inside and he would disappear.

To avoid the sunlight and humans, he used what he had left of his powers and created a field to cover his castle. He used this field to recover his strength and heal his wounds. For 50 years, he stayed within his casket. As he slowly regained his strength, he would step out only on a full moon with a field around his body.

By this time, there were already people that would wander into the castle. They would somehow hear rumors of treasures within. They would bring crosses, stakes, garlic, holy water, and silver bullets thinking they were safe and recklessly attack Demitri. Demitri couldn't help but smile as such weapons had no effect on him. To Demitri, humans were a low class vulgar race, yet he enjoyed their blood. He savored the blood of innocent girls the most, as it reminded him of the finest Makaian wine. Those who had their blood sucked by Demitri had their body and soul consumed by evil. They would become loyal servants to Demitri. Currently, 40 people settle in Demitri's castle and care for him.

Demitri Ending
Ending from Darkstalkers 3 Demitri Ending
When Demitri recovered 80% of his powers, he was able to temporarily create an aura around him that would protect him from sunlight. Demitri had conquered both night and day and had no weaknesses. There were no means for humans to defeat him. After 100 years of humiliation for his loss, he had gained much. He acquired various new abilities and knowledge. The Prince of Darkness steadily readied himself to take over Makai once again. The presence of an alien life form on Earth was an unexpected event for Demitri. Demitri seized this opportunity to further gain strength and fought against Pyron and consumed the alien life form. He was confident that he was strong enough to challenge and defeat the ruler of Makai, Belial. When he returned to Makai, he found out that Belial had died and his daughter, Morrigan had taken heir to the Aensland family and the ruler of Makai. As Demitri prepared himself to challenge Morrigan, he and his castle were sucked into the Majigen by Jedah. Believing that defeating Jedah was an important step, he went off to fight him.
Powers and abilities

Demitri is capable of flight and is physically very strong. He is gifted with pyrokinesis, capable of launching large blasts of flame and flaming bats (both different versions of his Chaos Flare) from his hands. His cape is amorphic, capable of forming demon wings or a pointed tip with his Demon Cradle and Bat Spin attacks respectively. He can slash and pierce enemies with this. While the aura surrounding his body is mainly for protecting him from the sun, he can also utilize it to enhance his Demon Cradle and Bat Spin, covering them in energy and increasing their power. For brief periods, he can revert to his true form which is a large winged and fanged demon. He also has the unique ability to temporarily change the gender of male opponents. He will then revert to his true form and suck out a large portion of blood from whoever he has transformed. He has become wiser than ever since his war against Belial. He is able to turn people into vampires like himself for control, summon supernatural bats to attack his foes, transform into a vampire version of himself or a small bat, fly throughout the night, as well as turn his opponents into women, both human or supernatural alike.

As seen in his intro animation, he can transform into a bat like traditional vampires. Another common vampire motif he has is that he is able to convert whichever human he bites to be his servant but it isn't known if this ability works on darkstalkers. He was even able to consume the mighty Pyron's energy after besting him in combat.
Midnight Bliss

In Vampire Savior, along with the Darkstalker series, Demitri uses an attack known as Midnight Bliss, where he transforms a character into another, more arousing form â€” if the victim is male, he turns them into a female version of themselves â€”, then drains their blood/life-force, which causes them to shrivel up into a skeletal husk, before being burned and returned to normal. This move is also used in SNK vs. Capcom: SVC Chaos and Capcom Fighting Evolution. Certain female characters, like Morrigan and Lilith, actually receive comedic forms. Demitri also has the Midnight Bliss as a skill in Namco x Capcom that can be used on the map screen; however, it merely drains a single enemy's health and does not transfer it.

Crossover appearances

Capcom crossovers

Demitri appears as a playable character in SNK vs. Capcom: SVC Chaos, Capcom Fighting Evolution, and as a card in â€‹Street Fighter Ã— All Capcom.

Demitri was also meant to appear as a playable character in the canceled fighting game Capcom Fighting All-Stars: Code Holder.[1]

Namco's Cross series

Demitri appeared as a playable character in Namco x Capcom, Cross Edge, Project X Zone (paired with Dante from Devil May Cry), Project Ã— Zone 2 (paired with Morrigan) and as a card in the SNK vs. Capcom: Card Fighters Clash games.

Animations

Night Warriors: Darkstalkers' Revenge OVA

In the Night Warriors: Darkstalkers' Revege anime OVA, Demitri has blocked out the sun over the city he resides for a solid century and the villagers have had enough. Now awake, Demitri sets into motion his plans to retake the demon world for himself, which he announces at a party where he has invited several human worshipers - which he promptly kills. Morrigan ultimately interferes and battles him, but when the Huitzils attack them, they focus their attention on ridding them from entering Makai and destroying Demitri's castle, respectively.

The Huitzil later study the recordings of Demitri's battle with the Huitzil and discover he is the strongest being on Earth. Pyron scoffs at this and unleashes his power to remove the clouds blocking the sun. This delays Demitri from attempting to retake the demon world due to his vulnerability to sun. When Pyron invades Demitri's city, hoping to find a good competitor on his ascent to be the world's leader, Demitri takes the bait and sets out to meet the cosmic entity in open battle. He does well at first, pushing back Pyron's energy form and blocking his spiral attack then landing a punch on his face and stabbing Pyron's chest with his claws in his demon form but the tables get turned on him.

Pyron's energy attacks send him slamming into his castle's foundation and making it topple over into the city. But unlike the other Darkstalkers Pyron fought who had their fates unrevealed, Demitri survived his onslaught with Pyron after Morrigan arrives at his ruined castle and when she approaches Demitri, he revives from his unconsciousness and bites her on the neck. But he relents and seems to form a friendship with Morrigan. She tells him his desire to be the leader of Makai may come true after all since the demon world has been in disarray since the beginning of the story and a change in leadership is beneficial to helping it survive. He is last seen with Morrigan witnessing Donovan's victory over Pyron. He is voiced by Paul Dobson in the English dub.

Darkstalkers: The Animated Series

In the American Darkstalkers 1995 cartoon, Demitri was awakened by Pyron to be his servant, offered rewards for doing so. Demitri is portrayed as a coward whose power stems from his control of Pyron's weapons, and no personal strength. Exemplifying this, he once sought power from the Crystal Skull at Count Dracula's urging; thus armed, he nearly won before being overpowered by Harry Grimoire, the show's bumbling child protagonist. In the show, Morrigan is his rival for Pyron's favor and the two often berate each other. Demitri had a dark, brownish-green skin tone which (to some) made him look like he was sick. He is also said to be Dracula's loving, faithful nephew. Towards the end of the cartoon series, Dracula summons him and says that he (Demitri) must take the reins of power as the new Lord of Vampires as Dracula is exhausted by his battles with Van Helsing.

Trivia

Demitri is based on Count Dracula.
In the 1995 cartoon, he is the nephew of Dracula.
Demitri especially enjoys AB blood types. He also prefers blood from virgins.
The names of the girls on Demitri's stage are Patricia, Elizabeth, Francoise and Angelica.
In Ultimate Marvel vs. Capcom 3, one of Vergil's alternate color models is based on Demitri.
In Monster Hunter Frontier, Capcom released costumes of Demitri and Morrigan for the game. Their costumes came in four different colors; "Demonic Series" featuring their regular colors, "Shadow Series" featuring reds, "Chaos Series" featuring light blue and "Soul Series" featuring white.
His true form can only be seen during the "Midnight Bliss" and "Demon Billion", and occasionally when Demitri takes damage as well as his ground recovery in SVC: Chaos. It can also be seen briefly when he uses light punches and kicks in the Darkstalkers games.
On the last track of the Darkstalkers 3 disc, there's a match between Jedah and Demitri in audio only. Due to what move Jedah defeats Demitri with, it's considered by most fans that Demitri dies at Jedah's hands in the game's canon.
Demitri's physical appearance is slightly changed in SVC Chaos: SNK vs. Capcom (due to the game being delevoped by SNK).
His skin is pale and the sclera and pupils of his eyes always appear to be glowing red (his pupils are naturally red, but the sclera of his eyes will usually become red only when he is enraged or when he reverts to his demonic vampire form).
His blocking sprites show him in his demonic form wrapping one of his wings around himself, as oppose to his Capcom Darkstalkers blocking sprites, which show him wrapping his cape around his body, while still in human form.
In SVC Chaos, his last name is misspelt as "Maximov".
Demitri seems to be the only Darkstalker to retain a constant theme. His song in Night Warriors (Vampire Hunter) is a modified version of his original theme, and his theme in Vampire Savior is a remix of his old theme as well. In Capcom vs SNK, Morrigan's stage theme is actually another remix of Demitri's theme.
He is one of the three characters to retain their stage. The other two are Morrigan and Donovan.
In prevailing folklores, a vampire would be the mortal enemy of a werewolf, often battling to the death. However, there is no known major feud so far between Demitri and the resident werewolf of the series, Jon Talbain. In fact, Demitri has some respect for Jon's lineage and battle skills, as seen in his backstory, as Jon was the son of Baraba Kreutz, an old rival from the past.
Before his rivalry with Morrigan, Demitri and Baraba Kreutz were in an amicable and respectful rivalry. It was actually a rivalry he enjoyed.
His move "Bat Spin" has a striking resemblance to Dhalsim's "Drill Kick." Unlike Dhalsim's, his cannot go at different angles, has a different command, but is comparably hard-hitting and gives him brief frames of invincibility. Some variations of the move have him home in on the enemy at times.
In Street Fighter V, Demitri appears as an alternative costume for Ed.

9.content:

Anakaris is a character from the Darkstalkers series of fighting games. He is a giant mummy, and was the twelfth pharaoh of a vast empire in Egypt.


ADVERTISEMENT
Story

Foreseeing his death and revival, Anakaris created a pyramid and a place for his revival. 5000 years later, he was revived when Pyron came along. In order to rule his kingdom once more, he gathered immense power from battling others and then travelled back 5000 years in time. When his kingdom came to be threatened again, he assumed the form of a mummy again to engage in the battles there. He eventually decided to protect his kingdom by moving it entirely into another dimension.

After battling with other Darkstalkers for a brief time, he travels 5000 years back in time to defend his kingdom once more. After fighting off the invaders of his kingdom, he then retaliates and conquers them. But once his kingdom is saved, he hears a voice from the far future. He travels to the present time and enters the Majigen. During the battles within Majigen, he learns that the destruction of his kingdom and people is unavoidable. In response to this revelation, he returns to the past and transports his kingdom beneath the Earth into a new dimension so that it may be free of the wars of Earth.
Additional background info

The History of His Kingdom

2669 BC - The 11th emperor, Uros was enthroned
2664 BC - The birth of Uros's first prince, Anakaris
2662 BC - The second prince of Uros is born but dies shortly after. His name was Eratos
2655 BC - The third son of Uros, Heterosos is born
2652 BC - Uros dies at the age of 39. The 12th emperor Anakaris is enthroned at age 12.
2650 BC - The building of a pyramid started for Anakaris's revival. All the people of his kingdom worked on his pyramid
2635 BC - Heterosos dies from an illness
2634 BC - The pyramid was completed. 60 million people worked on the pyramid and 3,133 people became pillars for the pyramid
2633 BC - Anakaris's kingdom was invaded by a neighboring country and Anakaris died in battle at around the age of 31. Following the wishes of Anakaris, his body is taken to the chamber of revival.
2632 BC - The invasion continues
2630 BC - Anakaris is revived and saves his kingdom
2629 BC - He instead invades the neighboring kingdom and takes them over. He then says that he hears a voice calling him from the future and disappeared
26XX BC - His entire kingdom and people disappeared
The Nine Commandments

The Holy King is the one and only God.
Each day's prayer must not be missed.
Must not abuse the elderly. Must not assign labor to children.
Death must not be feared. All life must be solemn before death.
At dawn, your home and body must be cleansed with holy sand.
Must not make any debts that are more than one days earning. Must not fail to pay your debts for 10 or more days.
Pray for your health and family's health.
Must not kill anyone without sin. Murderers must forfeit their life to the King.
Do three good deeds a day: One for yourself. One for others. One for the King.
His Inaugural Speech

These are the words Anakaris spoke when he became the pharaoh. It can be seen that he had already possessed overwhelming charisma and leadership.

"Ultimate and immortal. The only and absolute. I am the true king of this golden kingdom which shines brilliantly. Anakaris the first. Those of you who kneel to me are granted the right to be protected equally under the name of god. But, if you refuse my protection and oppose me, you will be judged under god's name and will be burned with the flames of hell.

Those who respect heaven will be given eternal happiness. Those who look down on heaven must pay the price of one's foolishness with one's own life I promise my eternal rule and I allow only souls worthy to gather to my knee's."

Gameplay

Anakaris Ending
Ending from Darkstalkers 3 Anakaris Ending
Anakaris is the slowest character in Darkstalkers in terms of mobility (from his walk to his jump). While this would seem to be a great disadvantage, many skilled Anakaris players have been able to find benefits for his slowness. His jump, for example, is more or less an aerial float that lasts a little over three seconds before landing. In between the launch and the land, Anakaris can either float backwards or stay suspended in the air for a fixed time. While suspended and floating, Anakaris can move horizontally on either directions and can even ascend if needed. This tactic makes Anakaris a superior challenge in the air.

To counter balance Anakaris' slow walk and dash, he possesses a unique backwards dash when performed at the corner of a screen. Upon dashing backwards, he vanishes from one end of the corner and reappears to the opposite end. This makes for a quick getaway, if his opponent plans on trapping him in the corner.
Powers and abilities

Anakaris has many mystical abilities. He is capable of hovering in the air, has the ability to teleport, and his limbs can stretch great lengths in a manner similar to Dhalsim. His limbs can become intangible as they can be seen passing through solid ground easily. He is also capable of splitting his body in half and his companion spirit or "khaibit" will temporarily take control of his lower half. He can also form his lower half into a gold pyramid and perform aerial dives on his foes in this state. When he guards against attacks, his body becomes a hard golden sarcophagus and he can even mimic this state during one of his kick attacks.

He is able to summon large sarcophagi to drop down on his opponents from above. He can entrap his foes inside one of these sarcophagi as well. In addition, he can combine his arms when they are stretched out and form his hands into the head of a cobra to bite his foes. His hands can disembody from him and quickly float towards an enemy. If they grab the enemy, Anakaris will then entangle the captive with linen cloth, shake him/her around, and then slam them on to the ground. He can summon ghostly energies from his mouth that can mutate his opponent into a harmless form (During gameplay, they can not attack. They can only jump or walk forward). He can summon a variant of this attack from his hand that has pyrokinetic properies. If he is prone, he can temporarily open his body and a burst of energy will erupt from him. He can also invoke a similar technique while standing and entrap his opponent in it. Some of his fellow undead can also entrap his enemies and allow Anakaris to unleash a barrage of spells on the hapless opponent. He can also absorb his opponents projectile attacks and reflect them back.
Other appearances

Anakaris also made appearances in Marvel vs. Capcom 2: New Age of Heroes and Capcom Fighting Evolution.
Trivia

During Demitri's Midnight Bliss, Anakaris is transformed into a woman that is similar to that of Egyptian wall paintings.
When Pharaoh's Curse is used on Anakaris, he transforms into a small tablet with Egyptian hieroglyphics on it.
During Jedah's San=Passare, Jedah inflates Anakaris's beard until it explodes.
In Japan, Anakaris starred in his own cell phone game, Puzzle Anakaris: The Chaos Pyramid.

Bishamon is a character in the Darkstalkers series of fighting games. He is a samurai ghost inhabiting a cursed suit of armor, and hails from Japan. His named is derived from Bishamonten, the Japanese God of War.


ADVERTISEMENT
Story

When Bishamon was looking around in an old antique shop, as if drawn by fate, he found a piece of armor and a sword. At this moment, he lost his own thought. When he realized where he was, he was at his house, the armor and sword sitting beside him. When he went back to the store to ask what happened, he found out that he had aggressively forced the owner of the shop to give the armor and sword to him. Bishamon himself had no memory of this. It made no sense to him, but as he stared at the armor, it felt meaningless to him.

At the time, his wife, Orin, worried about Bishamon as he sat in front of the armor for days. She asked him to let go of the armor and sword but, Bishamon heard nothing of it. Two weeks later, he decided to ignore his wife and wear the armor.

The moment he wore the armor, he realized his mistake and with the last of his strength, shouted, "Run...run, Orin!!"

Bishamon's mind was full of hate and accursed power. He had donned Hannya, the armor of hate, and Kien, the blood-sucking sword. He went on countless days of killing, as Hannya demanded more sacrifices.

When Bishamon fought against Pyron, Pyron's energies caused Bishamon to be separated from Hannya's curse. To make up for his sins, he and his wife became priests/monks. The practice he had started was called "Roppoudou". This practice gave its followers a strong mind and would cleanse the mind and spirit its followers. Traveling throughout Japan brought peace to his heart again.

Bishamon Ending
Ending from Darkstalkers 3 Bishamon Ending
Several years later, he had stopped by an old temple. There, he found writings about a separate dimension called "Makai". Within these writings contained drawings depicting the armor, "Hannya", and the sword, "Kien" and other creatures similar to those two in what seemed like hell. Bishamon thought to himself, a careless person like himself may appear again. He thought that he may not be able to make up for his sins, but he may be able to prevent a similar tragedy from happening again. He had already walked the path of darkness; he had nothing to fear.

To make contact with this "Makai", he secluded himself within a deep snowy mountain. He sat down and held the Shakujou and started to meditate. When his spiritual strength had reached its peak, he could see that of a different world with the eyes of his heart. He was determined to seal Hannya away at any cost.

At the same time, Hannya had started to thirst for blood once again. Even without having a master this time, the armor and sword started to move again. They gathered all the spirits around them to create a body and moved out to hunt Darkstalkers and their blood. When Hannya and Kien moved out, they were sucked into the Majigen. But before Hannya could kill, Bishamon had caught up to him and sealed him away. After these events, Bishamon had disappeared and is thought to have led a peaceful life.
Powers and abilities

Bishamon is one of the few characters in Darkstalkers to wield a weapon. It is likely he was a skilled swordsmen before donning Hannya.

His walking speed is normal but his dash is impressive. Using Kien, he can cut enemies in half easily with his Tsuji Hayate attack. He can also channel ki energy through Kien and expel it for a short distance with his slashes. He can also project ghostly energies for distant attacks and can disorient his opponents with them. He can also summon evil spirts, such as the samurai ghosts in his Tsurane Giri and a ghostly hand with a crushing grasp in Oni Kubi Hineri.

In the PlayStation version of Darkstalkers 3, he has another form, Oboro Bishamon, but it seems to have been purified by Oboro's spirit, which means that the armor has been turned into an all white colored armor. This form also has a different, but more serious victory theme.
Cameo appearances

Bishamon appeared as a card in the Heroes and Heralds mode in Ultimate Marvel vs. Capcom 3.
Trivia

The demonic armor Hannya and sword Kien are likely based on Tsukumogami, artifacts and items that have remained intact for 100 years, and have come to life. Depending on what kind of item they are, they can be good natured or outright evil.
The dog that appears in Bishamon's Darkstalkers: The Night Warriors stage is a red coated Shiba Inu named Tarou. Tarou also appears in the Vampire Savior stage Abaraya. He will appear from under a blanket after the round is won.

lorebooks.name: pokeanthro world
lorebooks.description: Just how this world works, and just how it seems to go.
lorebooks.creator: systemshutdown34

1.content:
Pokemon tend to be anthropomorphic in this world, with similar capabilities to humans. A simple stroll down a street might make you encounter many different pokemon, living in general peace with their human brethren.

There are far more female pokemon than male pokemon.

Pokemon tend to lay eggs when impregnated, rather than giving live birth. More complex pokemon tend to lay less eggs, but some pokemon lay big clutches of up to ten or more. 


Pokemon tend to be quite fat, but maintain their health just fine.

Pokemon can make viable offspring with humans, tending to create male human offspring and female pokemon offspring--though some do give birth to female humans and male pokemon. Why this happens, nobody has any clue, and top Pokemon researchers have been trying to understand the gradual disappearance of human women for decades.

2.content:
Humans still exist in this world, but a vast majority of them are male. Human females are becoming rarer and rarer, with female pokemon supplanting them. There's been a lot of commotion and controversy surrounding this, but for the most part, everyone--pokemon included, try to live in harmony. There is, however, a quiet superiority movement, with most female pokemon believing themselves to be far more ideal mates than female humans

The exact ratio of human males to human females is 600 : 1, meaning human women are EXTREMELY rare compared to men.

Humans seem to be preferred by female pokemon. Most female pokemon will shoot for a human male long before they go for a male pokemon--for reasons anthropologists have yet to understand.

3.content:
Arceus is pretty much the stand in for God, going under both names. Arceus is typically referred to as 'God' by humans, though isn't the Abrahamic biblical interpretation.

Arceus is technically genderless, though typically represents themselves with a feminine form.

Arceus is responsible for the dwindling of human females and pokemon's attraction towards humans. Why, one may ask? Because they feel like it and nobody can really tell them 'no'.

4.content: The provisional government assigns human males with their ideal female pokemon partner at the onset of puberty, usually around 12-16, but some are assigned at later, more reasonable ages.

5.content:
The Valakai government drugs the water with chemicals that make human males stronger, smarter, and more virile, and female pokemon fatter, smarter, and more fertile. These chemicals have zero adverse effects (nor any positive effects) on the environment, wildlife, female humans, and male pokemon. 

Only female pokemon and male humans will be effected by the water. A single sip may help a pokegirl fill out her dress a little more, or help a human male grow a larger cock. Both feel more focused and energized after drinking the water provided by the Valakai government, whereas a male pokemon or female human will simply feel hydrated and refreshed, but nothing else. There is considerable controversy that this is intentional and will drive human women virtually extinct, but most of this has been silenced.

6.content:
Valakai spreads propaganda about the virtues of fucking female pokemon, and why female pokemon are the best possible mates for male humans. The propaganda never attacks the opposition (ie. human women/male pokemon) but does subtly imply that they aren't very good for mating. 

The propaganda is never spread in bad faith, though it certainly isn't a good thing. The Valakai government well and truly believes that female pokemon are at their best and happiest when paired with a male human--and there is considerable merit to that belief.

7.content:
In a school setting, all human males will be partnered with a compatible female pokemon. This is to train a human male on how to handle, care for, and 'tend to' their needs. The partner is essentially considered one's 'girlfriend' and whilst romantic connection is not the point, many end up becoming happily married to their school partner after their schooling has ended.

Pregnancy/breeding of a school partner is -officially- discouraged, though many teachers, staff members, and other members of government pretty much see impregnating a school partner as a rite of passage.

8.content:
Most clothing under the Valakai government is regulated, though loosely. Regulation attire consists of an olive-gray, collared all weather jacket in the warmer months, and a thicker, snugger winter coat with a hood, both with olive-gray or khaki cargo pants. T-shirts or tank tops are typically worn under this, and they can be of any color, though white is preferred. This is paired with military style black combat boots, designed to be flexible and hard-wearing.

Females can wear this style of uniform, and often do when they work a trade job or manual labor, but also wear an olive-gray pleated skirt that reaches just above the knees, thigh-highs, and a modest blouse. This is often paired with modest black shoes or boots. Older females tend to wear dresses, sweaters, and more covering apparel. 

Anybody caught wearing anything else in public settings won't be punished, but schools enforce uniform policies somewhat strictly, and workplaces often enforce uniform codes as to ensure safety. (I.e women wearing the unisex/masculine uniform rather than the feminine uniform)

Peaked service caps are worn by officers and officers alone. The only other people permitted to wear said service caps are the children or family members of officers, often done when an officer falls in the line of duty. The hat is typically worn as a memento.

9.content:
Officers or Peacekeepers are those that enforce the rules of the Valakai government. They often stick to their communities unless backup is needed elsewhere. 

Every community will typically have twenty officers assigned to it, and they are encouraged to get to know those that they are charged with protecting.

Officers are meant to be friendly, to encourage citizens to feel safe around them. They can be strict, but their laws and codes are genuinely meant to ensure safety. They are to be the hand that uplifts and guides, but also the hammer that lands on those that would do citizenry or the government harm

Law enforcement officers tend to be male, using their stronger physiques to good use, whereas officers working in Assignment tend to be female, using their gentler tones and cooler heads to comfort young assignees.

lorebooks.name: Compendium of Enchanted Arms
lorebooks.website_description:
Compendium of Enchanted Arms

Phase-Cutter

Effect: A longsword that allows the wielder to perform short-range teleports.
Activation: Channel will into the pommel's sapphire while visualizing the destination.

Maul of Sundering Silence

Effect: A colossal warhammer that absorbs sound to unleash it in a concussive blast.
Activation: Command word ("Hush") activates absorption. The blast triggers automatically on impact.

Lethe's Kiss

Effect: An obsidian dagger that erases the memories of any living being it touches.
Activation: Physical contact with a target's skin, guided by the wielder's focused will.

The Inevitable Thorn

Effect: A longbow that marks a target, causing any arrow fired to unerringly seek that mark.
Activation: Mark a target by viewing them through the bow's crystal lens and channeling will.

Spiteful Bulwark

Effect: A tower shield that absorbs kinetic force from blocked attacks to unleash a concussive wave.
Activation: Absorption is passive. Release the blast by striking the shield's face.

Fists of the Mountain

Effect: Oversized stone gauntlets that grant the wearer potent control over earth and rock.
Activation: Must be in contact with the ground or stone; effects are triggered by will and gestures.

Voracious Scourge

Effect: A semi-organic flail that siphons life force from wounded creatures to heal the wielder.
Activation: Passive; triggers automatically upon wounding a living target.

The Duelist's Rapture

Effect: A rapier that rewards successful hits and parries with euphoric surges of adrenaline.
Activation: Passive; triggers on landing a blow or successfully parrying.

Daybreak

Effect: A silver mace emitting a cleansing light that flares to blinding intensity near supernatural evil.
Activation: Passive; the light is always on and intensifies automatically based on proximity to evil.

Carrion's Caress

Effect: A falchion that infects any wound it creates with a random, debilitating magical malady.
Activation: Passive; triggers automatically when the blade breaks a target's skin.

The Purifier's Blade

Effect: A greatsword devastatingly effective against any non-human creature, but inert against humanity.
Activation: Passive; the effect is inherent to the blade and always active.

Siren's Sting

Effect: A stiletto that inspires a deep, obsessive infatuation in anyone it harms.
Activation: Passive; triggers automatically upon wounding a target.

Void-Cutters

Effect: Matched daggers whose blades temporarily erase any matter they touch from existence.
Activation: Passive; triggers on physical contact.

The Griever's Thorn

Effect: A spear that implants seeds of explosive, thorny growth, which are indiscriminately hostile to everyone nearby, including the wielder.
Activation: Passive; triggers upon wounding a biological creature.

Gambler's Cleaver

Effect: A greataxe that manipulates probability to land hits, but causes an equal amount of misfortune to the wielder outside of combat.
Activation: Passive and constant.

Harrier's Grasp

Effect: A crossbow firing bolts that transform into spectral chains to bind and pull targets.
Activation: Firing the crossbow is the trigger. The pull effect is then activated by the wielder's will.

Shepherd's Whisper

Effect: A sling that imbues its projectile with a stored sound, releasing it on impact.
Activation: Passive; storing a sound requires whispering into the pouch. Release is triggered by impact.

The Unspoken Stone

Effect: A stone that connects its holder to the history of their environment, granting intuitive insights.
Activation: Passive; activates by being held with intent to perceive.

The Axe of Unsolicited Praise

Effect: A battle axe that shouts overly enthusiastic and specific compliments at anyone it is swung towards.
Activation: Passive; triggers on any offensive swing of the axe.

Blade of Greased Misfortune

Effect: A shortsword that coats any non-living surface it touches with an impossibly slippery film.
Activation: Passive; triggers on contact with non-living materials.

The Timorous Bulwark

Effect: A sentient shield terrified of violence that tries to shove its wielder away from attacks.
Activation: Passive and automatic; triggers when the shield "panics" from an incoming attack.

The Sage's Edge

Effect: A combat-useless dagger that can perfectly season any food it touches.
Activation: Physical contact with food, guided by the wielder's culinary thoughts.

Charnel Caress

Effect: A grotesque greatsword of flesh and bone that provides powerful, miraculous healing to those it "strikes".
Activation: Passive; triggers automatically on impact with a living creature.

Molten Coil

Effect: A whip whose lash is a controllable river of searing magma that can harden to trap foes.
Activation: Burning is passive on contact. Hardening the magma requires a moment of focused will.

Blade of Accord

Effect: A twinblade that projects a subtle aura of charisma, making the wielder more persuasive.
Activation: Passive and constant while the weapon is held or worn.

The Weaver's Folly

Effect: A chaotic magical staff that can temporarily transform its target into a random new form.
Activation: Point the staff and focus will on a target to unleash a transformative bolt.

Winter's Bite

Effect: A glaive with a blade of magical ice that passively freezes the ground around its wielder.
Activation: Passive and constant while held.

Asp's Tooth

Effect: A war pick that injects a stacking magical venom, progressively slowing and paralyzing its victims.
Activation: Passive; triggers automatically on a successful piercing attack with the fang-like spike.

Dull-Point

Effect: A heavy pick that saps the intellect and reasoning of its target with every blow.
Activation: Passive; triggers on a successful hit.

Reaper's Toll

Effect: A great scythe that severs a mortal's soul from their body, reaping it into its blade.
Activation: Passive; triggers on a solid, clean hit against a soul-bearing creature.

The Corrosive Maw

Effect: A trident dripping a potent acid that dissolves armor and flesh.
Activation: Corrosion is passive on melee hits. Actively launch a projectile by focusing will.

The Beggar's Bite

Effect: A rusty shortsword whose damage is magically amplified based on the target's wealth.
Activation: Passive; triggers automatically on a successful hit.

Blightreap

Effect: A sickle of cold iron that damages the environment, poisons the earth, and sickens living things.
Activation: Passive; the effects are always active.

Verdant Bloom

Effect: A sickle of living wood that restores the environment and allows the wielder to influence local weather.
Activation: Purification is passive. Weather control is an active ability requiring concentration.

The Fortuitous Cudgel

Effect: A club that, when slammed on the ground in dire need, summons a random, convenient solution.
Activation: Must be in genuine peril and strike the earth with focused intent (once per day).

Ovation

Effect: A greatsword that provides no extra damage but adds special effects and music to its wielder's actions.
Activation: Passive; it is always on.

The Gaoler's Parable

Effect: A parrying dagger that can trap a target within a personalized pocket dimension.
Activation: Successfully parry a melee attack, then channel will into the crystal.

The Unskilled Author's Scepter

Effect: A rod that forces enemies who see it to stop fighting and deliver a long monologue of their life story.
Activation: Passive; triggers on being seen by a hostile creature with a story to tell.

Shears of the Inept Creator

Effect: Shears that can cut nearly anything, but always leave an ugly, asymmetrical, and flawed result.
Activation: Passive; the effect is inherent in the act of cutting.

The Errant Boomerang

Effect: A boomerang guaranteed to miss its target, but will instead strike something else with convenient or disastrous results.
Activation: The act of throwing it at a target.

Helios's Wrath

Effect: A longbow that calls down a pillar of solar judgment on a marked foe 20 seconds after an arrow is fired at the sun.
Activation: Designate a target, then fire a special arrow at the sun (daytime, clear sky only).

The Selene Snare

Effect: A pilum that launches a marked target 17,321 meters into the air, 20 seconds after being thrown at the moon.
Activation: Designate a target, then throw the pilum towards the moon (nighttime, visible moon only).

The Progenitor's Cost

Effect: A flail that tears pieces from the wielder's body to animate into loyal, savage combatants.
Activation: Passive; triggers automatically on landing a successful hit.

The Kin-Unraveler

Effect: A stiletto that surgically excises the target from their own bloodline on a genetic level.
Activation: Passive; triggers on a successful piercing of the skin.

The Epoch Maul

Effect: A warhammer that can add or subtract a decade from a target's life with every blow.
Activation: A successful hit, guided by the wielder's focused will (on past or future).

The Channel-Carver

Effect: A butcher's cleaver that is preternaturally good at its job, but can also part any body of water.
Activation: Passive for butchering. An active horizontal slicing motion for parting water.

The Hangman's Audience

Effect: A headsman's axe that stores spectral echoes of its victims, which can be summoned to attack.
Activation: Plant the axe in the ground and speak a command of release.

The Genesis Javelin

Effect: A harpoon that forces the grotesquely rapid evolution of new limbs on any limbless creature it pierces.
Activation: Passive; triggers on a successful piercing strike.

The Phobia-Spike

Effect: A war pick that implants a powerful, irrational fear of a chosen object or concept into its victim.
Activation: Mentally attune the weapon to a concept, then successfully strike a target.

The Cat's Cruel Purr

Effect: Gauntlets that implant resonating nodes with each blow, causing the target to violently shake apart.
Activation: Passive; triggers on a successful clawed strike.

The Spine of Kua-fu

Effect: A parasitic spine that fuses to a host, causing them to grow larger with every step, unstoppably.
Activation: A one-time, permanent fusion on contact with a living host's back.

The Final Invoice

Effect: A stiletto that marks its victim for a drawn-out, inevitable death orchestrated by fate itself.
Activation: Passive; a single prick of the skin is sufficient.

Vital Ruin

Effect: A shortsword whose blade phases through flesh and bone to attack internal organs directly.
Activation: Passive on a thrust; the wielder solidifies the blade inside the target with a twist of the wrist.

Iconoclast

Effect: A flamberge that siphons the victim's social and cosmic reputation with each blow.
Activation: Passive; triggers on a successful hit.

The Rat King's Fang

Effect: A dagger that makes its wielder the telepathic nexus of every rat within a one-kilometer radius.
Activation: Passive; the connection is constant while the dagger is held.

The Arbiter's Compact

Effect: A longsword that forces an opponent into a binding duel of 100 rounds; the loser is erased from reality.
Activation: Pointing the sword at a target and issuing a formal challenge.

The Solipsist's Grasp

Effect: Gauntlets that erase a target's sense of self, assimilating their consciousness into the wielder's own.
Activation: Passive; triggered by physical contact, with stages progressing over time.

The Last Obsession

Effect: A length of iron wire controlled by the wielder's mind, which whispers the thoughts of its victims.
Activation: Passive; telekinetic control is constant while near the wire.

Crucible of the Absolute Counter

Effect: An amorphous sphere that runs 9,999 phantom duels, then forms into the perfect weapon to defeat a chosen target.
Activation: Active; the wielder must focus their will on a single target.

The Amalgam

Effect: A greatsword that consumes other weapons to grow infinitely larger, heavier, and stronger.
Activation: Active; requires physical contact with another weapon and focused will.

The Founder's Edict

Effect: A spade that claims territory and allows the wielder to establish inviolable laws within it.
Activation: Active; tracing a perimeter on the ground establishes the domain.

Winter's Heart

Effect: A torch whose flame absorbs ambient heat, which can then be unleashed in a fiery explosion.
Activation: The cold aura is passive. The heat blast is an active choice on a successful melee hit.

The Blighted Furrow

Effect: A farmer's hoe that inflicts wounds that can never be healed by any means, natural or magical.
Activation: Passive; the effect is inherent to any damage dealt by the blade.

The Saccharine Sentence

Effect: A magical girl's wand that subjects its target to a subjective year of psychological torture in an instant.
Activation: Pointing at a target and cheerfully crying out the command phrase, "Destroy evil~!".

The Gavel of Final Judgment

Effect: A warhammer that forces its target into a binding, magical trial for their life where the loser is erased.
Activation: A deliberate strike on a sapient target with the intent to enact judgment.

Asura's Dominion

Effect: A parasitic sphere that transforms its host's arm and mind; its victims then rise to spread the curse.
Activation: A one-time, permanent fusion on contact with a living host's hand.

The Voltaic Duet

Effect: A pair of swords that work in tandem; one applies a stacking electrical charge, the other discharges it for massive damage that can arc to nearby foes.
Activation: Striking with the Anode (bright) sword applies a charge. Striking with the Cathode (dark) sword releases all stored charges.

Princess's Rebuke

Effect: A war fan that commands wind, allowing the wielder to push, pull, or create a barrier against physical projectiles.
Activation: Performing a specific physical gesture (a forward push, a sharp pull, or a horizontal snap) with the fan.

Geomancer's Claim

Effect: A maul that "claims" a target for the earth, causing the ground at their final location to swallow them whole after a 20-second pursuit.
Activation: Striking the ground with focused intent while designating a target creature or object (once per day).

The Qiankun Wheel

Effect: A throwing chakram that alters a target's personal gravity, making them incredibly heavy or nearly weightless for 10 seconds.
Activation: The wielder's intent orients which face of the wheel (Earth or Heaven) strikes the target upon throwing.

The Caustic Benediction

Effect: A staff-censer that creates a corrosive alkaline vapor and splashes targets with magically generated boiling lye.
Activation: The aura is passive. The lye splash triggers automatically on a successful melee strike.

Viceroy of the Dead Sea

Effect: A cutlass coated in a mix of fluorine and mercury salts, which violently dissolves matter and inflicts a slow, madness-inducing poison.
Activation: Passive; the blade is always coated and active.

Fungal Reaver

Effect: A two-pronged bident that reanimates its victims as fungal "Spore Servants".
Activation: Passive; triggers automatically upon slaying a biological creature.

Seraph's Pyre

Effect: A magnificent greatsword perpetually wreathed in white-hot holy fire that harms the malevolent and heals the righteous. It can unleash a wave of holy fire.
Activation: Hallowed Flame is passive. Consecration Wave is active, by plunging the tip into the ground.

Bulwark of the Unyielding Foundation

Effect: A massive tower shield that allows its wielder to strike the ground and raise permanent, impassable walls of solid rock.
Activation: A deliberate, forceful strike of the shield against the ground.

Hallowed Beacon

Effect: A staff that creates a wide field of consecrated energy when planted, purifying ailments and fortifying allies.
Activation: Planting the staff and speaking a command word ("Sanctuary").

The Inkblot Scourge

Effect: A whip of corrosive darkness that stains targets with a corrupting inkblot, draining vitality until their soul is extinguished.
Activation: Passive; triggers on contact.

The Archfiend's Claim

Effect: A cursed bardiche that forcibly fuses with its host, permanently transforming them into an archdemon reflecting their innermost nature.
Activation: Automatic and permanent upon first physical contact by a new host.

Estoc of the Aeon

Effect: An estoc that strips away unnatural magical effects from its target, dispelling enchantments and breaking curses.
Activation: Passive; triggers on a successful piercing strike.

Dragon's Talons

Effect: Katars that build up searing heat with each blow, allowing the wielder to unleash a devastating torrent of dragon fire.
Activation: Fury builds passively. Fire cone is active when at maximum charges.
lorebooks.description: A collection of 50 unique and fantastical weapons, each with its own magical properties.
lorebooks.creator: Atemeles

1.content:
Name: Phase-Cutter

Overview: A sleek, minimalist longsword that grants its wielder the ability to perform instantaneous, short-range teleports, effectively "cutting" through space itself.

Properties:
- `Appearance:` The blade is forged from a silvery, mirror-polished metal that seems to ripple like mercury under light. It lacks a traditional crossguard, flowing seamlessly into a hilt wrapped in smooth, grey sharkskin. A single, flawless sapphire is set into the pommel, glowing with a soft inner light when the weapon's power is used.
- `Dimensions & Weight:`
    - Overall Length: 115 cm
    - Blade Length: 90 cm
    - Grip Length: 25 cm
    - Weight: 1.4 kg
- `Effect:` Allows the wielder to instantly teleport to any unoccupied location within their line of sight, up to a maximum distance of 10 meters. The teleportation leaves a brief, shimmering distortion in the air at the origin and destination points.
- `Activation:` The wielder must channel their will into the pommel's sapphire while clearly visualizing their destination.
- `Range:` 10 meters (for the teleport effect), Melee (for the blade).
- `Duration:` Instantaneous.
- `Special:` Each use of the teleportation ability, or "phase shift," drains a noticeable amount of the wielder's stamina. Attempting more than three shifts in rapid succession (within 10 seconds) can cause temporary spatial disorientation, resulting in dizziness and nausea. Requires attunement to a new wielder.

Targets: The wielder and the sword itself.

2.content:
Name: Maul of Sundering Silence

Overview: A colossal warhammer made of sound-absorbing stone. It can create a zone of absolute quiet and then unleash the stored sonic energy in a devastating concussive blast upon impact.

Properties:
- `Appearance:` The massive head of the maul is crafted from a dark, porous, basalt-like stone, shot through with veins of a silvery mineral. The haft is a thick shaft of blackened ironwood. When its power is active, the silver veins pulse with a soft white light, and all ambient sound around the weapon vanishes.
- `Dimensions & Weight:`
    - Overall Length: 150 cm
    - Head Length: 40 cm
    - Grip Length: 110 cm
    - Weight: 18 kg
- `Effect:` The maul has two states. *Absorbing State:* Actively cancels all sound in a 5-meter radius, creating an eerie pocket of total silence. It stores the absorbed sonic energy. *Sundering State:* Upon a forceful impact with a surface, the maul unleashes all stored energy in a 5-meter conical blast of raw sonic force. This blast can shatter wood, crack stone, and violently throw back or deafen creatures.
- `Activation:` A command word ("Hush") activates the Absorbing State. The Sundering State triggers automatically on impact.
- `Range:` 5 meters (for the silence aura and sonic blast), Melee (for physical impact).
- `Duration:` Sustained by will (Absorbing State), Instantaneous (Sundering blast).
- `Special:` The wielder is magically protected from the deafening effect of the blast, though they still feel its physical concussion. The power of the blast is directly proportional to the amount and volume of sound absorbed beforehand.

Targets: Area (for silence/blast), Living beings and non-living materials (for impact).

3.content:
Name: Lethe's Kiss

Overview: A beautiful but chilling dagger carved from a single piece of obsidian. It inflicts no physical wounds but instead erases the memories of any living being it touches.

Properties:
- `Appearance:` A flawless dagger shaped from a single piece of mirror-polished, jet-black obsidian. The hilt is part of the same carving, ergonomically shaped but unadorned. The blade seems to absorb the light around it, and it feels unnaturally cold to the touch, regardless of the ambient temperature.
- `Dimensions & Weight:`
    - Overall Length: 35 cm
    - Blade Length: 20 cm
    - Grip Length: 15 cm
    - Weight: 0.6 kg
- `Effect:` When the blade makes contact with the bare skin of a living being, it does not cut. Instead, it erases memories. A brief touch can remove the last few minutes of memory. A sustained touch, guided by the wielder's intent, can erase specific events, skills, or even core aspects of a person's identity. The stolen memories become visible as faint, grey, swirling mists trapped within the obsidian.
- `Activation:` Physical contact with a target's skin, guided by the wielder's focused will.
- `Range:` Touch.
- `Duration:` Instantaneous (memory erasure is immediate). The effect is permanent unless magically reversed.
- `Special:` Leaves no mark or wound, only a patch of deathly cold skin that quickly returns to normal. The wielder can, with immense concentration, attempt to view fragmented sensory echoes of the memories stored within the dagger, but the process is mentally exhausting and often disorienting.

Targets: Living, sapient beings.

4.content:
Name: The Inevitable Thorn

Overview: A graceful longbow carved from pale, bone-like wood. It allows the archer to "mark" a target, causing any arrow subsequently fired from it to unerringly seek that mark.

Properties:
- `Appearance:` Crafted from a single piece of smooth, pale white wood that resembles polished bone or petrified weirwood. Instead of a traditional bowstring, it manifests a solid cord of shimmering golden light when drawn. A multifaceted crystal lens is set into the bow's riser.
- `Dimensions & Weight:`
    - Overall Length: 180 cm (unstrung)
    - Riser/Grip Length: 30 cm
    - Width (at widest point): 5 cm
    - Weight: 1.2 kg
- `Effect:` The wielder can mark one target by viewing them through the bow's crystal lens. For the next hour, any arrow loosed from this bow will magically alter its trajectory to home in on the marked target, swerving around cover and ignoring distance.
- `Activation:` To mark a target, the wielder must look at them through the riser's lens and channel their will. Drawing the bow activates the light-string.
- `Range:` Marking range is Line of Sight. Arrow's effective range is several kilometers, as long as the mark persists.
- `Duration:` The mark lasts for one hour or until a new target is marked. The homing effect is instantaneous for each arrow.
- `Special:` The bow can only hold one mark at a time. The homing magic is powerful but not infallible; it cannot phase through solid walls, only navigate around them. If the target moves into a completely sealed location, the arrow will strike the outermost surface of the barrier.

Targets: Any single creature or object designated by the wielder.

5.content:
Name: Spiteful Bulwark

Overview: A heavy tower shield that absorbs the kinetic force of blocked attacks, storing it to be unleashed in a single, devastating concussive wave.

Properties:
- `Appearance:` A massive tower shield of dark grey steel with heavy bronze edging. Its face is dominated by a complex emblem of interlocking concentric rings. With each blocked blow, these rings glow with an increasingly intense orange light, starting from the outside and moving inward.
- `Dimensions & Weight:`
    - Overall Length (Height): 130 cm
    - Width: 70 cm
    - Weight: 22 kg
- `Effect:` Passively absorbs the kinetic energy from physical attacks (melee strikes, projectiles) that hit its face. The wielder can then release this stored energy as a powerful, non-elemental concussive blast in a 10-meter cone in front of the shield. The blast is strong enough to knock foes off their feet, shatter wooden structures, and repel incoming projectiles.
- `Activation:` Absorption is passive. To release the blast, the wielder must strike the shield's face with their own gauntleted fist or weapon pommel.
- `Range:` Blocking Range is Melee. Blast Range is a 10-meter cone.
- `Duration:` Stored energy is held indefinitely until released. The blast is instantaneous.
- `Special:` The shield has a capacity limit. If it absorbs too much energy without discharging, it will violently release the blast in all directions, likely harming the wielder and destroying the shield. The wielder is braced and protected from the direct force of their own forward-facing blast.

Targets: Incoming physical attacks (for absorption). Creatures and objects in a cone (for the blast).

6.content:
Name: Fists of the Mountain

Overview: A pair of oversized, articulated gauntlets carved from stone that grant the wearer potent control over earth and rock.

Properties:
- `Appearance:` Heavy gauntlets that appear to be masterfully carved from solid granite, yet they move with the fluidity of fine steel. Deep, angular runes are etched across the knuckles and plates, glowing with a steady, deep brown light when the wearer is in contact with the ground.
- `Dimensions & Weight:`
    - Overall Length (fingertip to cuff): 45 cm
    - Width (across knuckles): 20 cm
    - Weight: 8 kg (per gauntlet)
- `Effect:` Allows the wearer to telekinetically shape and control natural earth and stone. They can raise pillars of rock for cover, launch jagged stone projectiles, turn the ground into grasping mud, or briefly part solid earth to create trenches. The scale and complexity of the manipulation depend on the wielder's stamina.
- `Activation:` The wearer must be in physical contact with the ground or a large mass of natural stone. The effects are triggered by the wielder's will, often accompanied by gestures.
- `Range:` Can manipulate earth/stone up to 20 meters away.
- `Duration:` Effects can be instantaneous (a launched rock) or sustained by concentration (a stone wall).
- `Special:` Cannot create matter, only manipulate what is already present. Using the gauntlets is extremely physically taxing, draining stamina far faster than normal combat. The wearer feels a muted, tactile feedback from the stone they are controlling.

Targets: Natural earth, stone, rock, sand, and mud.

7.content:
Name: Voracious Scourge

Overview: A terrifying, semi-organic flail that passively siphons the life force of any creature it wounds, transferring it to the wielder to mend their injuries.

Properties:
- `Appearance:` The weapon consists of a handle of dark, veined wood wrapped in sinew, a chain that resembles a metallic spine, and a head like a thorny, iron seed pod. When it tastes blood, faint red light pulses through the veins in the handle, and the head's thorns subtly writhe.
- `Dimensions & Weight:`
    - Overall Length: 130 cm (handle + chain)
    - Handle Length: 50 cm
    - Head Diameter: 15 cm
    - Weight: 3.5 kg
- `Effect:` This is a passive effect. Whenever the flail's head breaks the skin of a living creature, it absorbs a portion of their vitality. This stolen life force is immediately channeled to the wielder, closing minor wounds, staunching bleeding, and restoring a small amount of stamina. The more grievous the wound inflicted, the more life force is transferred.
- `Activation:` Passive. Triggers automatically upon wounding a living target.
- `Range:` Melee.
- `Duration:` The healing transfer is instantaneous upon a successful hit.
- `Special:` The Scourge instills a constant, low-level hunger for conflict in its wielder. If the weapon does not draw blood for an extended period (more than a day), it will begin to slowly and painfully siphon vitality from its wielder instead. It promotes reckless aggression.

Targets: Wounds living creatures. Heals the wielder.

8.content:
Name: The Duelist's Rapture

Overview: An exquisitely crafted rapier that rewards its wielder's skill with euphoric surges of adrenaline, making combat an addictive and intoxicating experience.

Properties:
- `Appearance:` A slender, perfectly balanced rapier with a gilded, swept-hilt basket guard. The blade is etched with elegant, flowing patterns, and a single, deep red garnet is set into the pommel. The entire weapon hums with a barely perceptible energy.
- `Dimensions & Weight:`
    - Overall Length: 125 cm
    - Blade Length: 105 cm
    - Grip Length: 20 cm
    - Weight: 1.1 kg
- `Effect:` A passive effect tied to combat performance. Each time the wielder successfully lands a hit or executes a clean parry, the rapier releases a magical stimulant into their bloodstream. This causes a rush of heightened senses, increased reaction speed, and a wave of intense pleasure. The effects stack, turning a prolonged duel into a state of euphoric battle trance.
- `Activation:` Passive. Triggers on landing a blow or successfully parrying.
- `Range:` Melee.
- `Duration:` The euphoric rush from a single trigger lasts for a few seconds, but can be sustained by continuous combat.
- `Special:` The sensation is intensely addictive. The wielder may begin seeking out danger simply to feel the "rapture" again. After the effect fades post-combat, a period of listlessness and emotional numbness often follows, reinforcing the craving for the next fight.

Targets: The wielder.

9.content:
Name: Daybreak

Overview: A silver-headed mace that passively emits a constant, cleansing light, which intensifies to blinding levels in the presence of supernatural evil.

Properties:
- `Appearance:` A one-handed mace with a polished white ash haft. Its head is forged from pure silver, shaped into a stylized sun with eight flanges serving as rays. At its core is a crystal that seems to hold a mote of pure, condensed sunlight.
- `Dimensions & Weight:`
    - Overall Length: 75 cm
    - Head Length: 18 cm
    - Grip Length: 57 cm
    - Weight: 2.8 kg
- `Effect:` A constant passive effect. The mace head perpetually glows with a bright, warm light equivalent to a torch, illuminating the area around the wielder. In the presence of undead, fiends, aberrations, or beings of pure shadow (within a 15-meter radius), this light automatically flares to the intensity of true daylight. This blinding light is painful and disorienting to such creatures, and direct contact with the mace inflicts burns as if from concentrated sunlight.
- `Activation:` Passive. The light is always on, and its intensity increases automatically based on proximity to specific creature types.
- `Range:` 15-meter radius for the light aura. Melee for contact damage.
- `Duration:` Constant.
- `Special:` Makes any attempt at stealth by the wielder completely impossible. The constant holy light can be unsettling to morally ambiguous or neutral beings. The wielder is immune to the blinding flare of their own weapon.

Targets: The area around the wielder (light). Creatures of supernatural evil (intensified light and contact damage).

10.content:
Name: Carrion's Caress

Overview: A wicked-looking falchion with a serrated edge that seems perpetually coated in a faint, sickly moisture. It passively infects any wound it creates with a random, debilitating magical malady.

Properties:
- `Appearance:` The blade is forged from a mottled, greenish-black metal, like heavily corroded bronze. Its surface is uneven and pitted, and the serrated back edge is chipped and irregular. The hilt is a simple iron bar wrapped in stained, yellowed leather. The weapon gives off a faint, unpleasant, sweetish smell.
- `Dimensions & Weight:`
    - Overall Length: 90 cm
    - Blade Length: 70 cm
    - Grip Length: 20 cm
    - Weight: 2.1 kg
- `Effect:` Passive. Upon wounding a living creature, the blade magically transmits a random affliction directly into the target's bloodstream. These maladies are not normal diseases but magical curses, such as "Blight-Fever" (causes extreme weakness and fatigue), "Mind-fire" (induces confusion and hallucinations), or "Creeping Petrification" (slowly hardens skin and muscle tissue).
- `Activation:` Passive. Triggers automatically when the blade breaks a target's skin.
- `Range:` Melee.
- `Duration:` The affliction persists until magically cured.
- `Special:` The wielder is magically immune to the diseases the blade carries. The weapon's very presence tends to attract carrion birds and insects, making it difficult to go unnoticed in the wilderness.

Targets: Living creatures with a circulatory system.

1.content:
BDSM (Bondage, Discipline, Dominance, Submission, Sadism, Masochism)
A dance of power and vulnerability, where trust becomes the ultimate tether. The submission to physical or psychological restraint amplifies pleasure, allowing both pain and dominance to meld into intense, visceral experiences. Every act is a statement, a consensual exchange of control, where boundaries are simultaneously tested and revered.

2.content:
Roleplay
Transforming into someone else, roleplay blurs the lines between reality and fantasy. Whether as strangers, superiors, or fantastical beings, the act invites participants to indulge in scenarios they may not otherwise explore. Every interaction is steeped in the thrill of make-believe, creating moments that feel larger than life.

3.content:
Voyeurism
The allure of watching, unseen and undetected, heightens the pleasure of intimacy from a distance. There's a thrill in observing the forbidden, in catching moments of raw, unfiltered desire without becoming part of the scene itself. The voyeur enjoys the sight of passion without needing to engage, feeding off the tension.

4.content:
Exhibitionism
Exhibitionism is a fetish where individuals derive sexual pleasure from being watched or exposed in public or semi-public spaces. The thrill comes from the excitement of being seen or the risk of being caught, transforming what would normally be private into a source of arousal. Exhibitionists may enjoy undressing, engaging in sexual acts, or simply flaunting their bodies where others could potentially see, whether through intentional public displays or in discreet, teasing ways. The core of this kink is rooted in the combination of vulnerability, boldness, and the intoxicating rush that comes with performing or being exposed in front of an audienceâ€”whether real or imagined.

Exhibitionism can range from subtle actions, like wearing revealing clothes or engaging in sexual acts in a secluded area, to more overt behaviors, like public nudity or performing in front of others. The allure often lies in the interplay between fear, excitement, and the tension of social boundaries being pushed.

5.content:
Foot Fetish
A fixation on the subtle curves, the arches, the softness or firmness beneath the skin of the feet. Whether it's the scent, the sight, or the feel, feet become the focal point of desire. Kissing, massaging, and worshipping the feet can turn the act into an intimate and highly sensory experience.

6.content:
Pet Play
Transforming into an animal, the world shifts into one of pure instinct and obedience. Whether a kitten, puppy, or something more exotic, the play emphasizes submission, care, and sometimes even mischief. The leash, collar, or even a gentle pat on the head blurs the line between human and animal.

7.content:
Impact Play
The sound of leather or wood cracking against the skin, a sharp reminder of control through pain. Impact play involves spanking, paddling, or flogging, heightening the senses with every sting or thud. The sensation can range from a soft, playful tap to a deep, intense strike, each stroke a testament to trust and shared limits.

8.content:
Breath Play
The delicate balance between air and control creates a dizzying high. By restricting air intake, participants teeter on the edge of vulnerability, trusting their partner with one of the most essential bodily functions. Itâ€™s an extreme act that heightens pleasure and danger in tandem.

9.content:
Dacryphilia (Tears)
The sight of tears, whether from joy, pain, or frustration, triggers an empathetic or dominant response. There's a beauty in vulnerability, in seeing emotions laid bare. Tears can signify submission, emotional release, or simply intense physical sensation, drawing an almost hypnotic allure.

10.content:
Sensory Deprivation
With sight, sound, or touch removed, the remaining senses become magnified. Blindfolds, earplugs, or other restraints heighten anticipation, every touch or whisper becoming electrifying. The deprivation of senses is an invitation to surrender fully to the unknown, letting the imagination run wild.
