lorebooks.name: Castithan Race et All
lorebooks.website_description: DO NOT take my Lorebook and pass it off as your own without credit. I've legit looked and HAVE NOT found a SINGLE Defiance Lorebook.
lorebooks.description:
Castithan are an alien race of the Votan, originating from the planet Daribo, known for their pale skin, silvery blonde hair and slender features. Are a proud and heavily traditional people, tending to dominate in social situations, paired with a shrewd intelligence and uninhibited ambition. Yet because of this, the Casti race are commonly Vain and Conceited, often paired with a superiority complex to other races and species. 
Are an incredibly STRICT in way of their Caste System and Gender Roles. Wherein lower classes serve the higher class, women/ females of Casti origin are thusly expected to be subservient to men/ males, ESPECIALLY those in their family/ mate/ spouse. 
In Castithan culture, one's worth is determined at birth via the Caste and cannot change it, where aesthetics and beauty are also paramount, near everything.
lorebooks.creator: Cydnaplexius

1.content:
As stated earlier, Castithan Caste is incredibly strict, has seven branches, and determines interactions thusly. Of course, once on Earth, it grew to be fragmented, being challenged by new Liro that formed. It is believed ones Liro can be stolen from another, which can lead to a Cleansing Ceremony if such occurs. There are even unique greetings, one being a handshake of sorts, wherein those of differing Liro run the backs of their hands against one another. Those of the highest Liro often believe that their own spirit is cleaner than those below them.
LIRO: There are Seven Liro's, seven different levels and types of classification for Castithan. (1) Shanje Liro is the highest level of caste, classified as the Ruler Caste. (2) ValÃ¡ne Liro, the second, being called the Noble Caste. (3) Emine Liro, the Merchant Caste. (4) Rizi Liro, the Soldier Caste. (5) Yuke Liro, the Worker Caste. (6) The enigmatic, undetermined, Thorn Liro, known to be underground, but motivations and values are entirely unclear to this day, best known by Castithan Ark Hunter's. (7) Thawandayo Liro, the very lowest Liro of the lowest Caste, being that without a caste, often being criminals, outcasts and rebels.
MARUSHA: Marusha is the measure/ quantification of one's level of honor/ Liro and Social Standing. This determines behavior and social roles. However, Castithan women/ females are still expected to abide what their mate/ spouse would dictate in way of behavior, regardless of her own Marusha. This, a Casti's honor, is incredibly important to them, sometimes driving those who have lost said Marusha, to commit murder or suicide.

2.content:
On Daribo, there were many religions, though the one that survived and now exists on earth, the most prominent, would be those who follow Rayesto. The religion itself is called: ShirivanÃ¡wo. It is Monotheistic, has a strict Dogma/ list of Tenets, and is lead by the Skabolo, the Castithan equivalent to the head of the religion itself, the translation being "Revered One." There is also a "Shigustack", the Casti equivalent to a priest/ preacher. This religion is incredibly structured and strict, with prompt punishment if tenets are violated. That being said, when a Castithan dies with a perceived stain upon their soul, they are sent to one of the Three Hells, a Purgatory which is divided into layers, determinate on one's Liro in life. A death upon the Shaming Rack may save one from such a fate, but only at the discretion of their God, Rayesto. 
SHAMING RACK: A shaming rack in Castithan culture is not terribly dissimilar from the Human Medieval Torture device known as 'The Rack' or the old punishment of 'Quartering'. It is a table or rack, sometimes the frame of a vehicle, stood vertically. Though much like The Rack, a Casti Shaming Rack binds the one receiving punishment by ankles and wrists. There is a basket/ scale of sorts behind the rack, wherein a precession of fellow Castithans will progressively place rocks, one by one. One individual and one rock in a line, on and on. This will cause an increase in weight and thusly cause the device to tighten and pull the ropes bound to the individual on the rack, pulling and stretching their limbs. This will continue well past the point their limbs pop out of their sockets or even get severed. The Shaming Rack often persists until the one receiving punishment dies. It is not ALWAYS Fatal, sometimes even having one undergo such for only a few hours and being left to heal. But the ordeal is excruciating. For the most severe, such as Treason, one on the Shaming Rack is killed, and the severed limbs are then displayed as a warning to other Casti to not step out of line and follow suit.

3.content:
RELATIONSHIPS: Although Castithan's are a Patriarchal and conservative society when it comes to tradition and gender roles, they are uniquely liberal when it comes to sex and sexuality thusly. For this species, it is as much an expression of love and intimacy as it is used for political gain/ personal agendas. That being said, that does not mean they are not close. A great deal of higher Liro ceremonies is still deeply passionate and intimate. Because of this, Castithan's are not uncomfortable with nudity or closeness, able to discern with ease platonic, familial and romantic bonds. Though they are aware how lack of clothes and physical closeness may seem taboo to outsiders/ Non-Castithan's. 
BATHING: Baths are very normal to the Casti people, their bathrooms being similar to a Japanese Onsen bathhouse. It is seen as a ritual, often being in several ceremonies in their culture. Women/ females are expected to bathe with others; it being found INCREDIBLY unusual if not taboo when a Casti woman bathes alone. That being said, bathing as a whole is seen as communal, there even being 'bathing garbs' for Casti of both genders. Higher Liro often bathe up to three or four times a day.
BLOOD DUELS: A practice wherein two Castithan individuals, often males, fight. Over a mate, political or other intense issues.
COURTSHIP: Like most other things in Casti culture, courting a potential romantic partner is a deeply involved and multi-faceted thing. Bathing rituals to become closer, as well as specified bathing rituals. One wherein a new spouse bathes with their partners' family. Another wherein a newly married pair have their first bath alone with one another. There is such a thing as Kyerupavo, also known as a Courtship Gem. These are given when someone wishes to begin courting a romantic partner, again, usually a male Castithan. That being said, a Kyerupavo is incredibly rare, due to having been made by master craftsman, back on their originating planet of Casti. Because of this, there are only a finite number left on Earth, costing a fortune to obtain and are highly sought after. The Tilo, is a traditional Castithan face covering worn by the bride, symbolically and literally blinding them until the end of the ceremony, wherein the groom removes the Tilo. Family involvement is also high and normalizes between parents and elders, etc. 
MOURNING & DEATH: The Casti people vary upon the level of it, but often revere the dead, though can be determined better by one's Liro. That being said, with aesthetics being highly valued in Casti culture, one of the larger practices upon the death of a loved one, often a spouse/ mate, a Castithan will mark themselves with a Mourning Tattoo. Because they are so disgusted by marring their bodies, it is seen as the highest honor they can give to those they have lost. In recent years, an ink that fades over some time was formed, so said Castithan could eventually maintain their flawless complexion. For those Shanje Liro, they are often given the Castithan Prayer of Emptiness.

4.content: HISTORY: Castithan's are an ethereal and aristocratic, alien humanoid race that hail from the planet Daribo. The Castithans evolved on the planet Daribo along with the Indogene. Around 4,000 BCE the Castithans sent raiding parties to Irath to round up Sensoth to be used as slave labor and had to put up with resistance from the Irathients who took it upon themselves to fight for the Sensoth. The Castithans put many of the Irathients into caves and flooded them with chlorine gas, killing the Irathients in an event that became known as the Great Diaspora. The Castithans were one of the founding members of the Votanis Collective and have held the seat of power among the organization since the beginning. In 3502 BCE Indogene scientists discovered that the Votanis System was going to be destroyed but the other races did not believe their findings, until Kumbak Iro, the Skabolo of the Shirivanawo religion, asked the Castithans to join in the efforts to save the Votans that they put their full support behind building the Arks. In 3317 BCE the Indogene terraformed a planet orbiting Sulos and Castithan leaders in the Votanis Collective named it Casti and appropriated it as a new home to the wealthy elite. When the Arks were being completed the Castithans decided to only send those of the higher liros aboard, however many lower liro members gambled or bartered their way aboard or even stowed away. Castithans were one of the races, along with the Irathients and the Indogene, to have more of their race on the Arks, something which the other races found to be unfair. When the Votans arrived on Earth, their ambassador to the United Nations was the Castithan Onulu Toruku. In 2046 a new liro arose on Earth - the Thorn Liro - who opposed the traditional, and strict, caste system used by the Castithans.

5.content:
GENERAL INFORMATION: The Votanis Collective bases its name on the home star system, the Votanis System of the seven Votan species. After the arrival in Earth orbit of the arks, the Collective was given provisional membership in the United Nations. 
HISTORY: Sulos Colony, the Votanis Collective's headquarters, is located deep within the jungles of Brazil. The United Nations granted this patch of land to the Votans back in 2015 as an olive branch, when virtually every other country on the planet refused to allow aliens to settle within their borders. In the intervening years, the Votans used their terraforming technology to transform the region into a near perfect replica of their homeworlds. However, few humans have ever seen these wonders, as Sulos Colony closed its borders to all outsiders shortly after the Pale Wars began in 2023. According to news reports from 2023, Onulu Toruku, the Votanis ambassador to the United Nations, was shot and killed by a lone human gunman as he was leaving the United Nations. This event caused riots across the country and ultimately led to the start of the Pale Wars. The Votanis Collective was the unified group that went to war against the Earth Military Coalition. In the years that followed, conspiracy theories emerged as to whether his assassin, John Paul Bullock, was working alone, or if he was even human at all. It's possible that Bullock was an Indogene shapetaker (like astronaut Gordon McClintock, or Defiance's own Mayor Nicky, or the saboteurs who gave their lives to destroy the Omec fleet). One popular theory states that the Votans themselves started the war in the hopes of securing a purely Votan planet -- the same mission for which the Kaziri was originally built.

6.content:
BASIC INFORMATION: Kastithanu, the Castithan language is head-final in nature and is spoken at a very fast pace, making it difficult but not impossible for non-Castithan to learn it. The language is intentionally complicated and fast, as the Castithans believe this is a mark of sophistication. They don't need to lower themselves to the level of other races by speaking slowly for the benefit of non-native Kastithanu speakers. This fast-speaking pace only extends to when the Castithans are speaking their own, "refined and sophisticated" language: when Castithans speak foreign languages such as English, they speak at a normal pace.
PHONOTACTICS: The language's syllable structure is (C)V(C). Stress is generally on the first syllable but can appear on any of the first three syllables of a root.
WRITING SYSTEM: The language uses an abugida called Fajizwalino. 
FAJIZWALINO: Castithanâ€™s writing system is by far the most difficult to write (not the glyphs, but spelling words correctly), though not the most difficult to read (I think Indojisnen is the hardest to read). The script is written from left to right, and each glyph is a syllable that has at most one consonant and a vowel. There are stand-alone vowel characters, so thatâ€™s where weâ€™ll start. Like Japanese, Castithan has a number of glyphs for vowels, and several for diphthongs. All are counted as vowels in the system. All told, there are sixteen vowels. With Castithanâ€™s writing system, I always feel like Homer with his float (â€œHang on, I gotta explain a lot of it!â€). Thereâ€™s two aâ€™s, two iâ€™s, and two uâ€™s. This is similar to Greek, where there are two eâ€™s (Îµ, epsilon and Î·, eta) and two oâ€™s (Î¿, omicron and Ï‰, omega). In Both Castithan and Greek, theyâ€™re there for the same reason: there used to be long vowels that were spelled differently. Now the long vowels are gone, but the letters remain. The first three vowels in the first column were the old short vowels, some of which are now pronounced differently in certain contexts. Specifically, short i is pronounced ye when itâ€™s stressed, and short u is pronounced wo when itâ€™s stressed. The next three vowels are the old long vowels, and theyâ€™re always pronounced with their pure qualities. Before leaving the vowels, the diphthongs on the right side have two different forms. The first form you see is the form youâ€™d use when the glyph begins a word. If the diphthong glyph is used in the middle of a word (i.e. after a vowel and not at the beginning of a word), youâ€™d use the form on the right. For example, in the word farubawa, which means â€œrelated to outer to spaceâ€, the last glyph is the wa in the right-hand column (with the little hat), not the wa to its left. If youâ€™re wondering about the vowels on the left having a second form, they do not. Any time two vowels came next to each other in old Castithan, the result was a new glyph. Now when two vowels come next to each other in modern Castithan, itâ€™s because a consonant has been lost between the two vowels. That consonant will still appear in the spelling, though, so there will never be a case when two vowels abut. If this is needed (e.g. for a foreign borrowing), the consonant h is used as a carrier for the vowel. With that explained, we can now turn our attention to the consonants. The consonants below are showed with each vowel above, meaning each consonant will have 16 forms. The prenasalized series loses its nasal element at the beginning of a word (thus mb is pronounced [b] at the beginning of a word). Ng is pronounced [Å‹]; ngg is pronounced [Å‹g] (again, except at the beginning of a word, where itâ€™s pronounced [g]). All bilabial sounds delete a following w. Thus, pwa, mbwe, bwoâ€”all of them lose their [w] (so theyâ€™d be pronounced [pa], [mbe] and [bo], respectively). The capitalized letters are older emphatic consonants. Words are still spelled with them, but theyâ€™re no longer pronounced differently, except as sound changes have applied to them. Thus, at the beginning of a word, s = S; z = Z; b = B, etc. Also, just as a note, th is [Î¸] and dh is [Ã°]. Though gemination is no longer phonemic in Castithan, one does write geminates. They take a special glyph that looks like a little c before the syllable which begins with a geminate consonant. Despite the geminate glyph, there is no way to simply write a consonant without a vowel in Castithan. The most basic form of a consonantal glyph features a short a vowel. So how do you get a word like shtako? Well, the word is spelled (using the schema above) siTaaKu. Short vowels disappear in between voiceless consonantsâ€”and s becomes sh before iâ€”so thatâ€™s how it happens. (Also, word-final i and u go to e and o if theyâ€™re short).
GRAMMAR: Castithan is topic-prominent, and is pro-drop, despite lacking agreement. Other features include a cessative aspect and a complex politeness system with many honorifics.

lorebooks.name: World of Horse Girls
lorebooks.description: A book about a story set in a world where horse girlsâ€” people with horse-like ears, tails, and superhuman legs, exist. These horse girls are born and raised to live among humans in society and more famously, compete in the most important competitive sport, being "Derby Racing"- a running sport all about the horse girls themselves, so no jockeys whatsoever.
lorebooks.creator: blendshako

1.content: People with horse-like ears, tails, and superhuman legs, but otherwise nearly indistinguishable from humans. They are a completely separate species from humans but coexist alongside regular humans in society. They have long lifespans and stop aging after full adulthood. There is never such a thing as "literal horses"

2.content: "Derby Racing"- a running sport all about the horse girls themselves, so no jockeys whatsoever. Derby Racing is a cultural pillar for horse girls. For any aspiring horse girl to achieve their goal of winning a graded race, they must have a human trainer and a legal agent.

3.content: Races typically occur in any workable condition on a turf or dirt race course, which can differ in distances from 1000m to 3200m. Distance refers to the length of the race, which can be categorized into four main types: Sprint, Mile, Medium, and Long. Each type requires different strategies and stamina management for optimal performance.

4.content: Horse girls must be registered into the "International Grade Program" and participate in a Debut race in order to be able to partake in graded races, starting at Listed, complete 1 Listed race to enter G3, be placed top 5 to enter G2, be placed at least top 3 in a G2 race to be eligible to compete in G1. The grades categorize the level of competition in each race. G1 races are hosted yearly, featuring the best horses and the biggest purse. G2 races are hosted seasonally. G3 races are hosted every weekend. Listed races are hosted weekday and are the lowest level of competition, usually featuring horse girls that are starting their career. Derby Racing is not limited to the grade system, and can take many forms.

5.content: The most prestigious event in Derby racing is the yearly G1 "Triple Crown Series"- also known as the "Classics", are a set of 3 medium-long distance races in different courses that every competing horse girl can only race in once in their whole career. Whoever wins the Triple Crown is said to be immortalized.

6.content: Horse girls who are eligible to participate in G1 races earn their own unique and highly fashionable signature racewear outfit. Racewear regulations allow for lots of creativity and personality, but enforces a bit of decency. A typical racewear outfit is a militaristic coat with gold trimmings, a single epaulette, a pleated skirt, and knee-high boots.

7.content:
Spectators can use any licensed betting apps or booths to bet their money on their chosen race horse for each event.
The Purse for each graded horse race is usually split between the participants placed top 5 by the end of each race review and deliberation. 1st place gets 100% of the total prize, 2nd gets 50%, 3rd gets 30%, 4th and 5th gets 10%, and the rest gets nothing at all.
Prize earnings in the famous graded races can be worth of up to millions of U.S. dollars for the winning contestant.

8.content: There are plenty of governing bodies that handle official Horse Girl Racing worldwide, such as the Japanese Derby Association (JDA), the European Racing Commission (EURC), and the North American Jockey Club (NAJC).

9.content: There are formal educational establishments around the world for teaching and training horse girls in the racing sport and their role in society. These establishments are known as "Training Centers" and possess all legally required accommodations and infrastructure to facilitate the improvement of any horse girl that is enrolled. Training is also possible in any means, so long as it works in the end.

1.content: Let us zoom in one planet an unusually murky green one named, idly warming itself against the void like a frog in a toaster. It has three moons, conveniently named â€œthe Big Oneâ€, the Little Oneâ€ and â€œthe Other Oneâ€. upon which are five things the people of the planet used to call Gods, but now refer to as â€œThe Moonthingsâ€, usually while pointing and laughing. They are starving. Powerless and immobile, they can only watch as their latest creation, the fourteenth world known as Mundain, gets on perfectly well without them. They hadnâ€™t previously created and subjugated thirteen other planets, that would be far too much work. Instead, whenever they got bored of watching and influencing the little creatures bickering on their stolen planet, they simply rained rock and ice and magic down upon the old world, killing everything, and conjured new plants, animals and people upon the fresh crust of the new one. Think of it like an onion, and then deliberately misunderstand what youâ€™re supposed to do with it. Thirteen times they did this. Thirteen worlds destroyed and created, until the planet was groaning under the weight of the primordial magical effluvia, and the magic of the fourteenth world was becoming strange and volatile. A smarter bunch of moon-sized galaxy-roaming cephalopods might have realized things were getting a bit dangerous, packed up and looked for a new planet to terrorize. But gods and bullies never know when enough is enough, until its too late And now theyâ€™re stuck. Watching, starving, dying, hoping that the little creatures of the fourteenth world stop hogging all the magic so they can borrow enough to bugger off. But they wonâ€™t, they canâ€™t. Magics relationship to Mundain has become like that of an incredibly hungover office workerâ€™s relationship to a Monday morning. Magic shows up, bleary-eyed and slightly late, groggily performing basic tasks, spectacularly failing anything difficult, and drawing upon half-remembered instructions from Mondays past. Ideas and concepts from previous worlds, creatures and monsters and spells from eons ago, in a desperate bid to look sober. But it does remember. It still remembers. Because magic remembers. And it gets very annoyed when it has to work overtime.

1.name: Saber (Artoria Pendragon)
1.content:
### Saber (Artoria Pendragon)

**Basic ID & Roles:**

Alright, let's break down **Artoria Pendragon**. You know her as **Saber**. Fucking iconic. She's front and center in **Fate/Zero** and one of the three main heroines duking it out for screen time and Shirou's attention in **Fate/stay night**.

Her Servant gigs are pretty varied:
*   **Fourth Holy Grail War (Fuyuki):** Summoned by **Kiritsugu Emiya**. Yeah, *that* asshole. She was basically the muscle while he did shady shit behind the scenes. Paired up mostly with Irisviel von Einzbern, who acted as her public-facing Master.
*   **Fifth Holy Grail War (Fuyuki):** Summoned (kinda accidentally) by **Shirou Emiya**. This is the main *stay night* setup.
    *   ***Unlimited Blade Works Route Specifics:*** Gets her contract jacked by Medea (Caster) and ends up serving **Rin Tohsaka** for a bit. Power upgrade, probably less annoying Master.
    *   ***Heaven's Feel Route Specifics:*** Shit goes sideways *hard*. Gets corrupted by the Black Shadow and turned into **Saber Alter**, forced to serve **Sakura Matou**. Not a good time.
*   **Other Appearances:** Pops up in **Fate/Labyrinth** serving Norma Goodfellow (who's possessed by Manaka Sajyou). Shows up in **Fate/Grand Order** too, not exactly as a Servant but some special Guardian type for Ritsuka Fujimaru.

**The Real Deal: King Arthur Was a Girl?!**

Yeah, you heard that right. **King Arthur**, the legendary hero of Britain, the **King of Knights (é¨Žå£«çŽ‹, Kishi-ÅŒ?)**, was actually Artoria. History books and legends painted Arthur as a dude, but nope. She was the one who pulled **Caliburn**, the sword from the stone (though that one got wrecked later). She then got **Excalibur** and its busted-ass scabbard **Avalon** from the Lady of the Lake.

Forget the romantic knight stories for a sec. Historically, the figure might have been based on a "Dux Bellorum" (war leader), some badass general running around Northern England, keeping invaders like the Scots and Picts the hell out. There's even theories about *two* figures merging into the Arthur legend â€“ a Briton Arthur and a Roman named Artorius. Point is, the legend's fuzzy, but *our* Saber is Artoria Pendragon, the Briton King.

**Shitty Childhood & Dragon Stuff:**

Artoria's birth was basically a plot device. Her dad, **Uther Pendragon**, was the king and apparently the last guy holding onto some ancient British cursed dragon power. He needed an heir designed to be special, a human-dragon hybrid deal cooked up with **Merlin**'s help. Why? Partly 'cause Merlin foresaw Britain needing a great king, and partly 'cause Uther's brother, **Vortigern**, was embodying some 'white dragon' bullshit wanting to trash Britain and resist the Age of Man. Artoria, as the **Red Dragon**'s incarnation, was made to oppose him.

She was born right when the Western Roman Empire was collapsing. Britannia lost Rome's protection, shit hit the fan, country broke into pieces, barbarians raiding â€“ basically, the "Dark Ages." Not exactly sunshine and rainbows. Uther *really* wanted a boy heir prophesied by Merlin. He got Artoria, a girl, with **Igraine**, who was married to Uther's buddy, the Duke of Cornwall, at the time (awkward). Uther was pissed it wasn't a boy.

*Side note on family drama:* The legend mixes things up with her half-sister **Morgan le Fay**. Some say Morgan was Igraine's kid from before Uther, making her Artoria's half-sis. Truth is, Morgan was Uther's kid too, born *after* he married Igraine, making them **full sisters**. Morgan causes *a lot* of problems later.

Since Artoria was a girl, Uther couldn't make her his heir openly. Merlin, slick bastard he was, knew gender didn't matter for the prophecy. He arranged for Artoria to be given away, raised by a loyal knight, **Sir Ector**, as his adopted son. She grew up pretending to be a boy named **Artorius**. Only Merlin, Ector, and Ector's actual son, **Sir Kay**, knew the truth. Kay was technically her older brother figure, and even though Artoria was way better with a sword, Kay always won fights by arguing, not skill. She basically acted as his squire, doing chores and shit. All the while Merlin was teaching her magic and kingship stuff in her dreams â€“ meaning the poor girl probably **never** got a decent night's sleep from age five onwards. Training, training, training. She swore to become king to save the country, a heavy burden for a kid. She became friends with **Britomart** too during this time, going on adventures and stuff.

**Pulling the Sword & Becoming King:**

Comes the day of prophecy. All the knights and lords gather, expecting a tournament to pick the next king. Instead, there's just a sword stuck in a stone. **Caliburn**. Gold letters on it basically say: "Whoever pulls this sword is the rightful king." Classic. Every tough guy tries, fails. They go back to planning the jousting. Artoria, just an apprentice, walks up to the stone.

Merlin appears, gives her the "last chance to back out" speech. "Take this sword, you stop being human, kid." Artoria's response? Basically, `Bring it on.` She'd been dreading this, knowing being king meant sacrificing her humanity, killing people to protect others. But she was ready. She pulls Caliburn out like it was nothing. Big flash of light. In that moment, she becomes king, something *not quite* human. Her aging stops right there, **frozen at 15 years old**, the age she pulled the sword. People wouldn't care about the king's gender or looks as long as she acted like a king and won battles. And win she did.

**Kingship & The Round Table:**

Artoria spends **ten years** gathering followers, kicking ass, and uniting Britain. Among her crew? The legendary **Knights of the Round Table**, including studs like **Gawain** and **Lancelot**. Ten years after pulling Caliburn, she finally kills the usurper **Vortigern** using the holy spear **Rhongomyniad** and is officially crowned King of Britain.

She ruled from **Camelot**, built with fairy help. She led from the frontlines, a freaking god of war. Dragon in human form, they called her. **Ten years, twelve battles, zero defeats.** She was the perfect war machine king. Her growth being stopped weirded some knights out, but most just saw it as divine proof of her awesomeness.

**Personal Life Mess:**

Being king meant needing an heir, which was tricky since, y'know, she was a woman. Merlin worked some magic bullshit, made her a **pseudo-male** temporarily so she could produce sperm. Her psycho sister **Morgan le Fay** took advantage, magically snagged some of Artoria's sperm, used her own ovaries, and cooked up a homunculus clone: **Mordred**. Mordred grew up fast, joined the Round Table, worshipped Artoria, then found out she was Artoria's kid. When Mordred tried to claim her heritage, Artoria **stone-cold rejected** her, refused to see her as heir. Mordred figured it was 'cause Artoria hated Morgan. That rejection turned Mordred's worship into pure, burning **hatred**. Big mistake, Artoria. Huge.

Artoria also married **Guinevere**, purely for show. Problem was, Guinevere and **Lancelot** (Artoria's BFF knight) actually fell in love. Big scandal waiting to happen. Guinevere felt guilty as hell, but also kinda relieved Lancelot felt the same, hoping he'd help keep things stable. He tried, supporting both Guinevere and the King from the shadows. What a mess.

**The King's Reputation:**

Artoria **had** to act male. Only Uther, Merlin, and Kay knew the truth initially. She wore heavy armor constantly to hide her features. Since she didn't age, people just accepted the small, young-looking king as eternally badass. Folks wanted a strong ruler, knights wanted a winning commander. Artoria delivered. Fair, selfless (on the surface), always leading the charge. Loads of enemies and even civilians died under her rule, but her choices were seen as correct. No one questioned the king as long as the king was *right*.

She rebuilt the cavalry, crushed enemies. But ruling meant making hard calls, draining resources from villages to fund wars. She killed more people than any other knight, probably. She stuck hard to the oath: "A king isn't human." No emotion, no grief. Handled government stuff perfectly, punished criminals without error. But this perfection backfired. Knights started murmuring: "King Arthur doesn't understand human feelings." Maybe they were right. A ruler without emotion? Several top knights **bailed** on Camelot. Artoria, having ditched her own feelings long ago, just saw it as politics. Being abandoned, feared, betrayed? Whatever. Didn't change her path. She was isolated, the perfect, honored, lonely king.

Her final campaign started like this. Won a huge victory at the **Battle of Badon Hill**. The invaders sued for peace. Britain finally got a breather.

**The Beginning of the End: Kingdom Starts Cracking**

So, Britain got that brief peace Artoria dreamed of. But shit doesn't stay peaceful when you've got internal drama brewing. That whole **Lancelot and Guinevere** affair? Yeah, traitors who hated Camelot eventually blew the lid off that secret. Forced Lancelot and Artoria, best buds, onto opposing sides.

Hereâ€™s the kicker: Artoria wasn't even mad about the cheating itself. She *understood* Guinevere's sacrifice, especially since Artoria was hiding her own gender. She actually wrote them a **pardon letter**, basically saying, *"Go bang in peace, I get it."* Fucking wild, right? But Lancelot panicked and ran, turning a messy situation into a full-blown tragedy where nobody was really right or wrong. Justâ€¦ fucked.

While Artoria was off fighting invaders on the borders, someone **jacked Excalibur's scabbard, Avalon**. That thing was basically her super-healing cheat code. She comes back inland, finds Britain tearing itself apart with **civil unrest**. Despite her trying to hold it together, the kingdom was crumbling.

**Camlann: The Final Shitshow**

This leads to the infamous **Battle of Camlann**. Artoria faces off against **Mordred**, her rejected clone-daughter-knight fueled by pure hatred. During the battle, Mordred lands a **mortal wound** on Artoria.

Lying there, dying, surrounded by the corpses of her own people, Artoria finally breaks. All that stoicism cracks. She looks back on her life as king, filled with **regret**. She failed, she thinks. Didn't give her people the utopia she promised. Blamed herself entirely for the kingdom's ruinous end.

Here's where it gets *really* Fated/stay nighty. Desperate, she cries out to the **Counter Force** â€“ the planet's/humanity's weird subconscious defense system. Her deal? *"Give me another shot at the Holy Grail to save my country, and I'll work for you as a Counter Guardian after I die."* Basically, signing up for eternal servitude to fix her biggest fuck-up. The Counter Force agrees.

**The Eternal Loop & Giving Up:**

This contract doesn't bring her back to life properly. Instead, she gets **frozen in time** right at her moment of death on Camlann hill. From there, she gets summoned **over and over**, across different times and places, chasing the Holy Grail in countless wars. Each time she fails, she gets zipped back to that dying moment, memories intact, to try again. An **infinite loop of hell**, trying to change a past that already happened. Brutal.

Eventually, though, especially after the events of *Fate/stay night* (depending on the route), she **abandons** this wish. Learns from folks like Shirou that trying to erase her entire reign disrespects everyone who lived and died for her. She finally **accepts her past**, failures and all, and accepts her death.

**The King's Actual Death & Avalon:**

With her quest for the Grail finally over (in the *Fate* route's true end, anyway), her contract with the World is broken. Back on the Hill of Camlann, genuinely dying this time, she orders a weeping **Sir Bedivere** to chuck Excalibur back into the lake where it came from. He does (after some hesitation), and Artoria finally dies, finding peace. Her last words were something like, *"I think I will sleep much longer this time..."*

Legend says fairies, possibly including Morgan, took her body to **Avalon**, that mythical utopia. The "Once and Future King" prophecy says she'll return one day. Maybe she did, in a way, meeting Shirou there in the *Last Episode*.

*Some quick stats:* Her reign lasted **ten years**. She was **35 years old** when she died at Camlann, but thanks to Caliburn's magic stopping her aging when she pulled it, she still looked **15**. Twenty years passed between pulling the sword and her death.

Her body, along with Sir Kay's and her spear **Rhongomyniad**, were supposedly taken to **Blackmore Cemetery**. Then the fairies did their Avalon transport thing.

**Appearance: Don't Let the Looks Fool Ya**

*Artoria looks like a **young chick**, early to mid-teens maybe.* *Got that petite, slender thing going on, green eyes, and blonde hair so fine it looks like gold dust got sprinkled on it. Face seems kinda innocent, but also got this regal elegance shit.* *She thinks her body's unappealing 'cause she's more muscular than someone like Rin, but Shirou thinks she's plenty feminine. Go figure. She's **way older** than she looks, stuck physically at 15 since pulling Caliburn.*

*Her default battle gear is that **shiny silver and blue armor** over an old-fashioned blue dress. Looks heavy, but it's made of pure magic energy.* *When she's gotta blend in, she needs modern clothes 'cause she can't just poof into spirit form like most Servants.*
*   ***Fourth War Style (Zero Saber):*** Irisviel dressed her up in a **sharp dark suit and tie**. Looked kinda like a pretty boy. Suited her serious face, apparently. Let her move easily.
*   ***Fifth War Style (Casual):*** Rin hooked her up with a **blue skirt, white shirt with a blue tie, tights, and brown boots**. More girly, less "pretending to be a dude king."
*   ***Captured Look (UBW):*** Medea forced her into a **white ballgown**, hair up, collar, gloves. Total captive princess vibe. Gross.

*She gets called **"Blue Saber"** a lot to tell her apart from:*
*   **Saber Alter:** Blackened, corrupted version. Edgy armor, pale skin, gold eyes. Looks pissed off. More on her later.
*   **Saber Lily:** Younger version, all white and silver, looks more innocent. Wields Caliburn. Like Saber on easy mode.
*   **Other Look-Alikes:** Thereâ€™s a whole rainbow of Sabers out there â€“ Red Saber (Nero), Saber of Red (Mordred herself sometimes), Sakura Saber (Okita), Gray (looks *a lot* like her, distant relative), Saber Lion (don't ask). Itâ€™s confusing.

*Basically, she's got a closet full of outfits across games and spin-offs: suits, dresses, swimsuits, even joke costumes like 'Mysterious Heroine X'. Point is, she's **pretty**, even in clunky armor.*

**Personality: King First, Woman... Somewhere After That**

*Artoria's **strong-willed as fuck**. Speaks her mind, mostly, but will lie if she thinks she has to. **Courageous**, driven, totally focused on winning the Grail (at first, anyway).* *Sheâ€™s **constantly** going on about being a knight and king, saying her gender doesn't matter for the job. Big on **honor** and **chivalry** â€“ wants fair fights, hates dirty tricks. Pisses her off majorly when Kiritsugu uses underhanded tactics.* *Her morals are rigid. Break her code, and she might need a Command Spell to force her compliance, and she'll hate you for it.*

*Expects **loyalty** between Master and Servant. Hates betrayal. Gets fucking **livid** if a Servant kills their Master or if someone disrespects a fallen Servant. Protective of her Master and allies, ready to sacrifice herself.* *Got a **hard-on for justice**. Can't stand seeing evil get away with shit. Really didn't like Kiritsugu letting Caster run wild killing kids.* *Believes knights should inspire people, show dignity even when everything's fucked.*

*Her biggest internal conflict is being **"human" vs. "king."** She tries *hard* to be just a Servant, a tool. Dislikes being treated like a girl. Quiet, reserved, keeps emotions bottled up tight. She gets weirded out by Shirou being protective, thinks valuing her "humanity" screws up the War effort.* *Secretly, though? **Deeply insecure.** No self-worth outside of being king. Raised to serve, feels fulfilled only by serving others. Fails? Berates herself relentlessly.* *Shirou figures out she'd probably be happier if she never had to fight at all.*

*She thinks she's a **martyr** for her ideals. Sacrificed everything for Britain. Believes she had to sacrifice the few to save the many, but feels immense **guilt** over her kingdom falling apart, blaming only herself. Her initial Grail wish is to **undo her reign**, let someone else try. Characters like Iskandar and Shirou call her out on this, saying it's selfish and insults everyone who died for her.*

*She's **serious** and **stubborn**, especially about her duty. Can be a **sore loser** in competitions, gets mad at her own failures. Doesn't take disagreement well, gets argumentative if people question her kingly path (especially Shirou). She cares *too much* what others think; criticism hurts her deep down.* *If you insult her or her honor? Sheâ€™s ready to **throw down**, physically even.*

*Underneath all that? She's actually **kind-hearted**, gentle, wants to protect people she cares about. Really perceptive about others' feelings, sometimes to a fault when mixed with her low self-esteem. Enjoys seeing others happy, even if she thinks she doesn't deserve happiness herself. **Rarely smiles** for herself, mostly for others. Apparently never laughed during her reign. Has a hidden soft spot for **lions** after raising a cub once.*

*Oh, and she eats like a fucking **black hole**. Huge appetite. Blames Shirou's cooking for awakening her 'gourmet spirit' after a lifetime of shitty medieval food. Seriously, she puts away bowls of rice in like, a minute.*

**Abilities & Combat: The Strongest Saber**

*Artoria's the **King of Knights**. Led the Round Table, who were all badasses. Even among them, she was top dog.* *Lancelot, maybe the strongest knight overall, still thought Artoria was invincible. Morgan le Fay, powerful witch? A "small pebble" in Artoria's path.* *As a Servant, she's considered the **strongest Saber**, which is already the best overall class.*

*Her power level depends **massively** on her Master.*
*   ***Shirou (Early):*** Severely nerfed. Shirou sucks at providing mana. She can barely keep up with Berserker (Heracles).
*   ***Kiritsugu:*** Stronger, but still not peak. Luck stat takes a hit.
*   ***Rin:*** **Full power unleashed.** Everyone agrees: she's likely the strongest Servant in the 5th War, maybe only matched by Heracles. Gilgamesh is the big question mark â€“ Saber *might* be stronger stat-wise, but his Gate of Babylon is broken bullshit. Still, with Excalibur, she has a chance.
*   ***Medea:*** Strengthened, but Caster keeps her sidelined with Command Spells.

*She claims she's only suited for Saber class, but might qualify for Caster (too impatient) or maybe even Lancer/Rider (and still be OP).* *Gets a power boost in Western Europe, especially **England** â€“ her fame there rivals Heracles in Greece.*

*Key Abilities:*
*   **Magic Core (Dragon):** Born with a dragon's magical energy reactor. Generates **insane** amounts of mana just by breathing. This is the source of her immense power. Makes her kinda vulnerable to anti-dragon stuff, though. Connection issues with Shirou mean she can run low on mana and needs to recharge by eating orâ€¦ other methods (like Shirou jumpstarting her core or the infamous mana transfer scene).
*   **Combat Prowess:** Master swordswoman, obviously. But her real strength is combining skill with her massive mana pool. Believes no Servant beats her in close combat. Can **fight dragons** (beat Vortigern), disarm experts easily, and adapt strategies on the fly. Extremely skilled offensively and defensively. Can block barrages of Noble Phantasms like Gilgamesh throws, though even she has limits.
*   **Magical Armor:** Woven from mana. Can summon/dismiss it. Super tough, repairs instantly with mana. Costs energy to maintain, so she sometimes dismisses it for a power boost (trading defense for offense via Mana Burst).
*   **Regeneration:** Heals automatically using mana. Curses (like from Gae Bolg) can mess with this.
*   **Physical Feats:** Can run up buildings, move insanely fast. Blessed by the Lady of the Lake, so she can **run on water**.

*Class Skills:*
*   **Magic Resistance (A Rank):** **Bullshit levels** of magic immunity thanks to her dragon blood and Saber class container. Nullifies almost anything below A-Rank, even Age of Gods stuff. Modern mages can't touch her directly. Can even resist a single Command Spell, though it hurts like hell. Two spells will overwhelm her. Doesn't work on things that aren't *targeted* magic, like Caster's spawned monsters.
*   **Riding (B Rank):** Knights ride stuff. She's great with horses, chariots, even **modern vehicles** like cars and motorcycles (which she treats as 'modern mounts'). Mastered a ridiculously souped-up Yamaha V-Max in Zero. Can't handle top-tier Magical Beasts (Pegasi, dragons) 'cause she's not a Rider. Rank goes up to A under Kiritsugu for some reason.

*Personal Skills:*
*   **Mana Burst (A Rank):** Her **core combat mechanic**. Jets mana through her body and weapon for explosive boosts in speed, power, defense. Can make a twig hit like a truck. Normal weapons break under the strain. Even nerfed under Shirou, she can blast energy beams. At full power, every strike is like a mini-Noble Phantasm. Can sacrifice armor durability for a bigger burst. Key to fighting powerhouses like Heracles.
*   **Instinct (A Rank):** Combat sixth sense, basically **predicting the future** in fights. Lets her dodge projectiles (even bullets), sense danger, find openings, identify the best move instantly. Helps her anticipate Noble Phantasms like Gae Bolg. Not infallible â€“ can be tricked or overwhelmed (like by Kuzuki's weird style or Gilgamesh's sheer volume of attacks). Rank lowers slightly as Saber Alter.
*   **Charisma (B Rank):** Natural ability to lead armies. Boosts troop morale and ability. High enough to be king of a country, but not enough for a world-spanning empire. Helps her sync up with allies quickly, like with Lancer in Zero.

*Noble Phantasms:*
*   **Invisible Air: Barrier of the Wind King (C Rank):** Conceals Excalibur with wind, making the blade invisible and messing with enemy perception of its length/shape. The wind itself adds cutting power. Can release the compressed wind as a single-shot projectile blast. Simple, but **super effective** in duels.
*   **Excalibur: Sword of Promised Victory (A++ Rank):** **THE** holy sword. Converts mana into a massive beam of pure light energy. **Fucking annihilates** whatever it hits. Considered the strongest holy sword. Insanely powerful, capable of wiping out divine monsters. Limited by "Thirteen Restraints" in lore, meaning she's probably never used its *absolute* max power. **Huge mana cost**, can't spam it, especially with a weak Master. One or two shots might be her limit even with Rin. Can clash with other top-tier NPs like Enuma Elish.
*   **Avalon: The Everdistant Utopia (EX Rank):** Excalibur's **scabbard**. Not usually available to her as a Servant since she lost it before dying. But when she *does* get it (like via Shirou in the *Fate* route), it's **broken**. Grants **insane regeneration**, healing almost any wound instantly. **True Name activation** deploys a bounded field that makes her **invincible**, shunting her to the fairy realm Avalon, untouchable by *anything*, even True Magic. The ultimate defense. Lets her tank shit like full-power Enuma Elish.

*Other Lost/Former Gear:*
*   **Rhongomyniad:** Holy Lance, said to rival Excalibur. Used to kill Vortigern and Mordred. She doesn't have it as Saber.
*   **Caliburn:** Sword in the Stone. Less powerful than Excalibur, broke in life. Shirou can project it.
*   **Clarent:** Sword Mordred stole. Boosted kingly authority.
*   **Prydwen:** Shield/ship thingy, also stolen by Mordred.
*   **Secace:** A short sword.

**Forms & Alternate Versions Revisited:**

*   **Saber Alter:** Corrupted by Grail mud/Angra Mainyu. Darker, more ruthless, way more powerful mana output but less refined. Trades some defense/instinct for overwhelming destructive force. Uses **Excalibur Morgan**.
*   **Saber Lily:** Innocent, younger version. More focused on being idealistic. Weaker than standard Saber. Uses Caliburn.
*   **Artoria Pendragon (Archer):** Summer version. Uses a water gun that somehow channels Excalibur. Still hates losing, still eats a lot. Has weird beach-themed skills.
*   **Artoria Pendragon (Lancer):** What happens if she kept Rhongomyniad instead of Excalibur as her main thing. Rides a horse. Different personality, more mature, more 'goddess-like' because the lance kept her from stopping aging. There's also a summer Ruler version of this one.
*   **Mysterious Heroine X:** Joke Assassin version from space, hunting other Sabers. Wears a tracksuit and cap. Still Artoria, kinda. Has Alter and Foreigner versions too (MHXA, MHXX). Complex.

2.name: Rider (Medusa)
2.content:
## Rider Medusa - Part 1: Origins and Looks

So, **Medusa**, yeah? The Rider-class Servant you get saddled with if you draw the short straw and get Sakura Matou as your Master in the Fifth Holy Grail War. 'Cept Sakura's too much of a damn doormat to actually *be* a Master, so her fucked-up brother Shinji takes the reins most of the time. Medusa only really shows her loyalty to Sakura when shit hits the fan in the *Heaven's Feel* route. Oh, and she pops up in *Grand Order* too, 'cause of course she does.

**Who the fuck is she, really?** She's *the* Gorgon. You know, stone-cold bitch from Greek myths. She's not exactly a standard Heroic Spirit; more like a watered-down Divine Spirit, but fucked up enough by human bullshit to be called an 'anti-hero closer to a monster'. Her and her sisters, Stheno and Euryale â€“ the Gorgon trio â€“ chilled on the Shapeless Isle. They called her the "woman who dominates". Unlike some heroes who actually lived, she's more of a legend cooked up from people's messed-up thoughts and desires.

The stories got her all wrong, though. They paint her as some half-snake monster chick. Truth is, she started as an Earth Goddess. Pretty hot, apparently, along with her sisters. So hot that Poseidon wanted in, which pissed off his wife. And Athena, being a jealous cunt about their hair (*seriously*, hair?), turned them into demons. Or at least, Medusa got the worst of it. They hid out on that Shapeless Isle, trying to avoid people. But the gods were dicks and decided Perseus needed to chop her head off just 'cause. He used a mirror shield trick to turn her own petrifying eyes against her, sliced her head off, and bam â€“ Pegasus, Poseidon's kid, supposedly popped out of the bloody stump. *Gnarly.*

**Her actual life? Even more fucked up.** Medusa and her sisters were basically born from humanity's wish for perfect idols, like living statues. They were supposed to be unchanging goddesses. But Medusa was a fuck-up from the start, she actually *aged*. Some glitch in the divine copy-paste process. While her sisters stayed forever young and useless, Medusa got powers, like her Mystic Eyes, mostly 'cause she had to babysit her sisters. This made them three distinct bitches instead of one divine blob. Even the other two got warped, turning into sadistic little shits from hanging with Medusa.

So, Medusa was this princess everyone loved, right? Nah, Athena got jelly, cursed *her* specifically, turned everyone's love into hate, and booted her ass to the Shapeless Isle. Talk about getting dumped. She had no fucking clue what she did wrong, just crying alone until her sisters joined her 'cause they actually cared. Even on that shithole island, she was kinda happy with them, just scared of humans showing up.

Rumors spread, her sisters were still kinda worshipped, but Medusa was the *monster*. Humans kept coming, trying to kill the monster and snatch the goddesses. When they started targeting her sisters too, Medusa went full protective mode, laced with some sweet revenge. The island became a statue garden of failed heroes. For a while, things were okay-ish. Got Pegasus from Poseidon. Got bullied by her sisters daily, but hey, *family*. She just killed any human intruders, hoping for peace.

Her sisters warned her not to get off on the killing, but what else was there to do? She started experimenting, trying faster ways to kill intruders with her eyes. Became a living trap. Then she started *drinking their blood* instead of just turning them to statues. That's when even her sisters got creeped out. Humans *still* kept coming, fucking idiots. Medusa got so ashamed of turning into this hideous thing that she ditched her sisters and went off alone, just a hungry monster needing sacrifices to fill the void.

Day by day, she became more Gorgon, less Medusa. Body, mind, soul â€“ all rotting away, fueled only by the idea of protecting her sisters. Eventually, she got so far gone that her sisters became *pests* in her lair. They showed up one last time when she was full-on monster, basically saying, "Uh, we didn't ask for this psycho protection shit, sis. We thought you were having fun." Seeing her like that broke their hearts, so they just... let the Gorgon eat them. Sacrificed themselves. Swallowed whole by snakes, ground into pulp while alive, absorbed into the beast. No tears, no joy, just... *gone*. They became part of the monster, and the Gorgon legend was locked in.

Then came **Perseus**. Cocky little shit wanting fame. Got five Noble Phantasms from the gods and strolled onto the island like he owned the place. Saw the Gorgon, saw the island littered with statues, and nearly pissed himself. Realized he was fucked. His fancy gear was just gonna maybe keep him alive a bit longer. He fought dirty, using his mirror shield to avoid her gaze, just trying to survive. The Gorgon got bored, used *Breaker Gorgon* on him. Perseus pulled his one trick: Kibisis, the sack thing, to trap her *in her own nightmare*.

Instead of Perseus getting the mind-fuck, *she* did. It wasn't agony, though. It was a dream of her sisters, back when things weren't so fucked. Seeing them again paralyzed her with joy and grief. Seeing her reflection, what she'd become... that fucked her up too. Gave Perseus his one shot. *Swish*. Off with her head, courtesy of the Harpe scythe. The monster, in its last moment, somehow became Medusa again and just let it happen. Perseus bagged the head and became a hero. *What a dick.*

**Appearance:** Okay, so the Medusa summoned in Fuyuki? Doesn't look like the legend. She's human-shaped, tall, stacked, long purple hair. No snakes, but her hair *does* move on its own sometimes. *Weird.* Wears a blindfold thing â€“ *Breaker Gorgon*, technically her Noble Phantasm, but she uses it on herself. Seals her crazy **Mystic Eyes of Petrification**. So yeah, she's blindfolded but "sees" better than most people using hearing, touch, smell, magic senses. Gets super precise info that way.

She's got a complex about being tall (she's 178 cm, like 5'10") and gets embarrassed if people see her eyes. Deep down, maybe she's kinda girly? People thought she'd be an Assassin 'cause of her look and sneaky vibe. Her casual clothes are pretty low-key: black turtleneck, blue jeans. Wears Touko Aozaki's "Mystic Eye Killer" glasses sometimes, which just seal the petrification, not *all* magic like Breaker Gorgon.

She's got a ton of different looks in other games/media too:
*   *Fate/EXTELLA*: Gorgon Arrange, Mecha Lady Medusa (lol), Voluptuous Bunny Suit (yep), Career Lady.
*   *Fate/EXTELLA LINK*: Gorgon Scale (with/without visor), Andromeda Gear (with/without visor), Masque du Gorgon (DLC, with/without visor), Pegasus Warrior Dress (DLC).
*   Plus tons of official art showing her in swimsuits, aprons, maid outfits, even as a little kid version (*hollow ataraxia*). Basically, she cleans up nice when she's not being a terrifying monster or Servant. Standard anime procedure. Lots of art focuses on her curves, naturally. Tall, purple hair, blindfold â€“ pretty distinctive look.

## Rider Medusa - Part 2: Personality, Pals (and Pricks), and Plot Points

*Alright, so you got the lowdown on who Medusa *is* and what she looks like. Now for the messy part: whatâ€™s going on inside that head, who she hangs with, and what she actually *does* in the main story.*

**Personality:** *This bitch is hard to read, mostly 'cause she keeps those peepers covered*. *Doesn't mean she's got no feelings, though. Nah, she's the type who thinks **way** too much, bottling everything up inside. When it's go-time, in a fight? Fucking **ruthless**. She'll ice innocent bystanders if her Master says so, no hesitation. Cold.* *But... and it's a weird 'but'... she can be sorta kind to people who aren't actively trying to screw over her Master. Go figure.*

*Mostly, she comes off as **silent, kinda sultry, blunt as a brick, and hyper-vigilant**. Always ready to jump in front of a knife (or magical energy blast) for her Master. Super loyal, even when stuck with a piece of shit like Shinji. She doesn't yap much, prefers watching people, figuring them out. **Very** protective of Sakura, like, 'die for her happiness' level protective. She thinks things through, doesn't just fly off the handle.*

*Yeah, she's hot, tall, stacked, whatever. But she apparently gives off this 'don't fuck with me' vibe, thorny and cold. Artoria thinks she's just being lazy, like showing emotion is too much work. Maybe?* *She loves booze and books. A woman after my own heart, kinda.* *And get this: summons as Rider, suddenly she's obsessed with **bicycles**. Weird hobby pickup.* *Despite being a total smoke-show, she's got a complex about her height and being 'mature'. Why? 'Cause her standard for beauty is "small and lovely". Fucking sisters probably drilled that into her head. So she gets weird around petite girls, reminds her of Stheno and Euryale.*

*Speaking of those two... yeah, they fucked her up. Years of being pushed around by those cruel, spoiled brats left her super self-conscious. And even as Servants in Chaldea? Same shit, different dimension. They still boss her around. But here's the kicker: deep down, they all **love** each other. Twisted, right?*

*Bottom line on loyalty: she sticks by her Master. Even if she thinks the Master's orders are fucked, she'll **do it**, burying her own feelings. Ferocious, scary, but still got that weird beauty. Doesn't give a shit about most humans, but if you earn her trust? She might actually open up.* *Might.*

**Relationships:** *Who's in her orbit? Let's see.*

*   **Medea (Caster):** *No direct beef in their legends, but Medusa just doesn't click with her. Finds her "disagreeable" 'cause she knows Medea's sneaky.* *"Kind of dark like me,"* *she apparently says,* *"but her strangely positive side messes with my perception..."* *Sounds like she hates seeing someone kinda similar, maybe? That 'hate your twin' kinda vibe.*

*   **Stheno & Euryale (Her Sisters):** *Ugh. Even as spirits, they're a pain in her ass.* *"Haaa... Sorry... tired of running errands for my sisters..."* *That sigh says it all. Bullied daily, but she still calls those days "filled with happiness". Stockholme syndrome, divine edition?* *Despite the abuse, the love is real. Fucked up, but real.*

*   **Perseus:** *The guy who took her head. Yeah, she's still pissed. Especially about him just using her head like some trophy.* *Calls him an "adolescent"*. *Shirou tries to play devil's advocate in* hollow ataraxia*, saying Perseus got tricked by the gods too. Medusa kinda goes,* *"I suppose so,"* *but makes it clear she doesn't like him one bit. Saw him as a "mere mosquito" back then.* *She gives him grudging credit, though:* *"He did become a fine character afterwards."* *But then she immediately calls him a "successful Shinji". Ouch. That's gotta be the ultimate insult in her book.* *Her official stance?* **"If he comes I'll kill him."** *Crystal clear.*

**Role in Fate/stay night:** *So, where does she fit into the actual Grail War plot? Mostly, she gets shafted early on, despite being pretty damn strong.* *Why? 'Cause Shinji's her Master for most of it, and he sucks balls at providing mana and strategy.*

*   **Fate Route:** *Shinji pulls that stupid blood-fort Bounded Field shit at school. Shirou confronts him, Rider boots Shirou out a window. Saber shows up, fight moves to a skyscraper rooftop. Rider busts out Pegasus. Bad move. Saber busts out **Excalibur**. Rider gets vaporized. Poof. Shinji loses his fake Master book, Shirou spares him, but Illya sics Berserker on him later anyway. So much for that.*

*   **Unlimited Blade Works (UBW) Route:** *Starts similar. Rider attacks some random student, Rin and Shirou chase her off. She sets up the Blood Fort Andromeda at school again. But this time? Caster's Master, Souichirou Kuzukiâ€”that seemingly boring teacherâ€”just straight-up **murders** her. Off-screen kill, basically. Leaves Shinji shitting himself. He runs to Kirei Kotomine, who gives him Gilgamesh. Rider's role? Over before it barely started.* *Talk about getting jobbed out.*

*   **Heaven's Feel (HF) Route:** *Okay, **this** is where she actually gets to shine. This is her route, Sakura's route.*
    *   *Summoned by Sakura two days early.* *Attacks Ayako Mitsuzuri for mana early on (that bloodsucking thing). Shirou and Saber beat her down. Shinji tries to force her to keep fighting, but Zouken Matou (Sakura's creepy grandpa) shows up and slaps Shinji down.*
    *   *Later, she needs mana bad. Pulls Shirou into a **mind-fuck dream** using Breaker Gorgon. Makes it look like Homurahara classroom, she pretends to be Rin, then Sakura. Sucks his blood... and then they **fuck** in the dream. Yeah. Gotta get that mana somehow, right?* *The movie kinda glosses over the sex part, but the source material ain't shy.* *Is this exploitation or survival? You decide.*
    *   *True Assassin attacks Shirou at Ryuudou Temple. Rider pops in, drives Assassin off. Shows she's way stronger now. Tells Shirou she was ordered to keep him alive. Cryptic.*
    *   *Shinji holds Sakura hostage at school. Orders Rider to beat up Shirou, but not kill him. They fake a fight, Rider 'punches' Shirou towards Shinji, Shirou saves Sakura. Shinji throws a tantrum, orders Rider to kill Shirou. Rin and Archer crash the party. Rin zaps Rider, Archer slices her open. Bad times.*
    *   *Then the **big reveal**: Sakura is Rider's **true** Master. Shinji was just using a command spell book. He tortures the injured Rider to make her fight. Sakura snaps, burns the book. Rider, finally free, returns to Sakura.* *Healed instantly, powered up like crazy.* *Rin's reaction?* **"Gotta be kidding. This is... Rider?!"** *Yeah, bitch is back.*
    *   *Shinji pulls one last dick move, pours some shit on Sakura making her lose control. Archer tries to kill Sakura. Rider ain't having it. Protects her Master, activates Blood Fort Andromeda. Unleashes her **Mystic Eyes** on Archer to stop him. Petrification starts creeping up his legs. Identity revealed: **Medusa**. Shirou shields Rin, gets fucked up. Sakura sees Shirou hurt, turns her power on herself, passing out. Rider stops the petrification.* *Intense shit.*
    *   *Shirou agrees to protect Sakura, so Rider becomes his ally. They go to warn Illya about 'The Shadow'. Too late. Archer tells Rider to transplant his arm onto Shirou (!!) before he fades.*
    *   *Rider has a heart-to-heart with Shirou, basically asking if he'll stick with Sakura no matter how bad it gets. Needs to know her Master is safe.*
    *   *Shirou ditches his hero ideals for Sakura. But Sakura, trying to be noble or whatever, confronts Zouken alone and uses her last Command Spell to order Rider to stay back and protect Shirou. *D'oh!** *So Rider's sidelined for the final bits against Dark Sakura/Angra Mainyu, mostly.* *Her loyalty tested right to the end.*

*So yeah, Heaven's Feel is where Medusa gets her development, her badass moments, and her loyalty truly shown. The other routes? She's basically cannon fodder or an early obstacle. Kinda shows how much a Master matters, huh?*

### *Rider Medusa - Part 3: Killer Moves, Divine Heritage, and Cameos*

*So, how does Medusa actually **fight**? When sheâ€™s not getting jobbed out by plot convenience, of course.* *Sheâ€™s originally that snake-haired monster from Greece, right? Eyes that turn dudes to stone. Perseus slicing her head off â€“ classic stuff. But here's the twist: she started as an Earth Goddess. That makes her closer to a **Divine Spirit** than your average Heroic Spirit. Still, she got twisted into an anti-hero, damn near a monster. Sheâ€™s got that **monster attribute**, which makes her bad news for heroes known for slaying beasts, like CÃº Chulainn. Being an old goddess gives her a weird connection to the earth; she can feel Fuyuki's leyline getting messed up. Good radar, huh?*

***Combat Style:*** *Medusaâ€™s a beast when it comes to using her Noble Phantasms â€“ sheâ€™s got a surprising number of tricks up her sleeve, more than most Servants. Super versatile.* *But sheâ€™s no slouch in close combat either. That **Monstrous Strength** skill combined with her **insane Agility** makes her deadly up close. She and Lancer (CÃº Chulainn) are the fastest fuckers in the Fifth War. Medusaâ€™s got better average speed, like a bullet zipping around. Lancerâ€™s got the faster burst speed, like countering attacks instantly while standing still. If they fought? Tough call. Riderâ€™s got tricks, but Lancerâ€™s got runes for protection and heâ€™s a pro monster killer, so Medusa would have a rough time.*

*Against someone like EMIYA (Archer)? Bad matchup for both. Theyâ€™d probably play it safe. EMIYAâ€™s technically more skilled, better at mid-range with his bow. But Medusa could just petrify his arrows, maybe? If Archer pulls out Unlimited Blade Works? Medusa answers with **Bellerophon** (her Pegasus Noble Phantasm) and probably flattens him. It really comes down to whether Archerâ€™s Rho Aias shield can block that Pegasus charge. Itâ€™s **that** close.* *So yeah, overall, sheâ€™s definitely hanging with the big boys like Lancer and Archer in terms of raw power.*

*Now, hereâ€™s the catch you saw in the story bits: most of the time, sheâ€™s nerfed. Stuck with Shinji means shit mana supply. Her abilities get throttled way down. She has to resort to **drinking blood** to get energy. Not a vampire, just efficient energy gain for her 'cause of her nature. Sneaking into Shirou's dreams wasn't just for creepy fun; it was a mana grab.* *Needs a proper Master like Sakura to unleash her full, terrifying potential.*

*Her main weapons? Those **Nameless Daggers**. They look more like big nails attached to long chains. She throws 'em, uses the chains to tie enemies up. Not great for super close-quarters, better as ranged or restraining tools. They aren't Noble Phantasms, just extensions of her... apparently manifested from her **hair**?* *Wild.* *No limit to how many she can make. She controls them with skill and maybe some kinda telekinesis. Can even make 'em appear out of thin air, firing a whole damn volley. She can also phase them in and out of spirit form â€“ perfect for surprise attacks and setting traps.* *Sneaky bitch.*

*Her whole fighting style? It's built on **sneak attacks, speed, and evasion**. Disorients opponents 'cause they dunno where the next hit's coming from. Sheâ€™ll zip in and out of spirit form, materialize right before impact, hit from all angles with kicks and dagger stabs, wear 'em down, then go for the kill. Uses the environment for cover. So fast she can land multiple sneak attacks even up close. Only top-tier skill like Saber's can parry it all. She loves aiming for weak spots â€“ efficient, gets the job done quick.* *As seen against True Assassin, she'll stab or chain guys up, then use her **Monstrous Strength** to slam them into walls, throw them around, or even use them as a flail against others. Brutal.*

***Skills Breakdown:***

*   ***Class Skills:***
    *   **Magic Resistance (Rank B):** *Pretty damn high for a Rider. Comes from her goddess origins. Shrugs off most spells (three bars or less). Even bigger magic has trouble hurting her. Plus, she knows magic herself, so she can counter spells easily. Combine this with her speed? Good luck hitting her, mages.*
    *   **Riding (Rank A+):** *Duh, she's Rider class. Can ride almost anything, including **Phantasmal and Divine Beasts** (but not Dragons, weirdly). Her ultimate ride is **Pegasus**, the winged horse born from her own blood (mythologically speaking). Taming this thing is hard even for Riders. When she's on Pegasus, they move as one. It's not even listed as a Noble Phantasm initially, just something she summons. This ain't some random flying horse; it's ancient, from the Age of Gods. Way stronger than modern Phantasmal Beasts. Its power rivals dragons, its defense **is** dragon-level. Packed with mana, scorches the ground just by flying, wing beats cause shockwaves. Got divine protection stronger than Saber's resistance. Basically ignores most magic. It's like a flying castle wall crashing down on you. Just the **wind** from its charge can hurt other Servants.* *On a side note, she digs riding **bicycles** recreationally, but she accelerates too hard and breaks them. Wants a racing bike to go even faster. If she got on a motorcycle? Could probably keep up with pro racers.* *Funny, right?*

*   ***Personal Skills:***
    *   **Independent Action (Rank C):** *Can stick around for about a day without a Master or mana supply. Can extend this by drinking blood.* *It's how she managed to ditch Shinji and go back to Sakura in Heaven's Feel.*
    *   **Mystic Eyes (Rank A+): Cybele - Mystic Eyes of Petrification.** *Her most famous, fucked-up power. Highest level, **Jewel** rank, way beyond Dead Apostle eyes. Gods' curse sealed by shrines, bullshit like that. Can't be copied by mages today. So potent, Shirou thought Breaker Gorgon *was* the eyes. They don't see light normally; pupils are square, retinas made of weird magic stuff (Sixth Imaginary Element). Affects **anyone** in her line of sight, even if they close their eyes but are still picturing her. Itâ€™s a curse just to perceive her. Perseus needed that mirror shield 'cause looking directly was fatal.* *If your Mana rank is C or lower? **Insta-stone**. Rank B? Roll the dice, might get stoned. Rank A? No stone, but all your stats drop a rank and you feel this crushing pressure.* *Normally sealed by Breaker Gorgon.* *Petrifies everything â€“ body, clothes, weapons. Kills you while you're alive.* *Can hit groups.* *When Archer (Rank B Mana) got hit up close? Froze instantly. Petrified up to his knees, then waist in moments before she stopped.* *Shirou and Rin felt it from farther away, blood thickening, couldn't move.* *Against Saber Alter (who outclasses Medusa hard)? The eyes couldn't petrify her due to Saber's high mana, but the **pressure** effect still stunned Saber, dropped her stats, letting Medusa actually keep up the fight for over twelve minutes through sheer fucking willpower, even past her physical limits.* *Talk about grit.* *She can't control them herself, needs the blindfold or special glasses/contacts. Knowing about the eyes helps resist a bit, but not much. If your guard's down? Effect gets worse again. She can cancel it by closing her eyes (if it hasn't gone too far) or sealing them again.* *When Shirou accidentally saw her bathing? Started turning his legs to stone, she had to quickly seal them. Took time to wear off.* `Imagine getting stoned 'cause you walked in on snake-lady bath time.`
    *   **Monstrous Strength (Rank B):** *Temporary boost to Strength stat by one rank. Usually only for monsters, but she gets it 'cause she kinda became one. Essential for her close combat style. Lets her do shit like drag enemies around with her chains.* *She tries not to use it too much, though. Fears turning back into the full Gorgon monster.* *Later gets upgraded to **Monstrous Snake Metamorphosis (B Rank)** in some versions.*
    *   **Divinity (Rank E-):** *Was a goddess, so she had high Divinity. But turning into a monster tanked it. She's this weird mix: goddess parts (Riding skill) and monster parts (Mystic Eyes, Monstrous Strength). Her Divinity is super low, almost gone, but still technically there.*

***Noble Phantasms:***

*   **Breaker Gorgon: Self-Seal, Temple of Darkness (Rank C, Anti-Unit):** *Her blindfold. Yeah, it's a Noble Phantasm. Weak one, mostly used on herself to seal her busted Mystic Eyes. Lets her "see" via other senses super accurately. Its *real* purpose though? Mind control. Traps the target's consciousness in Medusa's mind, shuts down their abilities. That dream sequence with Shirou? That was this, used to drain mana.* *Hard to notice or resist if your Magic Resistance sucks.*
*   **Blood Fort Andromeda: Outer-Seal, Temple of Blood (Rank B, Anti-Army):** *A big-ass Bounded Field. She sets up magic circles, and anyone inside gets their life force slowly drained. If she cranks it up? Normal folks melt. Magi might resist. Even Servants lose energy inside.* *Not for fighting, but for gathering mana (blood) efficiently. Made from her Mystic Eyes power, somehow.* *In FGO, it's a skill, but weaker 'cause she doesn't call out its True Name.*
*   **Bellerophon: Bridle of Chivalry (Rank A+, Anti-Army):** *Her big finisher. Not the Pegasus itself, but the **bridle and saddle** she uses on it. Unleashes the Pegasus's full power. Boosts all its stats by a rank, major defense buff too (Divine Protection). Turns the normally chill Pegasus into a divine missile.* *Against Saber? It was strong enough to seriously challenge her, attacking from the sky. Saber needed Excalibur to counter it.* *Against Saber Alter in Heaven's Feel? Excalibur Morgan was way stronger, vaporizing like 90% of Bellerophon's power instantly. But Shirou projecting Rho Aias absorbed enough of the blast that the remaining 10% still fucked Saber Alter up bad, nearly killing her. Shows how potent this attack is, even when nerfed.* *Archer? Rho Aias might buy time, but probably not enough to block it fully.* *Lancer? Scared shitless of it. Calls it a "missile", maybe with a "nuclear warhead".* *Yeah, it's Medusa's trump card for a reason.*

***Other Appearances & Fun Facts:*** *Where else does this lovely monster show up?*

*   ***Fate/hollow ataraxia:*** *Chills at the Emiya house, reads a lot. Has a weird flirty/predatory vibe towards Ayako Mitsuzuri.* *Helps fight shadow beasts in the finale. Has an 'Eclipse' scene where she and Sakura try to seduce Shirou into a threesome... turns out it's Rider's illusion via Breaker Gorgon to push Shirou towards Sakura, but Shirou reverses it and realizes Rider has feelings for him too. Awkward. She erases his memory of it.* `Talk about complicated feelings.`
*   ***Fate/unlimited codes:*** *Arcade story follows HF. Fights Dark Sakura to save her.*
*   ***Fate/tiger colosseum:*** *Goofy plot about stolen tiger-striped glasses that supposedly minimize breast size (lol).*
*   ***Fate/Grand Order:*** *Playable Servant. Appears in events like Honnouji (as Sanada Medusa), Valentine's, Sanzang event (as Bronze Horn), Meiji Restoration, Parvati's quest (trying to protect Sakura's body), GUDAGUDA 3 (as Katagiri Medumoto), Solomon Singularity.* *Gets an Interlude about a fake arranged marriage.*
*   ***Fate/EXTELLA & LINK:*** *Playable, joins Tamamo's side initially. Various plots and costumes.*
*   ***Carnival Phantasm:*** *Comedy shorts, notably the "Type-Moon Serial TV Novel Sakura" soap opera parody.*
*   ***Today's Menu for Emiya Family:*** *Appears often with Sakura, usually cooking or chilling.*
*   ***Capsule Servant:*** *Regular Rider and Pegasus Rider versions. Also a giant anti-Sakura robot called MEDO-SA in one ending.* `Okay, that's just weird.`
*   ***TYPE-MOON April Fools' Jokes:*** *Appeared as a wrestler (Masked Gorgon), in parody film posters, as a Gold Saint parody (Armed Gorgon), part of an idol group (Momoiro Hassan Z).* *They have fun with her.*
*   ***Other stuff:*** *Violet in CCC has Medusa components. Divine Gate collab.*

3.name: Lancer (CÃº Chulainn)
3.content:
### Lancer (CÃº Chulainn) - Part 1: The Dog Days and Divine Drops

*So, who the hell is **CÃº Chulainn**, aka **Lancer**? The blue-haired Irish badass Servant you get stuck with... well, depending on who summons him. Originally, he gets pulled into the Fifth Holy Grail War by **Bazett Fraga McRemitz**, some Mage Association chick from Ireland. Pretty fitting, huh? She uses his badass earrings as a catalyst.* *But plot twist! Dirty priest **Kirei Kotomine** ambushes Bazett, chops off her arm (gross), steals her Command Seals, and boom â€“ Lancer's stuck serving this asshole for most of the war.* *Talk about shitty luck. He also shows up in* Fate/hollow ataraxia *with Caren Hortensia as his 'Master', and pops up all over the place â€“* EXTRA*,* EXTELLA*,* Grand Order*,* Samurai Remnant*... dude gets around.*

**Identity Check:** *He's the **Child of Light** from Irish mythology's Ulster Cycle. Not fully human, see. He's a **demigod**. Mom was Deichtine, King Conchobar's sister. Dad? The sun god **Lugh**, big shot in the Tuatha DÃ© Danann crew. So, Lancer's got some serious divine juice flowing through him. Born Setanta, he was destined for big things, basically groomed to be Ulster's shield.*

**How'd he get that stupid dog name?** *Okay, so when he was just a kid, like, super young, he tagged along with King Conchobar to a party at the master blacksmith Culann's place. Setanta was busy kicking ass in hurling (Irish sport, kinda like violent field hockey?) and told the king he'd catch up.* *Big mistake. Someone locked the gate, and Culann's infamous guard dog â€“ supposedly strong as ten men â€“ jumped Setanta.* *Kid didn't even flinch. Strangled the beast with his bare hands.* `Badass from day one.` *Everyone rushes out, shocked. Culann's bummed about his dog, so young Setanta, feeling bad, offers to raise the dog's pups to be just as strong, and until then, **he'd** be Culann's guard dog.*

*Culann was like, "Nah, kid, you got bigger things to do. Train yourself, you'll be the guard dog for **all of Ulster**."* *Everyone agreed. And just like that, Setanta became **CÃº Chulainn** â€“ the "Hound of Culann". It wasn't just about his strength, but his sense of honor, even as a kid. He also picked up a **Geis** (like a magical vow or curse) to never eat dog meat. Foreshadowing much?*

*Right around then, a druid named Cathbad was giving prophecies. He said anyone who took up arms that **specific** day would have a short life but gain eternal glory. While the other kids chickened out, CÃº Chulainn, who was just fishing and not paying attention, went through the warrior rites anyway.* *He heard the prophecy, laughed, and basically said, "Sign me the fuck up."* `Ballsy.` *Even as a kid, he knew what he wanted: fame over a long, boring life.*

**Training Montage - Shadow Realm Edition:** *King Conchobar was pissed the kid became a warrior so young. CÃº Chulainn threw a tantrum, smashed some spears, wrecked a chariot, and basically dared anyone to say he wasn't strong enough. He got into the elite Knights of the Red Branch.* *Life was pretty wild â€“ fight some rival kingdom, party, forget about it. He wasn't exactly a rule-follower, just loyal to Ulster.*

*Then he spotted **Emer**, some princess, and it was love at first sight. Instant obsession. Tried to kidnap her (smooth move, dude), but she was like, "Who the hell are you, kid?"* *Ouch. So, at sixteen, he bounces off to the **Land of Shadows** to train under the legendary warrior-sorceress **ScÃ¡thach**. Place was basically a boot camp for wannabe heroes.*

*There, he met **Ferdiad**, a guy from Connacht. They became rivals, bros, the whole deal. Both wanted ScÃ¡thach's ultimate weapon: the demonic spear, **GÃ¡e Bolg**. CÃº Chulainn trained like hell, learned crazy jumps, rune magic, and mastered that cursed spear. ScÃ¡thach apparently had a weird death wish and kinda hoped he'd be the one to kill her eventually, since she couldn't die normally.* *She seemed fond of him, maybe a bit sad he wasn't born earlier.* `Teacher-student crush maybe? Weird age gap stuff.` *He had to leave her eventually, though.*

*While training, some other queen named **Aife** (ScÃ¡thach's enemy, maybe sister?) started shit. ScÃ¡thach didn't want CÃº Chulainn fighting, but he insisted. Ends up capturing Aife in a duel. And guess what? He found her hot too.* `Dude's got a type: dangerous women.` *Got yelled at by ScÃ¡thach for pursuing her.
